TeM6hybdH2sRIDstsXEHOA.text: Food so-so. Really poor customer service. They were slow, rude and pretty ridiculous. Once you choose for here or to go, you DO NOT get to change your mind. They will "kick you out" if you try. Lumpia tasted frozen.

CrvcJYgj_sCJ5LDb48B88A.text: You know it's good when you always leave there feeling like a stuffed pig, and with a smile on your face because you feel like they didn't charge you enough! Love this place!

SCxTc-0PjvjifDzqougJHA.text: Very delicious. Reasonable prices. My husband and l stopped by randomly and will come back again. He ordered the teriyaki combo plate and I have the spicy chicken combo bowl. Very delicious and nice customer service! You should check it out!

QmeUJTrFThmsE5vKze0row.text: This place is great if you want food poisoning aka diarrhea galore. Food is greasy and unsanitary

2XrhdvzYRuBxy75e7S7fjA.text: Mixed plate was just okay....will definitely come back to try another dish. Should have read the reviews before and tried the spicy Korean chicken.  Next time fa show

HYrma5L-FqahcbK82OTCLQ.text: Best local hawaiian food spot in town IMO. The portions are huge, fast service, delicious food. The meat jun and saimin are my favorite things to get!

A3shtGnQ6OiTYZCk5XY5MA.text: AMAZING food and at such a great price.  Korean Chicken is amazing.  Huge portions at an unbeatable price.  Customer service is great.

UMscO8Say8JK4ZYA5CTRxA.text: Oh how I miss this place...   1. The food is amazing! :)  2. Place is clean  3. The staff are very nice, I believe one can sing . : P  4. Portions are BIG  5. Price is right

gUs1zs5Owi4Rb_eQJimiIw.text: Prices good and portions big... And most important food was Ono! Cheeee! I recommend the garlic chicken plate

0r1E45iM9k9syyn6EvBLQQ.text: OMG!!!!! I love this place seriously. I am amazed at how awesome the food is there. I orignally heard about this place from my co-workers and ever since have been coming here. They have very good food at a very reasonable price. It is the best Hawaiian place in Vegas.I am defiantely going to be coming here a lot. Especially, since my work is in the parking lot. Now I am one happy person! Thanks to everyone I work with!

ROS1PC0D6rLrxW2vCSauxg.text: The best comfort food in the world. Clean and friendly place. I have been dinning here since I left Hawaii and this is the closest you can get to island style. The flavors of the Teriyaki and Mac salad are par with any take out dinner on Oahu, Maui you get the picture. Spam Musubi, Kalua Pork and the Korean Chicken are my favorites. The dish to die for is the Wonton min on a cold rainy day. Get there early cause they sell out.

2wfMyWhdwD_IyWkgjS9AXQ.text: Lot of food for a good price.and it taste great too! I will eat here at least twice a week now.highly recommended

R5Owfp14gUy-qS9lc4Altg.text: Food: The mahi-mahi was well-cooked, and matched perfectly with the tartar sauce. The kahlua pig and cabbage however was oversalted. It was even too salty for my wife, who loves extra salty food.  Service: Friendly, prompt.  Ambience: What you'd expect.

6OTdJD3So-LFy1txx7pCTQ.text: Of all the Hawaiian places I've been to, this one is beyond my favorite. The food is quick, simple, cheap, and fantastic! The portions are a bit obnoxious... they pretty much tell you right off the bat, "the small is large and the large is larger".... the perfect way to describe their portions. If you want to eat well but want to save on $$$, this is one of my top choices. The staff is so friendly and laid back, there is hardly any wait even when they're busy, and you can tell by their overall business during lunch hours that many others agree with this review ;).   I took 2 of my friends from out of state here for lunch today before dropping them off at the airport, and they were actually tempted to order more to go! In fact, the one said it was his favorite meal in Vegas so far after eating on the strip in major casinos all week. It is unlikely for someone to be disappointed with this place unless he/she is not a fan of Korean/Japanese/Polynesian-style food.

fjjbM2yHk4tC3zgJmydV2g.text: I love supporting small business and love the effort they are making here.  So nice to get real friendly service, the girls working the counter and tables were great.  You don't see that so much anymore.  I also loved that you get real plates and silverware, even though everything was so cheap.  My food was great, only complaint was the rice was a bit dry, I prefer mine to be quite sticky.  But that won't stop me from coming back.

4dMy4RRLNNQzqN4bAhtmew.text: Consistent Quality, Gigantic Portions, and always hits home.  Las Vegas seems to be so saturated with "Hawaiian food/BBQ" joints. Being from Hawaii as with my family we were desperate for a taste of home. Ross J's is one of the first Hawaiian restaurants in the Green Valley/Henderson area being around for well over a decade and we've been hooked ever since. They always kept a consistency of amazing tastings foods, huge homestyle portions, and all at a very reasonable price. My favorite is the Chicken Katsu & the Spicy Korean chicken. They also offer some of the best home made chocolate chip & Macadamia nut cookies up by the register(you won't regret taking a bag home). The Staff is always very friendly and again explore the menu they have too many tasty things to list. Not to mention eating here saves me money because I usually don't need food for another day or two if I finish an entire plate. Enjoy!

FNYXDElzs8gv6AdPCWqHKQ.text: MEAT AND RICE! It has become the mantra of our office. When we cant think of anything else it is Ross J's to the tune of at least a few of us from the office a couple of times per week. 5 Minutes door to door from our office, 5 minutes to order 10 minutes to eat giving plenty of time for the 30 minute rice coma you need to get over with a power nap!  Kalua Pig, smokey wet and MMmmMMm good!  Korean spicy chicken bowl - The default of good when the brain is just not available to process the menu  Mochiko Chicken - Best loved special, crispy good on the outside moist tastiness inside, of course with rice what else do you need except maybe a dab of saricha sauce!  Macaroni salad - creamy goodness  Huge portions stupidly cheap, and Fruit punch on the side (recently they got rid of the Grape punch). Clean restaurant, friendly staff, great food, not a bad word to say about the place!

r-lmjRU3yhuaHLww_94LxA.text: This place rocks. Real Hawaiian food, great prices. Definitely be back.  Great service too!

EWydgJqRnfHlaHSDLTuIpQ.text: Oh my gosh!!!!  This place is my favorite Hawaiian restaurant. No other place compares. My absolute favorite dish is the sweet and sour spare ribs. It isn't offered very often. You have to call and see if they are serving. It they aren't, the staff are usually pretty good about finding out when is the next time it will be served. If the Spare ribs aren't on the menu that day, I would go with the Spicy Korean Chicken plate. I could eat that all day!  The food at this restaurant is delicious and the staff is amazing. They always treat you good, especially if you are a regular. They will take care of you.

CHfbUfD1tmYZQFROcE1sIw.text: This place is great! Everything is so good, and the price is absolutely awesome. This place's Katsu Chicken makes L&L's and taste like chicken nuggets. If you're in this part of town, hit it up for lunch or dinner. You won't be disappointed.

kEVW5kmVaPwPfTp4UlpApw.text: The best Hawaiian food and the best prices. The proportions are big and everything is delicious.

jwTKikgNmwJCLbVpQS-jPQ.text: Customer service was great but the food was regular. It seemed on the lighter version in flavor. But the Mac salad had good flavor. They need to update the decor and have a deep clean but other than that it's not a bad place to come to if you want something on the less pricey side.

1egF57TVDKtwVMmOp_nSaQ.text: I have been going to Ross J's Aloha Grill for years, even from when it used to be located across the street on Sunset next to Lee's Discount Liquors...it's always been a comforting piece of home for me, since moving to Las Vegas from the islands...in my opinion, the best local hawaiian style eats in town.  Suffice it to say, I haven't had a bad meal here yet, from the Kalua Pig and cabbage, meat jun, teri beef, teri chicken, roast pork, chicken cutlet w/ gravy, mochiko chicken, spicy Korean chicken, beef stew, and the bentos...it goes on and on, with Ross J's delicious melting pot of home style recipes. But, I have to say that their Chicken Katsu is the best. Always juicy and the breading is perfectly crunchy, add the Katsu sauce and it's magical...instantly takes me back home.  If you're an ex-pat like me (c'mon, Hawaii is it's own country) from the islands you'll get it...Hawaii people perfected the plate lunch, so give it a try... Ross J's Aloha Grill no ka oi!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mochiko chicken, Roast pork smothered with gravy, side Kim - chi and extra mac salad...hui bruddah, iz ono!
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu with sauce and extra mac salad dumped on it...no ka oi!

J3ioBhzRf0W1F025EYyqJQ.text: I've been here several times now and can't say that I'm disappointed. The portions are huge and the food is almost (almost) as good as it is at home.  The spicy Korean chicken is always a winner in my book. I also see myself getting the Aloha bento quite often which comes with teri beef, Korean chicken, a hot dog and mac salad.   One item I did not enjoy was the meat jun. Think thinly sliced beef in an egg batter pancake esque dish. If you're from Hawaii, you know how big of a deal meat jun is and Ross J's just did not fit the bill at all. Since moving to Vegas, I've yet to find a decent spot for meat jun. :( Guess I just have to head on home to get the real thing!  Otherwise, Ross J's is solid. I often call my order in ahead of time because they can get quite busy esp during peak lunch and dinner time. There is lots of parking. There is a gas station and Smith's just a few feet away so plus one for convenience!

YxO3vSK1Df1TAFPqy8hprw.text: Hawaiian comfort food similar to a local drive inn. The portions are generous and the staff is friendly. Usually I order chicken cutlet or chicken katsu and my boyfriend likes his teri burgers, teri chicken, loco moco or meat jun (when it's available). We both agree that this isn't much to rave about, but it's just an okay place.

VhUcWJSiGHijN-XmvasJaA.text: One of the few legit Hawaiian BBQ places in the valley. I must say this place a must if you're in the area...and I WAS. Ross J's has all the original local plate options including Korean Chicken AND Miso Butterfish! oh...my...gawd. My mouth is salivating as I type. Seriously, when's da last time you had ono kine miso butterfish, eh? The grindz here are reasonably priced and never disappointing. They also carry da Hawaiian sun drinks, which go perfectly with your grindz when kaukau. Yes, being in this place and enjoying the foods of back home will bring out the pidgin in just about any local living in the 9th island. The portion sizes are good enough to keep me and my little menehune satisfied for our trip back to the other side of the city. The workers here definitely carry the aloha spirit and the place will remind of you the old school L&L drive ins.  AGAIN, if you are ever in Henderson, make your way to Ross J's and enjoy some ono local food.

SLGCpCj2cocEUHVkxH8f1A.text: Skip this place!  Staff is rude and slow.  Food is average.  They haven't had take out menus forever.  It's nice to call ahead but this place doesn't like that.  Drove over here tonight and got here at 750pm.  Yes it's late and close to the 8pm closing but thought I will still get waited on.  Stood in line for 7 minutes then a girl come out at 757pm and tells me they are closed!  Absolutely a joke when it comes to customer service.  I won't be back and suggest you save yourself the grief from this place!!  Lots of other Hawaiian places in Vegas with better food and way better service!

WyuaMpAKzs7I-ZsLAWfc3g.text: Decided to check this place out since a friend recommended it and it had some pretty good reviews.   Playing it safe, I got the chicken katsu meal (regular size) and a side order of spam musubi. My first impression of the chicken katsu was that it wasn't as flat as other places and it resembled like chunks of chicken. They were either going for that rustic look or they just got tired of pounding chicken. Either way, the chicken was pretty tasty and I loved the super crispy outer shell. I also noticed how they used both white and dark chicken meat which is surprising since I am used to seeing only white meat for katsus, but it was good nonetheless.. The spam musubi was awesome, but my only complaint   was the overwhelming rice proportion to the spam. I was thinking about getting a side order of the macaroni salad, but I'm glad I didn't because it tasted pretty weird to me. Don't get me wrong, I usually love this stuff, but it had this weird plastic taste to it (IDK how else to describe it).   All in all, I'd say this place was decent in terms of the food, but I may come back to try out some of the other stuff. The staff was really nice and I only had to wait about 10-15 minutes for my order. The only downer is how this place is about 15-20 minutes away from where I am. There is an L and L Hawaiian place that is closer to me and I kind of prefer that place because of their delicious macaroni salad and cheap thai tea with boba.  I didn't take a good shot of the food this time, but hopefully you guys can get an idea of what I was talking about!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Regular size chicken katsu meal with a bunch of rice and a container of macaroni salad. Also got a spam musubi!

YgYp9rem690DVDylzQCb4w.text: Once again I'm kind of disappointed at another favorite Hawaiian spot after bringing some coworker. But at least you're food, the non-rice stuff was delicious. My 2nd to last time went like this. We called up and placed an order for a few plates. When we went to pick it up the guy behind the counter got all butt hurt about separating checks and made it out like we were the ones at fault. They don't have a sophisticated ordering system. And what I did I get in return? A plate filled with a lot of rice and a couple of tiny pieces of their teriyaki roast pork. Tell me if you what this yelp.com/biz_photos/ross... not worth what I paid. Their rice to non-rice food ration is pretty disappointing. Who want lots of rice and a little of the good stuff? No other place does that. You not inventing the wheel. 1 scoop rice or maybe 2 tops not half a pot. Your food is good but not that good enough. My last time went better just because no one ordered ahead of time. Yea who orders ahead now days? Ordered the spicy Korean chicken it was good, it is what they are known for, but again I got nothing but rice and a few pieces of chicken. I probably wont make the trip for them anymore but if I'm in the area and feeling like Hawaiian sure why not. Maybe even stop by after a movie or after drinking at the near by businesses. Solid 3.5 star rating. Best in Henderson/Green Valley sure.

Ks0haD8ZFuwxP6WE2JeB4w.text: Excellent Hawaiian food and good prices! I love their Korean spicy chicken and the kalbi ribs. There is a combo platter with chicken, beef and fish that is fantastic. I really haven't had anything there I didn't like. Had saimin noodles today and made the mistake of getting the big bowl - way too much, but it was delicious. The macaroni salad is simple and like that I've had at other Hawaiian joints, but for some reason - I could eat it by the bucket full. They also have lumpia! Anyway - I stop in every once in a while before or after I get my nails done in the same plaza. They have always been nice and consistant.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Saimin noodles

1Z9TGcg6OT3cSxzxJs_a6A.text: It's my first time here. I just decided to try this Hawaiian food restaurant and cannot be happier I did so.  The food is what's great here. This is a cheap and fast food restaurant, don't expect a fancy interior and top notch service, though the employees are super nice and they do bring you the food to the table. You pay at the cashier first and then sit and wait for the food, similar to how it is at Panera Bread.   The food cane fast and it was steaming hot. I got the combination plate with teriyaki steak, chicken & mahi and substituted the macaroni salad with steamed vegetables. You also get plenty of white rice in the plate and some cabbage and they put a scoop of tartar sauce on top of the mahi fish. Everything in this plate was cooked well and tasted amazing.   I also tried their signature Saimin soup. It's a type of Hawaiian style noodle soup with some beef in it and it is delicious.   The food definitely gets 5 stars. I loved it.  My only small complaint is they should have brought me the soup first, and then the combo plate, and I even requested that, but instead I got them in the opposite way and got the combo plate first. Go figure...  But this is not a fancy restaurant so expect some small misunderstandings like that.  Overall I really like this place and will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Teriyaki steak, chicken &amp; mahi combo plate for under $9 !!! Amazing
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Saimin soup

NakiMGEb01FkkCVh7oliCg.text: The food never disappoints, been eating here since they were located across the street but they keep eating worse and worse girls to take orders. The one with greasy black hair, fake lashes and too much make up is the worse. Attitude every day for no reason. Too bad they can't find good order takers. The cooks are the sweetest

Z7NtSLMy1F7S_0de0mBQQw.text: Very disappointed ..... I waited 30 mins for chicken and rice and they forgot my order... The macaroni salad is so bad. It's too sweet. They kept it 95 degrees in there. The only good thing about the place was the fruit punch

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

6LHYmlMUelH-ba7nLaLZ8w.text: I absolutely loved this little place. The food was excellent and the service was good. I had never had the garlic chicken before and it was Devine!  And just a heads up, if you've never had Kahlua Pig...make sure you take advantage of the opportunity to do so here. It's worth it!  I will definitely be back as often as I can :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmmmmmmm, so good!!!!!!

bILdsCLzdtdhJx5VwhdH8g.text: We decided to come here since we thought it was right off the highway. We found out later it is more inland. It is close to the Ethel M chocolate factory just to give you an idea of where it is located.   I ordered the Spicy Korean Chicken which came with white rice and macaroni salad. It is a huge serving that you can split into two to three meals. I ate all of the macaroni though because that doesn't keep well and it was too delicious to stop. Ross J's does a better macaroni than Baby Stacks.   The Spicy Korean Chicken was good but I thought it would be spicy I just felt a tinge of spice from it. I also ordered the green drink which is really sweet. It's like drinking juice from concentrate. If you don't have a super sweet tooth I would advise against it.   It was a good solid meal for a nice price!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. The super sweet green drink
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean Chicken plate

XmWGWl5pzfOuWjI2BX0o4Q.text: Most authentic Hawaiian food in town, best tasting Hawaiian food in town, and the lowest price Hawaiian food in town! Now that's a triple WIN-WIN-WIN!  I've literally eaten every menu item they have, and it has all been very good. The food they make is the closest to the food I grew up eating in Hawaii, and that's probably because the owners actually moved here from Hawaii to open this restaurant!  The portions are quite large, and the prices are lower than any other "Hawaiian" restaurants in town. I had to use quotes because most of those restaurants that call themselves "Hawaiian" are places like L&L which are more like what Taco Bell is to Mexican food.  The service is always great, and the ingredients they use always taste fresh, never old.  I'd recommend this place to everyone AND their moms! In fact, I already have multiple times!

hzDOMvZNcqtoHUr3bnq1PA.text: Chicken katsu, macaroni and spam masubi were delish. The portions are large. Next time my hubby, kid and I will split the full size katsu, each get a spam masubi, and get a side of mixed veggies and macaroni.   Service was great. Lady at the counter was attentive to the fact that we had kids and offered extra plates and water cups before i even thought to ask. Super sweet too.   I did not see any high chairs. It was quite busy so i didn't ask if they had any in back. I wish they had some out front to just grab as needed.

qFrdH4FRc4fUA7g5yPjsxw.text: I moved out of Las Vegas 4 years ago, but literally every time I come back I have to eat at this place. It's so good, without a doubt the best Hawaiian food in Vegas and maybe anywhere. Super affordable and so damn delicious. I'm on the way there now and my mouth is already watering. Ross J's is the truth, ask anyone. The tip is to avoid lunch time, right around noon cause it's packed. Thanks for the dank food guys!

4gntBwzDqQ836cebiSLEbA.text: This was pretty good Hawaiian food, I liked the Korean chicken.  My husband got the teriyaki chicken and he like it a lot.  The owner was super nice to us.  She asked if we lived here and we told her that we were looking. She gave us hints of where we could live, I thought that was pretty nice of her. They had the green river drink that made me think of Hawaii. We would be back if we are I the area. .

44nm8na_X8phVwIdfbMs4w.text: If i can rate a 0 i would! I went in to grab dinner to go.. There was a few people in front of me so i knew i was going to wait maybe 10-15 min..well i was wrong 30 minutes later I finally get my food.. People that ordered after me got there food before me!  The food was TERRIBLE! I ordered Chicken Katsu which was nothing but fried stuff with minimal chicken! The Mac Salad had a very sour/bitter taste to it! I eneded up throwing away my food! I didn't mention anything to my husband about how nasty my food was so I wouldn't kill his appetite! Couple hours later.. I get a text from my husband (which is not a picky eater at all) that it was the nastiest food hes had in a while! Seems like they put together a bunch of leftovers! He was not happy!  Will never go again! And definitely not recommend it to anyone!

n7bDHdfug-mxiI1uhIJqxg.text: Love! As soon as you walk in it smells delicious! The staff was friendly and helpful. I got the spam loco moco (it was my breakfast) and they have the best brown gravy I've tasted from a Hawaiian spot so far. They cooked my eggs perfectly, over easy. My friends food was on point too the Mahi Mahi, Spam Musubi, Mac salad. I will be back when I'm on this side of town.

QqcboqnSUt1Nyod5tu46DQ.text: Excellent in everything. I love this place. Its a bit far from where i live that is why i rated with 4 stars but all is great here.

zTZoiPyUH-eytJmnVPcEkA.text: The size of serving deserves five star but. The taste is just not more that three stars, but I will be back to try other dished as maybe I ordered badly.

P7BH6Eph5MAu2cciFvSDzg.text: I gotta say, this place is by far one of the best Hawaiian food joints in Vegas. Funny how this place is kinda a hole in the wall joint. But usually hole in the wall joints usually the best. I like the fact this place has good prices that comes with great food with pretty decent portion sizes. A place that you could come with a big appetite and leave full and happy. Two of my favorite plates to get here is the Korean chicken plate and the Ross j's special. Both plates are roughly 8 to 9 bucks but man, the portion size is huge!!!!!  Good for two meals or two people! Depending on your appetite of course.  Also I like the fact the cashiers are really nice people. You could also tell from the way they talk and there accents that the people here are definitely from the islands. This is one of the very few places in Vegas where you could get authentic Hawaiian food, good customer service, and if you come here fairly often. You are pretty much treated like family. I love this place.

nspI3SxIyELDtUO4XnFOFA.text: I've been here two times now. First visit was a little bit of a let down.. I remembered trying the mahi mahi plate and it was only ok.   This past weekend brought me, my boyfriend and our friends back to this place. This time I ordered the portuguese sausage fried rice. And it put this place back to my good graces. I still have a little bone to pick on in regards with their portuguese sausage (not flavorful enough to my taste) but overall it was a solid dish.  The bf and our friends each ordered loco moco and they were happily satisfied with their food - not one grain of rice was left behind ;)  I'll try another dish next time i come back here. Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage fried rice

ysT95QaFge6AzL6RNwpn8g.text: Good Hawaiian/Asian food!! And the prices are cheap too!! I got the katsu menehune plate and it was a bid portion!! I'm glad I live near this restaurant!!

H3dOsbSpJSCv0eBDUTSZgw.text: Whenever I come to Vegas I gotta come and get food here. So satisfying!! I love the spicy Korean chicken plate with fried rice. Full of flavor and never disappoints. The staff is also really nice. I'll keep coming back for more!

mHPFQ6At2zSvy7A7gV9fhQ.text: This place is flat out amazing.  Every Item on the menu is great. I love the Spicy Korean chicken the most though. My other favorites would have to be the Fried chicken, chicken katsu, hamburger katsu, and the Kalua pig.  Best Hawaiin food in town.

9dleDJZrVGXFJrYUG2v-Jg.text: Been coming to this Hawaiian joint for years.  Always good food.  Came back after a long hiatus (moved across town) & they haven't missed a beat. Spicey Korean beef bowl os my goto.

gopBecSeEfl5DDzQU1_rcQ.text: This place has some good island food with good portions. I usually get the combo bowl with chicken and beef. I've ordered other items and wasn't disappointed. It's become the default grinds spot when I'm in the area. Too bad they dont serve malasada's though.

vbMVOlYnndSbLN01ha22ow.text: I've gone to this place for lunch a couple of times over the last two years and really liked it. I just never went often. Back in August a friend asked us if we ever went there because we are only a mile away. He said that his family ate there a lot. The very next night we went and for some reason fell in love with it.   We now frequent Ross J's and I realized tonight that I have never written a review. It's funny reading the reviews because it seems as if everyone votes for the Korean Spicy Chicken. That's the only thing I have ever had there and I love it. I have it with the vegetables. You gotta have the veggies. The service is great. The wonderful lady at the counter introduced herself once, but I forgot her name. I'll find out next time. They are not slow, but they do have to prepare the food so there is a little bit of a wait. I think I'll start calling in my order.   I actually asked about some other things on the menu tonight ,but ended up getting the same thing. Next time I'll be adventurous. Bottom line...the food is great and the service is great. I love this place.

9hGm4y1velYROh-1v7idOA.text: Within 1 week, I have been here 3 times already.  I work near the airport on Eastern and was referred here by a student at my job when I shared my thoughts of craving for some "local Hawaii" food.  The parking area was under construction. Not good, if you've got a nice car, but that did not stop me from driving in and parking right in front. The decor of the fake palm tree and wooden tiki statue was a little tacky, but again, did not deter me from ordering :-).  I was glad that they serve breakfast at all hours, and I ordered, to go, the cornbeef hash, eggs over medium and rice.  The cornbeef hash is from the can (tastes like Libby's Cornbeef hash) Some people like fresh cornbeef, but personally, I like the one from the can.  I also got a bag of the almond cookies.  All of which was very good.  They also have Fruit Punch and LIme Punch, which we call "Green River" back home in Hawaii, and they carry the Hawaiian Sun canned juices :-).  My second visit, I dined in. I had the Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl.  Even for a smaller portion, it was still enough to fill me up for lunch.  You order at the counter and they serve you at the table. The chicken is boneless and not too much fat on it, which I like. I prefer really hot spicy, but I would consider this dish on the mild spicy side. I think my favorite part of the dish was the rice in the bottom of the dish that was smothered with the Korean sauce.  Today when I visited there for lunch, I had the small portion of the Tonkatsu.  This dish was also great. Good portion size, the tonkatsu was like a pork loin, so again, hardly any fat and the coating was nice and crispy brown. Each visit, I had excellent, friendly service. I keep forgetting to get their names, but awesome aloha vibes!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Tonkatsu (small order)
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Cornbeef Hash &amp; Eggs

UhNcnhfIkxWlkLBsB350TA.text: The food is good but the service on this particular day had me feeling some type of way.  The cashier took her sweet time coming to take my order. The server, who I noticed had NO trouble carrying two dishes to other patrons all of a sudden needed help carrying two bowls that might have been manageable by using a tray. But the cashier had to help.   When that task was over, things had to be cleaned and receipts written on and rearranged, and finally I could order.  The bright enthusiasm that was used for the other patrons was not spared even a little bit for me. But whatever. I placed my order and went to the waiting area.  At least the server was a little polite when she brought me my order.  I'm not sure what was wrong with me but that attitude was not appreciated. I would rather have been told that they didn't want to serve me than to have had to experience that. Message recieved either way.

dOamR9yVkJf1x4_Ib8nvqg.text: This was my first time here, so my review may change when I return (something I plan to do!).  I went on a Friday night at dinner time. It wasn't super busy and the service was friendly and quick. I ordered the Hawai'ian Plate and Diet Coke and the Mrs. had the same.  The Kalua Pork was the best part of the dish. I'd give this a 5/5 on the awesometown-o-meter of flavor. It was succulent and flavorful, something I long for in pork. If you are looking for properly cooked pig meat, come here.  The white sticky rice and mac salad were very good as well. The only gripes I have were that the salmon...basically didn't exist and that the laulau was just "meh."  I'll head back for the katsu and kalua pork!

rSuQ9HNzPrYCKEway5KigQ.text: Stopped by for a lunch break while visiting for a meeting.  Have to say it was outstanding top to bottom.  Great service and even better food.

40t0EIWajN4lmOLrvIyasw.text: Ross J's is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! I used to work nearby and would go to Ross J's at least 3 times a week for lunch. I don't think I have ever had anything that wasn't amazing, my favorites are probably the spicy Korean chicken and Kalua pig. The foods always good, the people are always friendly and you can't beat the prices. If you haven't been the you're missing out.

xG7hBlWrHECl3h3nM30JAg.text: Spicy chicken! It's so tasty that this is the only thing I've ordered the 3 times I've been here. When I finally try something else I might have enough data to consider giving 5 stars. Any place in Henderson that always has a line is a good thing. Great service too, super nice peeps. Btw did I mention spicy chicken? Spicy Korean chicken to be exact.

XltfMeqU4IVzcmUN6py7yA.text: First time coming here and I am in love! Always wanted to try Hawaiian food and this is it! Very welcoming and warming! I love it, come here to try some good food!

jyyYbVJ8bfR1znDBbUekqw.text: Great place. The locals that own the place and especially the main cashier auntie always takes care of my ohana. Fast, friendly and ono!!!

fDh7MlJOY6EH_hag_S_pZg.text: Friendly staff, great food, and great prices.  Got Chicken Teriyaki Bowl, Beef Teriyaki Bowl, Teriyaki Combo, and Ross J's Special Combo with 5 drinks for less than $40 bucks.  We'll definitely come back again......

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Ross J&#39;s Special Combo $8.75
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Terikayi Combo $7.75
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Terikayi Beef Bowl $3.90

PTHpieh61IsnzwNUVKLMLg.text: Favorite Hawaiian spot in the Las Vegas/Henderson area! Pricewise, super affordable. The portions are big and flavors spot on. I'd literally come here at least 3/4 times a week (which says a lot). My go-to is their Korean Spicy Chicken. Drooling thinking about it! Sidenote, the place is casual so don't expect anything fancy.

9IhOp2ZzGHz_p_oIdMRfLA.text: This place has the best Spicy Korean Chicken. I've tried food from several places but nothing compares to this. I really enjoy coming in and eating here. It has amazing food and great employees.

sr-9QHQ9O57gaEywYzgNCw.text: I love this place. You get huge portions and the food is all great, esp the Loco Moco, OMGoodness-Amazing!! Prices are great also. Love a good deal :)

_quL8vRj96nbXW7n-Y0W1Q.text: Spicy Korean Chicken plate is probably my favorite dish here. I order it extra spicy and its always a a satisfaction of burn and flavor.

0-0S4X9XrkF05zYaCs6rxA.text: Always love to support small businesses, we decided to come here after Aloha Specialities is currently renovating and that we always like to try a new place whenever we're in town. From the reviews, most reviewers here boasts about the korean chicken. Because of the recommendation, we got the aloha bento which had the hot dog, teri beef, and korean chicken with a small container of their mac salad. We also got a teri-plate in addition to feed the kids. Portions are good enough to share and prices are decent for what you get.   However, I do think the korean chicken didn't taste spicy and there were way too much of the teriyaki sauce on top. So our bento and our teri plate actually tasted the same because of it. One of our mac salads tasted like it had pinch of chili pepper on it and an odd taste of mayo. Had to toss that unfortunately. The ladies over the counter and the vibe here (as well as the wait) sure does bring me back to the islands. They were helpful and nice. The seating here looks like its been worn out a bit and the wait here can be long.   As of June 2016, don't take Sunset because of construction. It also took us awhile to get back to our hotel. The good thing for us, we ate most of it while stuck in traffic. Their teriyaki sauce is not overly thick, that I do like.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu

ldNVp7HY5J6VsDHRTdLf8w.text: Loco moco was delish!! I do wish they put more gravy on it but I'm sure u can just ask for extra w no problem. Such a friendly and cozy place. Perfect Hawaii feels!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

xGEIW5WmJyOPgKO7XzuAtw.text: This is our favorite Hawaiian place for sure! We get the spam loco moco and they always make it perfectly! The staff is friendly. Sometimes they don't answer the phones it took about 15 mins to get ahold of them once to call and order ahead of time.

tZdwUx79UmeZJvf7UQy32g.text: After seeing the many good reviews here we decided to stop in for a to-go order. We arrived just before noon which apparently was a mistake. Walking in to Ross J's I already felt like I was in a locals place in Hawaii. How can you not love the floral and green booths?   There were 3 people ahead of us which gave us time to look at the menu. They didn't have kalbi ribs which was disappointing but I knew I had to try the korean chicken. I ordered a korean chicken and katsu combo which came with rice and mac salad.   We did not receive our order until after 12:30, more than 30 minutes after we arrived. I know this place was busy at lunch hour but more than 30 minutes for a to go order is just too long.   The food almost made up for the wait :) The korean chicken was very good, just the right amount of spicy for me. The katsu was also very good, nicely breaded and crispy and moist on the inside. I did not care for the mac salad, it just had an odd taste.   Lesson learned, arrive before 11:30 next time. Definitely worth a return visit though.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean and teriyaki chicken combo
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean chicken and katsu combo
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. How can you not love these seats!

ny_yErnq4vU1t1_KpflCoQ.text: So ono!! Their portion sizes are enormous! I usually have enough for another meal. Spicy Korean chicken bowl is the best deal - only $4! I've tried a handful of other things on their menu - my favorites: loco moco, corned beef hash. Very sweet employees. Sometimes you have to wait a bit, up to 30 minutes, for your food. But it doesn't disappoint.

XB5E2Q9hjBmA6ctY-YO6qA.text: Aloha. This is the best tasting Hawaiian food in town. I also think it's the cheapest priced. Long line for lunch but well worth it. I come here 2-3 times a week.

KK1Xb6O_1ojh6O-0rlxV7w.text: One of my favorite hawiian spots. Cozy little mom & pop shop! The service can be a little slow at times due to busy crowds but that just speaks to how delish the food is!!! They have great dining options and you def get that "island " vibe while there. I can easily say I eat here about 4-5 times a month! My fav is the spicy chicken bowl with broccoli and a side of mac. Don't forget the Lilikoi!!!!!   Did I mention they are super affordable?! My family of 3 eats here for under $20 (a huge reason as to why we eat here so often)!

yD6hJw90nUr1BurkmLDn1Q.text: We cannot get enough of this place. Whether it is dining in or getting it delivered, it is always so good! Prices are great and food is awesome.

LDBvpGJtzTu-A0cYY8XVvQ.text: Quality of food is good but how am I going to review a product when the food my wife wanted ran out? For my food it was good but for my wife she was disappointed because they ran out of roast pork. Also I overheard that they ran out of meat jun. They still had 5 hours of business in the day. No air conditioning and the tint on the windows did not help at all when the sun rays came scorching through.

qle_hLU_NMUSXjcf6Rk70w.text: The food was very good and two meals came in under $10. The teriyaki beef and spicy chicken bowl had a large portion. My only complaint is there was not very much beef in the bowl. There was a good amount of chicken and for less then $5 per person it was a good value. When I'm to lazy to make my own teriyaki this will be one of my first choices.

C3gWiR_8TCuQxqst9taY6w.text: Bump up to 3.5 stars. Stopped in here late one night after my initial quest was closed for Monday. Nothing fancy, typical diner style place as far as decor goes. Nice selection of Hawaiian foods.  I ordered the Combo mixed plate, which has teriyaki beef, chicken, and mahi mahi. Portions were ok sized. Mahi mahi and chicken were really good, teriyaki beef was thin cut and chewy. Huge portion of rice, small plastic cup size of macaroni. I liked that the teriyaki wasn't too sweet or too salty, and actually complimented the meat instead of overpowering it. Chicken was moist and flavorful. Mahi mahi had a tartar sauce on it that was also complimentary to the meat and not overpowering.   Just one lady working the cash register and the tables, so when I walked in I was 3rd in line to order and it took awhile. She was serving food, bussing tables, and taking orders. Busy lady!  I will come back and try some more meals. I did like it better than L&L.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mochiko chicken

5CO5vbqE5r3Of43VC0swAg.text: I like the food here, but they need to get their restaurant properly staffed. The same lady taking phone orders, working the register, and running food to the tables. Come on you guys!  Hire more people!    I called in my order before leaving my office, ran some errands (20 minutes), got to the restaurant paid (and waited another 30 minutes).   Won't be back until restaurant is fully staffed.

dKW7hF7dnvVRzG-s_DVy5g.text: They have the best breakfast food. Love there fried rice with Portuguese sausage or spam. I only gave 3 starts because there meat jun wasn't even coated in egg and the meat was tough.

3vc7zdphVemTDNHFnC32yw.text: My last update for this place was in 2009?!  The place is still here and it's gotten better and better!  The food quality and quantity has not diminished one bit.  My go-to order consists of the Ross J special and a  spicy Korean chicken bowl (meant to be a side but it is truly a meal in itself).  Other offerings on their menu specials include Tuna  Poke, soups, and eggrolls.   The Tuna Poke is something I've only seen more recently and it's quite possibly the best I've tried in this city.  It was extremely fresh, marinated in a soy sauce and onion marinade, and the pieces of tuna were cut generously.  The price was unbeatable by even the best poke shops in town.  So much value and so cheap, you should get this if you see it on the board.  The whole menu is cheap.  The food is the best.  When you order the Ross J special, you'll be wondering how they made their crispy fried chicken so damn good.  Their breading is just so ..good.  I can't describe it.  But no one else in town does it like they do.  The people that work here are friendly and serve you with a smile.  Since 2009, I've had the chance to try multiple Hawaiian locations for lunch and dinner and Ross J's is simply the best in town.  Yelp 100 Challenge 2016 - 6/100

Xc8dz4dK_SvSyfA95f-09Q.text: This is one of the best places to eat unfortunately customer service sucks....they are slow, was informed after standing in line for 10 minutes, that I'd have to wait 25 min for my order...looks like I gotta find another Hawaiian food place...

36vMV7G1lVvkCk-_hyXQOQ.text: Three huge meals for under $30! This Haole, her husband, and our Filipino friend all love Hawaiian food, and prices this low can't be beat. I had the Bento plate (beef, chicken, and Spam); my husband had kalua pig and cabbage; and our friend had the Ross J's Special Pack (steak, chicken, mahi, and Spam). Tasty and cheap; what's not to like!  There is a small dining area, but most customers (us included) prefer this place for carryout. I'm not often in Henderson, but if you live there or you're in the neighborhood, take a trip to the islands at Ross J's.

XeQAELY4SK-Gr_KA0Y8eSg.text: It's another plate lunch place!  How many different ones are there now in Vegas?  I am loosing count, but my husband loves his plate lunches, and we're heading here today.  He tells me you'll want to try the spicy Korean chicken, I tell him, I'll look at the menu and decide for myself.  Well once I looked, I ended up getting the spicy Korean chicken.    It was spicy, crispy and had good flavor, served with two scoops rice and mac salad.  I do like a good plate lunch, but there are so many carbs!

n-IC-oHEUUl6133nMp934g.text: During my lunch today, I was fortunate enough to chow down on Ross J's!  Love this place.  It's what I'm used to.  This, for me, is comfort food.    AMBIANCE: The place is like the typical Hawaiian food dive/diner.  There are booths and table tops, a self service soda station and is always filled with people, primarily from the islands.  If you are from Hawaii, it really makes you feel like home.    FOOD and SERVICE:  When it comes to the service, I love the "local braddah" with the backwards hat and bandana.  He's always offering the Aloha spirit to customers.  Never skips a beat when it comes to greeting people and thanking them for coming in.  This is what I've noticed everytime I'm there.  When it comes to the aunty with glasses and a small homeade flower in her ear, I think it's a hit and miss.  Today she was very cordial and nice.  Many times I have visited, though, she doesn't make "small talk" or greets you.  There's another Asian girl who takes your order as well who seems very quite.    Today, I got the Spicy Korean Chicken for $7.50.  First, the macaroni salad is "ON POINT" for my taste buds.  Seasoned perfectly and they package it in a separate container when you take out.  The chicken were boneless thighs with the skin on.  They grill the chicken with their Korean sauce.  The sauce is sweet and has a subtle heatness to it.  The heat doesn't hit you like a ton of bricks.  It creeps up but doesn't linger in your mouth.  I really like that component.  The portion was big and they placed the chicken over the rice so it absorbed the extra sauce.    I've visited Ross J's many times and must say that if you're looking for a meal worth the price, you must try them out.  I've had a lot of things from their menu.  For me, when I think of local plate lunches I've had back home, this place is pretty much consistent with what I'm used to .   The authenticity of food is why I highly recommend this place to Hawaiian local food seekers and enthusiasts.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

cE416JrK6Xl-4V-S9lCRCg.text: If you missin home this is the spot right here the food is cooked hella good and fresh. On top of that prices are really inexpensive. It's right by my place on Sunset road right by smiths and makes it real convenient for me to grab a plate lunch quick. The service here from Aunty and the other workers are great makes you feel like family. Definitely recommend coming here everyday if not at least once in your life.

JGH-B9AmTP7TJSNa__7zGQ.text: This place has good food, large portion sizes and low prices. I have been here several times and it always seems to be busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

te0gGvbKKtVBm-h6Zb2NTA.text: There isn't anything on Ross J's that I don't like. Ultimate faves are the Spicy Korean Chicken and the Meat Jun. Their mac salad is just so good that I always have to order an extra side of it. This place is truly a gem and whenever I need to feed that craving for "local grinds", this will always be my go to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmmm... Meat Jun &amp; Spicy Korean Chicken Combo Plate.
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Saimin.... The local cure for any cold or if you just want that warm fuzzy feeling.

hfFgl5I00xZdpCDzdvDmIg.text: I'm surprised I haven't left a review.  Well I have been here about three or four times and it's not so bad when you want to get your Hawaiian fix.  I like this place because they have fresh sides like broccoli or kimchee.  If you're from Hawaii, you know the islanders just look for their protein and rice, oh and Mac salad. Lol!    I walked in this time around and was disappointed that they didn't have the butterfish on the menu and then I didn't see any other fish dishes in the menu.  I was so upset that I walked out, however my husband stayed because he wanted to eat. He knew I was grouchy and hungry, as was he, so he actually had asked (unlike me) to see if they had butterfish.  Aunty said, not supposed to, but guess what, she made one for me!  I then got back into a better mood, oopsie.  Warning, they give plenty of rice.  I don't really eat rice and rice takes most of your plate.  They might be better off using the ice cream scooper like everyone else...haha, why not, right?  But that's my reasoning for the three stars.  Mac salad was pretty mean and I will say that I actually killed the Mac salad way before even eating half my lunch.

4uqQTfjETSA619Yp8VUTNg.text: Heard from someone that this is from one of the original owners of Aloha Specialties at the Cal. So since I been going there for 25 years figured I would try this spot out since Aloha is getting renovated. From the taste of the Mac salad and chicken bowls it is just like the one at the Cal. Love this place. Korean Chicken was also very good. Definitely coming back now that I know it's good

LljN-R2j8JIetcI8wJ7ktg.text: I am so happy! This real hole in the wall is great. Don't be fussy about the decor, the furniture, the toilets, just come for good food...  1.  Rice plates - All good with plenty of meat and food. Spicy Chicken, Ribeye, BBQ Beef, it is all AWESOME.  2.  Specials - I always order them. Can't go wrong.  3.  Spam Musubi - My kids love ordering these. Kinda like a Spam rolled sushi for the novice.  4.  Wonton and Saimin - Be hungry. This is good stuff.  5.  Service - Barebone, but really great. Friendly, efficient and homestyle...  Just know you are eating food that will expand your waistline. Huge portions of rice, meat, noodles. Can't be shy, can't be fussy and cannot expect anything other than HUGE AMOUNT of food.

EjEE3OobzJHK7htvca451w.text: Was having a little Hawaii trip cravings. Came in here and saw a great menu of Hawaiian flavor. Opted for the Loco Moco which was fantastic. Big plates and great prices. Mahalo!

hunAm8FkVIuJZxpKXA34sg.text: In town tried this place b/c of all the positive reviews. Wish I hadn't. Had the Local Plate included 2x spam masubi, teriyaki chicken & beef & mac salad side. Mac salad & masubi wasn't bad but nothing special. Teriyaki was really bad. My kids had wonton soup & they usually love wontons but not this time.  Like another reviewer said service wasn't friendly just matter of fact.  Next time visiting will not be eating here.

DjShZrkJi6ggFJRhsNJhpg.text: I was really disappointed when I tried the spicy Korean chicken... it seemed like a lot of people praised the menu item, but it was not great at all. In fact, it just tasted like chicken with some fried breading with very little flavor. I gave the restaurant a benefit of the doubt and gave another chance of the spicy Korean chicken, and it was still the same.. so in conclusion, spicy Korean chicken is not very good.   Sad to say, but is one of my least favorite Hawaiian restaurants in town. Does not have friendly service either.   Probably won't go back.

Ri87RB8emBZR9m1dPgXWPg.text: The Korean Spicy chicken was good but not spicy. We got the Korean spicy chicken bowls - mine with grilled onions and mushrooms and the BF's with mixed veggies. First off, we ordered the bowls which were less than $4.00 each and with the veggies cames to an addition of $1.20 (or something like that) to each bowl. Pretty cheap huh?? Funny thing is that out food came in a regular container and not a bowl- so I don't know if thay made a mistake and it was my lucky day or if their bowls are really not bowls but regular sized plates- if that is the case then this place is a good deal!!! We liked our food -just wish it was spicier- I have try a pack of their Corn Flakes cookies some time!!! But several times I have asked the lady at the register if anny of the cookies are soft and sadly but honestly she said "No, all the cookies are hard" I love me some soft chewy cookies....  Anyways, I'll have to try other stuff on their menu sometime - I just can't help but order a spicy Korean chicken bowl everytime though- YUM - I wish they used chicken breast but they use chicken thighs instead. If they used chicken breasts (white meat) then this dish would be close to perfection!!!  I do wish they would sell Guava Chiffon Cake!!!!! More Hawaiian places need to offer this yummy cake - it's so hard to find and when I find it - it's not made right!!!  This place is set up just like other Hawaiian restrauants - with all kinds of yummy filling barbecue,stir fry,ramen,fried ramen,musubi's, ect... Right when you walk in you instantly feel the islands and you better come ready for some heavy grub cause that's what your gonna get.....

Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

fJ0OCq00LNOKFNhT7h3DVg.text: Quite possibly the best Hawaiian food place in Las Vegas,Ross J's Aloha Grill is located in the Green Valley area in Henderson,making it a bit of a drive for Las Vegans who don't live on the east side of the I-15 - but it is worth the drive,I guarantee it.   The service is always great; the staff very personable and friendly,as well as quick and efficient.  The venue itself is comprised of all booths,which I personally prefer to tables (there are a few tables in the back part of the restaurant,for handicapable guests).  The food - don't get me started on the food. In addition to being easy on the wallet,the food is freshly prepared and (depending how slammed the venue is) always promptly out. They have the Hawaiian staples - spam musubi,chicken katsu,etc. but what makes Aloha Grill stand out is their combination bowls (rice bowl toppings for under $7!) and the customer's ability to substitute the regular jasmine rice that comes with their meal for Aloha Grill's pork fried rice (worth the extra $2,trust me).   A must try,whenever you're on the east side,definitely consider stopping in! Aloha!

1gvcYCmUxBUktsUkaDBHcg.text: I come from a Hawaiian family & this is the next best thing to home-cooked. The family that runs it is amazing! I've been going here for years. This is the only Hawaiian place I will eat at. Everything is reasonably priced & affordable. Everyone is very friendly. The place is always well lit with natural lighting which feels amazing.   Food suggestions: Loco Moco, Spam Musubi, Pork Cutlets - My faves!

3JgqaYgDYcJ1xEjjR-Zm2A.text: Best in the Las Vegas area hands down. Great prices, great portions. I wish they were open longer hours. Great food variety and friendly people and always a clean environment.

RSdQXUuObiTFHwkg6oy_nQ.text: Ordered the roast pork menehune. Looked like TV dinner.  Not coming back. The Siamin was horrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Had a TV dinner taste to it

tZ0m_2XoebHfELJpRnh1nw.text: I love Ross J!!! The food is always excellent here and the prices are decent.  My only problem is that when I go here on a busy day, there is only one person taking orders, cleaning tables, and serving the food. Sometimes the wait can be a while because of that. I would highly suggest that they research when the busy times are and have an extra employee on staff to lighten the load and provide faster service to customers during peak hours.

SoluaSN1cGsRQ0zbAAVGvw.text: Good, fresh food. Island flavors. Great staff. Can get packed during lunch hours and can be a wait, but that's because everything is made fresh to order so call ahead of you're in a rush. Lots of menu items, too many when your hungry and want it all! Too much rice on the plate and not enough macaroni salad, but they have lime punch! Worth stopping by for that alone and I could afford to eat less mac and more rice anyways. Much better than the other hawaiian BBQ options in the area. Always full of Pacific Rim natives so you know it's gotta be good. Local business, which is always better to support. Overall worth the visit, will definitely continue to enjoy for the foreseeable future.

qooVDFZx4x1K3IkU_E3J3Q.text: 1st time here. Just had the spicy combo bowl with fried rice. Delicious! Highly recommend it.

J0gVnQlZoNT-t1OQNh0ExQ.text: I had a pregnant patient with high blood pressure. She kept coming into her appointments saying she ate too much once again. Lol. I had to ask, well what is so good that you just have to eat all the time? She introduced me to Ross J's, and I've been hooked ever since. They have an amazing Korean spicy chicken bowl for $3.75, and it is amazing (I'm a wuss when it comes to spicy and this is perfect). Also, their spam musubi is on point. Hands down best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Large portions. Cheap cost. Great quality. Always a good crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean chicken is amazing.

bDcZfqL9B0JrdbMAonVW0Q.text: The food is great!   I ordered pork cutlets from the favorites column and it was a HUGE plate. If I can't finish my meal at any restaurant then that place deserves kudos in my book.   I think what would've made the experience like the absolute best would be if there was more people working. I came on Sunday and all the seats were taken and only one person was working the cashier and serving the food. Maybe I had bad luck and they just happened to have a chaos grenade go off when I got there...either way my taste buds were satisfied.   Mahalo.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Gravy dishes

BwZCwUR9Gm85NAodpUpK8g.text: There are numerous Hawaiian spots in this area but nothing quite like Ross J's. This place has been my go to for my islander food cravings. Their Spicy Korean Chicken is to die for with the right balance (sometimes a bit too much) saltiness, hotness and overall flavor.   On days when I'm on a budget, the rice bowls always saved the day. You can't beat that under $5 menu.  The people at the counter greet you as you come in, like you were a distant cousin they haven't seen for a while. They treat customers like family. That's the island way.  I can say I've been a legitimate Duke of this hole-in-the-wall establishment for a good few months. I actually sit here and dine; unlike some who just check-in here to get Yelp brownie points without buying anything.  I'm writing this review while I enjoy perhaps what could be my last meal at Ross J's before I move out of state. Too bad where I'm going there isn't a place quite like this. The haole in me will be missing the Spam Musubis, hot steaming Saimin, well done Teriyaki beef and the Mac Salad. Oh my God let's not forget the Mac Salad!  Whenever I visit Vegas I know one place I'm definitely stopping by. Mahalo nui loa Ross J crew, your food definitely made this haole's 5 year stint in Vegas more wonderful.  Sincerely,  The guy who rides that white bike.

rp7wcVoHtyE7V30r5i4COg.text: Great prices and big portions! That's the long and short of it!   I'm not at all enthused with the old decor, dirty walls and spotted stainless steel area where the drinks are, but the food was good.  When I enter a hole in the wall Resteraunt I expect it to be far less than perfect, however I do expect cleanliness. This place wasn't clean ( at least to my expectations.) The dirty and spotted stainless steel was kind of gross to be honest, especially because it was near the soda machine. Now if you watch "dirty dining" you l ow the moldy or gunky soda machine is an imminent health hazard. That being said, I didn't see the inside of the machine so I couldn't tell you if that's the case, but the surrounding area wasn't appealing and it made me wonder!   I ordered chicken katsu,the small size, and the portion was more than enough. One breaded chicken piece with a lot of white rice and a small side of Mac salad will fill up anyone. The katsu breaking was yummy and crispy and the rice was perfect. The sauce wasn't the best I've had but wasn't the worse either. Again, portions were right and I was pleased with the food overall!  I did make sure to see if this place had an "A" rating when I left, and it did! I'd go back honestly. So I'm not terribly concerned with food contamination. The place had a lot of customers.  Advise to the owners- clean the dining room more frequently and use food area approved cleaner on your stainless steel! Looks can be deceiving!

4j97CUrNWilCNZtkXRuR2Q.text: Ross J's is pretty good! I love how close it is to me and it's really good local food. Not "just like home" but pretty much as good as it gets. Their portions are HUGE!! Definitely one of two places I go to whenever I need my local grindz fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu prices have went up since someone last posted them.

zmIKs1tXqTKT_hELGzUPUg.text: After many good reviews from my fellow yelpers, we decided to give Ross J a go when a milk tea from Noodle Cha Cha was impossible (they were CLOSED on a Saturday afternoon!  WTH?!?).  Well anyways, when we arrived at Ross J, we ordered the Spicy Chicken Bowl with added mixed veggies, Roast Pork Plate, and a drink.  It came out to $15ish.  I told my bf that she must charged him for the Roast Pork under the "ENTREE" heading ($7.50) instead of the roast pork that we noted under the "PLATE" heading ($4.50).  He inquired with the cashier and she firmly said "Well when you said roast pork plate, it is the 'ENTREE'".  He, being the friendly one in this relationship, accepted it because he was hungry regardless.   The food was ok.  I must agree with everyone about how cheap the spicy chicken bowl is.  I do want to come back to try the corned beef hash, and when I do, I will update my review as I see fit.

GvMz2RLiO0F9w6GlBPCICA.text: Garen-t make you feel like home when you walk in here. Affordable price, good portions, and the food is always consistently delicious. They are the only place in town i know for a fact has green rive, and being from hawaii that was a staple growing up so huge plus for them having it! Def a must stop when on that side of town. Huge parking lot, plenty places for sit and eat and talk story with da aunty inside haha.

SIONtOhyOwUpA38qTDp4Lw.text: I have to update my review because this place is just so awesome and down the street and cheap.  I took my friend Susan here post-Sex and the City for a late lunch, and we both each enjoyed the filling $3.50 spicy Korean chicken bowl as well as a new treat - ahi sashimi!  I never have seen this on the menu!  I know they have ahi poke on Fridays but I guess sashimi on Sundays works for me!   The fish was sooooo fresh (see picture) it melted in our mouths and tasted amazing.  The chicken was good, tasty and the skin so deliciously crispy (and I love those green onions).  I highly recommend visiting this charming place and remember, they take credit cards so have no fear :0) plus they carry Coke products yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Ahi sashimi

O0vsTECA-1kyAKhW5Gg9TA.text: Closest thing to plate lunches in Hawaii....Big Portions, reasonably priced and will keep you coming back for more...I've gone here on occasion and scarfed down TWO plates in one sitting which would leave the cashier in disbelief!!! My Favorites are the Mochiko Chicken' Hawaiian plate of Fridays(Where's the Poi???) And Ross J's Combo plate....Here's a good thing to know-ask for fried rice which is even tastier with your plate lunch than the plain white rice....ALOHA!!!

996w5hfwjKDSvS-oWFniNQ.text: Good food, and good service... I do recommend this place if you are want hawaiian food

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

hTe5evKII3Sg3Op7lPavWg.text: I like this place in my time to lunch. the prices are  accessible and the food is very good.

V3nI5DAsxvnk8twKJC_0pQ.text: I just went here for the first time today! I got the Ross J special combo plate and a spam musubi! I had been craving good Hawaiian for a while now and found my new favorite spot! Everything was on point. Hot and delicious! Will be back again!

sti-7gvvBemQ97m6Dm1SsA.text: Location is odd, in my opinion, and the interior may need some work, but for what it is, this is exactly what I envision a great Hawaiian Local food joint to be!   The prices are amazing for the amount of food you get. This is seriously the ONLY place that my boyfriend doesn't have to ask for more rice, OR borrow from my plate! HA.  I always get the spicy korean chicken (think Zippy's korean fried chicken... MMM). If I'm fiending for more variety, I will combo that sucker up with some sweet and sour spare ribs, or whatever special they might have.  Also, my boyfriend and I share one fountain drink, and get a "combo" plate each... the total is still UNDER $20!   Who can beat that? Winnahz.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

JcRzWuceESvLun1XPna-Bw.text: In all the years I have been coming here (5) I never have a single complaint. The food is great and so is the service. One thing I love about them is their consistency with the taste. Everything is always good!   My favorite is the 2 musubi, teriyaki chicken and teriyaki beef combo!  Hubby's favorite (when they have it) is the Aloha bento.  Saimin is good, chicken cutlet and katsu are good.  Even their cookies is good! Oh and mac salad is perfect! Hard to find places that get a mac salad right! Being born and raised in Hawaii I've tasted my fair share of it.   When friends come in town we always take them there. Now everyone else is hooked too. It's affordable and big portions.

t8oL6ojAU4LnqwsvTY44Bw.text: Best Hawaiian fast food in Vegas. I'm not from Hawaii, but I've eaten enough from many different restaurants to know what's good! Portions are huge. I would recommend the spicy Korean chicken for starters, but I like to get the Ross js special most of the time.

8h-3XsIN3TJh5uwqdNuWMQ.text: I've been going here for over 10 years now, great food and service. Yes during lunch time is really busy but the wait is definitely worth it but today was a different experience.  My boyfriend and I went here to get our usual order, we did a phone order to pick up our food. Of course it took almost 20 mins to get in front of the line to get our food. We were in a rush to meet up with my family so we were going to quickly eat in the restaurant and then go.  I'm guessing they had a new cashier girl because after we picked up our food and we were almost done eating, she told us that we couldn't eat at the diner if we did a pick up order. Keep in mind, there was a couple of open tables for others to eat as well. Also, we have done it multiple times where we did a pick up order and ate in the restaurant.   We would have a better experience if the service was better.

JwH1P83a6ocCfgNca_QBNA.text: This is the spot for your Hawaiian grind fix! Spicy chicken bowl is so tasty. They also have butter fish and poke on Fridays! oh yea and it's so cheap they basically  give it to you!

t2HVT4LKVMqud55KHgVYUw.text: Really good quality food for really affordable prices served up by some really nice people. It's good stuff.

2qu_1UuJs1yyg6LgwlzxcQ.text: This place is amazing! It is the hidden gem of Henderson NV. The food is excellent and very reasonably priced.  I'm fortunate that this place is a block away from my office.  It does get really busy during the lunch hour yet the staff still manages to keep up with everyone.  Come give this place a try you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl with vegetable. My go-to almost every time!

JNjt96JOigUwjko_oWR4lA.text: This is such an awesome place to go! Reminds me of the Mom and Pops restaurants back home. Very cozy, and relaxing. Customer service is superb! Lots of great menu choices and the prices are very reasonable. This is a must go to place for lunch or dinner if you're in this part of town. Your tummy will be satisfied!

fllPVN8eYr5sHAx_QGv8_Q.text: The most amazing Hawaiian food in Las Vegas! Price of food is super cheap!! The spicy Korean chicken bowl is my favorite!! The Shanghai lumpia's is my favorite appetizer!! Super friendly staff! Very clean!! Try for yourself!! You'll fall in love!!!

3c5960u8Ti2WvyJ6rBVA5w.text: Best customer service and big portions for a great value. One of my favorite places to go for breakfast or lunch. Their meals are so simple, but always delicious!   They always have specials going on that are super cheap. Usually crowded in the morning on a weekend so I'd recommend going during the week. My favorite breakfast is the scrambled eggs with the Portuguese sausage and white rice. Definitely the place to go for a cheap delicious meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

gf7YVsNqM4oOD1XJ17g5hw.text: Ross J's is my #1 spot for Hawaii local food. Ate at alot of different places of this kind of food and nothing has tasted as good as Ross J's. Their hospitality is a 10. The food portion and flavor are exactly like Home "kauai". If u are from Hawaii and have not yet gone to this spot, u betta go. And if anyone that is not from Hawaii but wants to get a taste of it, this is it. Place is always busy and but the food comes out with good timing. Will recommend this to everyone! If u don't kno what to order, get a loco moco. U can never go wrong with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Heard good things about this place.

s8r50gG1lDeVT9B2sWTeHQ.text: I usually don't like Hawaiian food, but this place is too good to resist. The food is great, the portions are enormous, and the price is so affordable. It makes the grad student in me cry tears of joy just by looking at the prices.  I usually get the Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl ($3.85) with broccoli (an extra $1.35-ish?), so for a little over $5, I'm full for at least two  meals. You can take home half and it'll be substantial enough for another full meal, or you can do what I did yesterday and just ate the entire plate. The chicken is soft and tender, and it's on top of some sweet teriyaki-esque sauce & rice. I just don't know how they make it taste so good. The only thing is that it does take about 5-10 minutes for them to cook the chicken and steam the broccoli, so if you want a to-go order, you can just call ahead.  This place is very straight to the point. It doesn't try to sell you with really aesthetic decor, special deals, or heavy social media presence because frankly, it doesn't need to. The quality and flavor of the food alone will make you a believer in Ross J's. There isn't much more to say but that you should stop reading my review, get in your car, and go get a plate of that Spicy Korean Chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy korean chicken with broccoli
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Hawaiian sun available
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Ordering area

ZaBB7PNgV45J3dorlY7l2g.text: I like to come here often. The staff are very nice and super hard working. However, when it is really busy there is no place to sit and you might have to wait 30 mins to get your food. So plan accordingly when you come during the busy times. You can also call in for a pick up, which a lot of people seem to do.   The food is delicious, cheap and you get huge portions. What we usually get are the beef stew, chicken Katsu, meat jun, spicy Korean chicken, Ross j special, and the 2 eggs with rice and Portuguese sausage. The beef stew, spicy Korean chicken and Ross j are our favorite. Depending on how hungry you are you can get the spicy Korean chicken plate which is $7.99 or the bowl which is $3.85. The Ross J special is $8.99 and it  includes Teri steak, mahi mahi, fried chicken, rice and mac salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

mScudLGRiZPrQrVeN_MMaQ.text: Always amazing island food! Great people and i always look forward to coming back.Best mac salad around too. ALOHA!

BNXjEs16kTYHr0y3oPEtuQ.text: I absolutely love the food. I cant find a place better than here and the price is so dang cheap. I'm a loyal customer.

QY2qy2i7vwjhizKDSSEeXA.text: I was excited to try this spot since it had good prices and the food looked super bomb from the pictures. I was a little disappointed with the lack of flavor in the Korean chicken and bland meat jun that was partially raw. Met jun should never be a little raw since it is a thin slice of meat. I'm not sure if they were just rushing our order out, but I don't mind a wait for food to be thoroughly cooked when it needs to be.  The restaurant also needs a little TLC with the paint and cleaning.  The staff were awesome and the choices they offer are good especially for the price but maybe that could why the flavor is a little lacking. This place is better than the Chinese Hawaiian BBQ places. Hopefully this experience was a fluke and never happens again.

wtjqjZwPP6MJy5Mi5TGQ6g.text: Ross J's is dangerously close to my school, so whenever I find myself craving Hawaiian food, this is the go-to spot.    It's located in the Smith's shopping center on Sunset and Sunset, across from the Ethel M Chocolate Factory.  Be mindful that this place is ALWAYS BUSY! Especially so during lunch time!    My favorite thing to get is their Spicy Korean Chicken bowl.  The chicken is sweet, spicy, crunchy..all that good stuff!  It comes with rice, but it's also good if you substitute noodles for the rice.  You can also add on some veggies to complete the meal.  It is my favorite thing to order on the menu!    Their musubi are great too!  They offer spam, Portuguese sausage, and chicken musubi for less than $2.  The last time I ordered 10 of them and 2 hours later, when I opened the styrofoam, they were still fresh and hot!     Portions are huge and prices are cheap!  They also have Hawaiian Sun juices to enjoy with your meal.    The only thing they get mad about is eating in the restaurant while ordering to go.  So when they ask you if you're dining in or taking out, make a decision and stick with it.

BqOerbHauSV3hLdVew2l9w.text: The food here is good! It's only five dollars for my favorite plate (good quantity too!) so definitely worth the price don't expect the staff to be too friendly cause they aren't but they're never rude either! I do catch them giving over wait times to get rid of customers though told the person after me it was an hour wait time I got my food in about twenty minutes ? I would recommend just because it's cheap and delicious other then that don't expect much

Ii5IE5CrTcNrUhBGH2YwFg.text: One of my favorite Hawaiian spots in Las Vegas/Henderson.  The place is very unassuming, but the food is GREAT!  what I love about this place is that it's just like the place inside california hotel, but w/o the casino tax and having to deal with a smoke filled casino.

4K-hRQ462x7f0rB71UZuYA.text: Very solid food, great prices!  Extremely busy at lunch time, come before 11am.  The portions are large, and I have never had a bad meal and I've been coming here for years!

LKYfYaKZlzUxke6LhIz4rA.text: Went with my daughter. I had the Garlic Chicken and gravy and my daughter had the teriyaki chicken with rice and vegetables. Don't let the photos fool you, I am currently on the throne.  I ate one piece of chicken, couple of bites of rice and pasta salad. I couldn't go on.  My daughter ate about half as she was famished, she couldn't go on either. Hopefully my ex-husband will eat it when he gets home tonight. I was not impressed but maybe the Katsu Chicken is better?
