69Z54aRGDzm0CDTGOhP5Ew.text: I've been eating here for 3 years and order only the same thing everytime. Spicy korean chicken bowl add vegetables(in which I pay extra for) and extra sauce on the side. For the most part it's  cooked great for the prices they provide  But I always have to remind them of the extra sauce and after 3 years of going in there you'd think they'd pick up a regular and not to mention I eat here multiple times a week. But everytime I order it's like the first horrible time that I did. Today the food was terrible!! the rice is mushy I feel like I'm eating mashed potatoes the chicken is waaaaay too spicy and of course they forgot my extra sauce   When a regular has to say it's not worth It then think of another place to eat because Ross j's needs to step it up from now on if they want to keep my business.

K87YXSrbsaIupwu7vFLQ5A.text: When ever I have the chance for Hawaiian good, Ross J's is on top of my list. I order the Korean Spicy Chicken bowl, and it's to die for. The portions are on the med/large size and they will fill you up. The only down fall I have is the location is a little old and wish they would be able to relocate to a different (new building) but for now, it'll have to do.

FX8BDcx4OLCIGxHTgW8LKw.text: If you've ever been to Aloha Specialties in downtown Las Vegas, then the menu here will look a little familiar. They have much of the same items, but the menu at this location is much bigger. The food is delicious, portion sizes are generous, prices are low and service is great. What's not to like?!  I'm disappointed in myself that I didn't discover the cookies here sooner than my last visit to LV. The cornflake cookies are bomb! I'm definitely buying more than one package the next time I'm here.

56vpMnyHdzidmK7UXn27aw.text: Love this place! You know it's good when the place is packed ! My boyfriend is local and he loves Thai place !

fWP0F48xuGNed7F73jKN3w.text: They have great food but I gave them a 2 star because after standing in line for 15 minutes to order my food. I finally made it to the front and was told  that the wait was 25 to 3o minutes to recieve my food.  The reason it took so long to even order my food is because the woman at the cash register kept walking away from customers.  It appeared that she was distracted.

qX9xD3lj5pHesUTFDKVLgA.text: It's pretty good but not exactly like home (Hawaii).  Run by 2nd gen mainlanders.  I love the Mahi platter and Korean chicken.  Don't get me wrong, I go here a lot on my way home but here a couple things they could improve upon, or at least try to be more authentic to the island way: The rice always seems a little old - not steamy or sticky enough.  The mac salad is strange flavor - almost couldn't eat it the first couple times but I am used to it and eat it al now. LOL  I guess I am adapting.  It can take a while to get your food also.  Prices are great and I am glad they are here.

jGPyTbwJaBSE83Po0lUBzw.text: I've eaten here twice and the first time was take out for lunch. The second was dining in for dinner.  After trying non chain hawaain places, I'll never settle for L and L or Aloha kitchen if I have the choice.  For take out I got the chicken Katsu plate with fried rice and a side of spicy Korean chicken.  I didn't get to eat it super fresh since it was a drive back to the office.  I will say, I've had better Katsu chicken and I've also had better fried rice.  They unfortunately forgot my sauce for my Katsu so I was pretty disappointed..  The spicy chicken was good but for the meal, I'd have to say I'd need to eat their food fresh to make an opinion.  That brings me a week later to dinner with my friend.  My Spicy Korean Chicken came out on a huge plate and I had a side of veggies for an extra dollar.  I know everyone has their preference of type of meat for their chicken.  Although fatter, I prefer dark meat!   They grill the skin side down so it's crisp and it's really good.  The chicken bowls are around four bucks and for the plate of food it's a good value.  Food came out quick.  And even with the four items for take out, the ready time was only five minutes and it took me longer to drive their :P   For them forgetting my sauce I have to take a star off.  You'd want your guest to enjoy their meal wether it's take out or dine in, and I was unable to do so because they forgot half of what makes chicken Katsu: KATSU SAUCE :[

zi1uiFfzBb9CS39m6FPPUg.text: Ok, I already made my return. Tried a few more items. The katsu pork is really good. I'm not usually a fan of deep-fried food, but this had a very nice crispiness and the pork still maintained it's moistness. I also tried the saimin. It was just ok. Everything else is fantastic!

cDHo_xmKOSVHdkyl3lMUww.text: This place is da bomb! Korean chicken is delicious, my wife gets the Ross J's special with old fashion fried, this is the best deal for the money. My fav is the hamburger katsu with 2 eggs on top, onolicious!  The garlic chicken,  teriyaki butter fish and roast pork is also very good. We love this place!

F2cUB3OQxaY7fi50fixXHQ.text: Solid food for the price. One can easily get by with spending $6 for lunch. For a mixed special rice bowl with spicy chicken cost me that. What you get? A large bowl of rice is piled high with meat and doused with teriyaki sauce. I didn't know that there were no veggies, but they offer a side of them for an additional $1.   The service is warm and quick. It is no surprise that they have so many people stopping in to get lunch.

kaEnuAOnCzB_txxp93AI-g.text: Absolutely LOVE Ross J's! Been coming here since I was 11!  EVERYTHING & I mean EVERYTHING is delish here. Service is extremely good for a busy spot. I love this place, & I'll always keep coming back.

cuc8haZ4ByDEUPVUn5VbiA.text: I eat here at least 5 times a week. Chicken teriyaki bowel for 3.50 can't beat the price and the taste is amazing. Also always have to get the macaroni salad also

1yYJ2M5XeNwQJyPp6clJ8Q.text: I've been here about four times now but this is the first time I've ever posted a review for this place.  So far, so good, I have yet to have a bad experience at this restaurant.  The food is wonderful and the prices are reasonable compared to other Hawaiian restaurants; and the restaurant itself - it's great.  If you feel like eating in, there's plenty of room for that as there is ample seating available.

YFiM6-Nd9QYjVWCKlHGvGQ.text: Hawaiians rejoice!  Another great place to get some ONO local food!  Those in the know are aware that the food at Ross J's Aloha Grill is very similar to the food at Aloha Specialties in the California Hotel because they are both owned by the same family (the last time I checked).  So the food you see at Ross J's for the most part you will see at Aloha Specialties.  This is good for the folks that live in Henderson that don't want to drive all the way to Downtown for some mighty good Hawaii-Style grub!  Save gas...save cash!  I love me some Calrose rice and macaroni salad when my diet allows me!  I hit this place up whenever I get to this side of town.  All their dishes are local favorites so I never have a hard time going wrong.  Popular of course are the Kalua Pig, Chicken Katsu, Chop Steak, Beef Tomato, Garlic Chicken w/ Brown Gravy (super ONO), Loco Moco (Hawaii STAPLE, duh), Teriyaki Butterfish, Meat Jun, and the Teriyaki Chicken.  Each of these plate lunches and more come with two big scoops of rice and a big scoop of macaroni salad.  Even better, all of their favorite dishes and Teriyaki plates are in the $7-$9 range!  So cheap for so much food!  They also do Menehune (mini) plates, and combination plates to satisfy everyones appetites and wallet.  Beefy on a budget!  Sweetness.  Ross J's also has gread noodles: Saimin, Won Ton Min, and Fried Noodles.  Always selling are their Bowls as well, my fav is the Teriyaki Chicken bowl.  I almost always get this with servng of mixed vegetables, and a Teri Burger and macaroni salad on the side!  Funny enough, this is my same order at Aloha Specialties as well.  Their Teriyaki sauce is addicting!  They also do burgers, and Spam Musubi too.    For breakfast, they got you covered!  Eggs with Portuguese Sausage or Spam, and rice?  Pork Fried Rice with Eggs?  Loco Moco for breakfast?  Sign me up, son!  Hawaiian Hearty at it's best!    Food is excellent, service is quick and friendly, and prices are good.  Visit Ross J's Aloha Grill and taste the Aloha Spirit!!  In the food, in the food...please do not taste the staff!

nhsuRrutLbm-ThZx9sbTNg.text: The food quality isn't that fantastic where the management can conduct themselves the way they do or maybe they're really that successfully that they can. I could be wrong but I doubt it. Shape up! Was trying to give you money. Hope you pull your heads out of you customer servAss! What happen to the aloha spirit? 3 stars only because I'm kind enough and trying to help you  and not a complete dick like manager that wanted to charge .25 for each box for a take out order.  Aaaaaaloooooohaaaaa!

HSn27xfuA5mo2vWbINas1A.text: This place is awesome!!! And the price is right, oh yeah. I usually get a spam masubi and spicy chicken bowl. Under 5 bucks for a chicken meal?? Such a good deal! The saimin is also fabulous, and for four bucks it is hugeeee. They do daily specials on the board every day, and have a great big selection of authentic hawaiian dishes. I have yet to try anything that is not awesome. I usually call ahead so it is ready when I come, but even when I have walked in the food is always finished fast. It IS a busy place but they manage to take care of everyone at a steady pace.  All of their food is delicious, and the people who run this place are so nice. SO NICE. So what are you waiting for? Come support this awesome local business!

jp6Al8qnjEAp8IfkJ0zyKg.text: Excellent food. Great menu layout. Seats a old n uneven. And the could use a food runner. One worker is taking orders, phone orders, running food, cleaning tables.

VMa5cA6IkNNdKhMDKY3Xdw.text: One of the few places that have authentic hawaiian local food and served with aloha. L&L and ohana bbq are ok..but if you want real island food you gotta come here..they have all you can drink GREEN RIVER! Plus they have awesome specials and if you not in the mood for those...you can make up your own mixed plate. Only place in vegas you can get butterfish!

DyXbyyXTzPHnmD2v-27Ojw.text: Best Hawaiian food I've ever had. I live near it so I'm always there. Lol. I work downtown so I eat at Aloha Specialties on my break when I can (which is owned by the same family, so I've heard). But Ross J's is my favorite. All these other places are disgusting  Korean bowl is my fav!!

uXc6epRqLW3MaVc-fia1uw.text: Thee absolute best! Spicy chicken bowl with mushrooms and onions w/a side of mac salad bomb bomb! Mixed plate delicious. Great prices friendly service. Aloha!

sJsU6FHLwNNvB7Ockrmozg.text: Ross J's is delicious. Consistently. The staff is really super nice and takes really good care of everyone in the place, even when they are beyond busy. My Dad always chats up the cashier (Yes, he is the older, bearded man that holds up the line... sorry) and they are always really really nice to him. Oh, and the food is awesome too!  I like the Korean chicken bowl which is under $4, it comes with tons of food. My Mom either gets Kim Chi Saimin (Delicious) or a mini kahlua pig (Never tried, but she loves it), a mini plate or bowl is the perfect size for an average or smaller appetite. The mini plate comes with a scoop of rice and a small scoop of yummy mac salad. The spam musubi, fried rice and teri combo plates are also delicious. I have been for a late breakfast and enjoyed the spam and eggs. If you like good coffee, you might want to skip getting a cup here. I know I might offend some by saying that it would be nice if they offered brown rice.  Just a thought... Everything else is wonderful!  Enjoy, in moderation.

HCu2WmzRYt4ItCaZbM5bLQ.text: I recommend getting the Spicy Korean Chicken; it's the best tasting dish at Ross J's Aloha Grill.  The spicy and a little sweet coating on the chicken makes it taste super yummy.  The portions are large.  If you get the plate (comes with rice and macaroni salad), you get three breast pieces which easily makes 2 regular-sized meals.  I tried some other dishes and they were average okay (ranging from not so good to good).  The Ross J's Special Pack combination plate is an example.  It comes with teriyaki steak (ok), mahi (very fishy, probably old and frozen), fried chicken (tender and tasty), and spam (super salty).   I also tried the Kalua Pig and Cabbage and unfortunately, it was very bland tasting; haven't found any place in Las Vegas yet with good pork kalua or lau lau.  I agree with some other reviewers that the macaroni salad tastes strange.  It doesn't taste like macaroni salad from other places like L&L Hawaiian.  I can't describe it... maybe a strong industrial overtone to the taste?   It still tasted okay and didn't give me any issues.   If you don't like it, you can always request a substitution to something else like broccoli.  (Note: some entries like the special/combos don't  allow substitutions.)  Parking is plentiful in the large outdoor mall parking.  (Currently, they are repaving in front of Ross J's, but you can still park on the dirt or nearby on the remaining concrete surfaces.)    The interior is like a medium-sized cafeteria with 4-person booths and a couple of 4-person tables.  Once you are inside, go to the front counter, look at the large menu (and the temporary specials blackboard underneath), order, pay, and grab a table if you are eating there (the waitress will bring your food to you).   The tip box is next to the cash register. Portions are big so instead of getting a plate, you can get a couple of small/regular size items instead.  When the place is busy (usually during lunch and dinner hours) and the person taking orders looks a little flustered, make sure to confirm the order and double-check that the total price sounds correct.  They got my order wrong once and instead of just remaking the correct order, they kept pushing the wrong order onto me until I finally accepted.     Because I usually can't finish a plate, I usually order Togo.   I still eat there and then take the leftovers home.  Unfortunately, they told me once that if they run out of tables, they will kick me out because I ordered togo.  Doesn't make any sense to me because I could just order to eat in, ask for a togo box, and not have to deal with the possibility of being kicked out.  Duh. (I still tip even though I ordered togo so I'm not trying to avoid tipping.)

rchj-CJFxkFbUoiwvhhV6A.text: Definitely the best Hawaiian food in town. You get HUGE portions for a small price. It is usually around $10 for my fiance and I when we get the spicy Korean chicken bowls and two drinks. AMAZING FOOD, AMAZING PRICES, and AMAZING SERVICE!

TBv9E0hAWMvtOABepSaWEQ.text: This restaurant is off to the side on Sunset and Sunset... and takes me back to all the great places to eat back home, Honolulu.  The most amazing item on their menu is the Spicy Korean Chicken and the Meat Jun.  I am always recommending friends and family there.  Great price, large quantity!  But no room for sharing!  #onolicious

KwdB8sOjgxQM97CeD55SLg.text: Definitely in the top 3 for best Hawaiian restaurant here in Las Vegas. If you're looking for authentic Hawaiian food, then this is your spot. The prices are unbeatable and the portions are huuuge. I never leave this place unsatisfied. The staff are always super nice. Sometimes they can be a little slow especially during lunch rush but its definitely worth the wait.

dNKLS2mpth5yMMIwHGr_Ng.text: Cheap, yummy and HUGE portions! What's not to love about this place. Ross J's Aloha Grill cooks up authentic Hawaiian food for dirt cheap prices. Everything I have tried here is delicious! Here are a couple of my quick tips on whats good...  1) The macaroni salad is AWESOME - and I don't even like macaroni salad  2) The noodle soup is so tasty. The broth is so rich and the ingredients taste fresh  3) They have homemade cookies!  4) The Korean Chicken and the pork are both great choices for dinner.  Make sure to stop by here and say "Aloha" to these tasty eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

h1ADkVIqS2BEMy2zu4oGmw.text: Affordable, delicious, Hawaiian food! Staff are always so friendly! Great selection of foods to choose from!  Personal favorites : Beef Stew, Meat Jun, Mochiko Chicken, Fried Saimin, and Loco Moco!  I'm not sure if I've tried everything on the menu but it's good food everytime!

DdjuV3EC5_ByV9MCty4XyQ.text: Delicious food! We had kalua pig & cabbage and Korean spicy chicken bowls. Very happy with today's meal, can't wait to come back.

ue8c_Wyr2n0pvNmrOT7NyA.text: Very casual and simple!!! I like here!! They have good number of menus!! Food is delicious!! They are all easy to try (if it's your first time trying Islander's food). I recommend here!!!! For sure!!

KVqSGFValKjoN7i3iCllKg.text: Good, Homestyle hawaiian food... it's a kick back environment, so don't expect too much. Friendly, homy, down to earth workers. Come before the lunch or dinner rush, because the line tends to get long and sometimes not enough seating. One of my favorite go to's when I want my local grind fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

NTLpeSWshwZSU-xFIByGkg.text: I usually stick to the chains of Aloha Kitchen or L&L when I am in the mood for Hawaiian food. Tonight I decided to mix it up a bit and try Ross J's.   I had planned on trying their wonton min (wonton and saimin soup). Unfortunately the broth is shrimp stock and I have a shellfish allergy :( I'm glad I asked. I also wanted to try the Shanghai Lumpia but I didn't see them until I had already ordered. Which was fine. I ordered a local plate which has BBQ chicken, BBQ beef, two Spam musubi and a scoop of macaroni salad. This is pretty much what I get at Aloha Kitchen minus the scoop of rice. I don't need that much rice any how so no worries there.  To say this local plate is a mixed plate is True on two planes of reality. There is a good mix of food with four different items. It is also a mix of awesome and a let down, sadly. To start with, the BBQ beef was hands down the best I've had at any Hawaiian place. It is tender and well cooked. You can taste the natural flavors of beef and the freshness there within. I only wish there was more than the maybe 6 or so small pieces. The chicken was tender also and had nice flavor. There was more of it than the beef. I take issue with the skin. I dislike chicken skin and will only eat it if it is crisp. Some pieces of chicken on my plate had a nice crispy skin. At least on one side. Other pieces I pulled off the skin. Its a textural thing. The musubi was fine. Tender nori. A lot of rice. A fair amount of Spam. A good example of what Spam Musubi should be. Then I get to the macaroni salad. I usually love Hawaiian style macaroni salad. The creaminess is unrivaled. It never goes to waste on my plate. But the macaroni salad I just had tonight I could not finish. Sure, it was creamy like it should be but it was also incredibly salty. I've never had a macaroni salad of any variety which has been so salty. I don't know if this is just Ross J's recipe or if it was a mistake but I could have done without it.    The service here is friendly but the food I found to be a mixed bag. I'm glad I gave them a try but it may be a while before I come back.

MfPD3P15quV2Pub4bNOhPA.text: Perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing on the wrong day, but how could you possibly go wrong with a mix plate?  For one, I didn't receive the friendly aloha service other reviews have raved about. The girl taking my order was more preoccupied with the cell phone pictures that the older ladies were passing around behind the counter. I took my order to-go, but was disappointed yet again, this time with the food -- it looked unappetizingly bland and thrown together, and a few bites later confirmed all of this. My dad ordered the same and he, too, wasn't a fan.   Other Hawaiian places often have the option of white or fried rice with their mixed plates. The majority of my platter consisted mostly of a sea of white rice with a drowning piece of teriyaki, chicken, and mahi-mahi barely surviving on top.  None of this was particularly tasty to me. The chicken skin was fatty and the teriyaki mediocre. The mahi-mahi was the only thing pretty decent...So no, no thanks.

-QX8u-QDN6skZaiMShqGdg.text: I haven't been to this restaurant in 10-11 years and being in the area because of family business we decided to eat here.  I ordered the combo teri beef and chicken plate and my wife had the garlic chicken we almost broke all of our teeth trying to eat the food.  The chicken was burnt beyond belief and supper dry, and the teri beef was hard and very old tasting like it was sitting around for days.  They gotta learn to marinate the meats in teri sauce made from scratch not from the bottle like back home style and the food would cook so much more betta.  Shoulda had the won ton mein instead, at least I would have broken teeth.  I'm 70 years old and cannot eat leather like the young days.  Fix the problem and I might come back.

QuFVVW8lSUooK5XWOM6puA.text: Being from Kapahulu I came here with the high expectations of Rainbows. I ordered teri chicken and fried saimin, thinking I'd have dinner and a lunch the next day. Very disappointed in the teri chicken. I make better! What I got was three fried chicken half-breasts that hadn't been marinated and were tasteless. They pour a syrupy, overly, sweet teri sauce over the chicken that also lacked flavor- didn't taste any ginger at all. Tasted like a ready made bottled sauce, just horrible. They must know how to make a better homemade sauce since they say and look local. The fried saimin saved then from 1 star. Flavorful, loaded with char siu, onions, carrots, omelet- quite delicious. I'll give them one more shot at impressing me-always give three chances-but at this point they've got some way to go...

RZ4byQRo2iJ_eB3dwcB86g.text: I used to eat at Ross J's Aloha Grill every Friday during lunch time with co workers when l worked in that side of town.  By chance, l took my girlfriend and it was her first time. She was disappointed that they didn't have meatjun which will bring us back.

Mo14juJ-pPvtlCvu5polxg.text: I love you Ross J, I don't think it's allowed how cheap you are. I've had this place bookmarked for awhile. We were randomly around the area and decided to check it out.  So many decisions, so little stomach. Luckily, there were 4 of us that could have tried 4 different plates. Too bad 3 of us for the same thing. The small Korean chicken was so fulfilling. If you get a small one, you should add some onions and mushrooms, it'll come out to be $5, definitely not that bad. Want to make it even better? My friend got it with noodles instead of rice. It was the best thing ever.   I used to wonder what was so good about saimin, if pretty much just ramen right? Nope! It was so much more flavorful!  The spamusubi also had a bunch of sauce, yumm!  Meat Jun: kind of a disappointment. Not as flavorful as everything else and it really just didn't stand out.  Too lazy to read this review? Long story short, get everything!

Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mini Korean chicken with mushrooms and onions
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spamusubi!

aatTsynIVZNON7NfVPxQag.text: It's not my favorite hawaiian restaurant but it will do when I'm not on the north end of town  .

LDqqilz-e9i3A-266KR62Q.text: Keep it consistent Ross J's!  Last time I was here I left with a meal worthy of 1 star, but gave 2 because I've had better meals there before. Today, I'll give it a 4. I went in at 10:30AM (They open at 10) and the food was great. The pork katsu was a little on the empty side, meaning all breading and no pork, but no other complaints The potato salad was fresh and the rice was soft (sticky Japanese rice, not that dry flaky American stuff).  The restaurant is a little on the beat down side. Plastic bench chairs are ripped and everything is a little old. Maybe take-out instead of eating in? Haha.  I don't know if going in right when they open helped, but Ross J's has redeemed themselves. YAY- I no longer have to go to L and L (gag!) :)

45PJ7Kmk-OYtzFONrIxgkA.text: Waste of money. Came here today 4/18/2017 and my first thoughts were, yuck it needs to be cleaned. Maybe if the kid behind the counter wasn't playing with his kendama, the place could look much more cleaner and more welcoming. When you put the word, Aloha on an establishment, you expect to be greeted with some type of customer service, but that wasn't the case.   The spam for 2 of my kids musubis were under cooked, my fried noodles was wet, the mac salad had too much pepper, the meat jun meat didn't look right, the sauce for it was a bit spicy. Only thing that was decent, was the spicy korean chicken.   We're from the islands too, so we're all about supporting local businesses. However, we will not be returning to this restaurant.   Train the workers to clean while it isn't busy, instead of playing with toys. The chairs looked really nasty and could use some scrubbing. The table to the right when you entered was dusty and the floors could also use a good scrubbing as well. Some of the chairs were ripped and really just dirty, that even my 9 year old daughter was afraid to sit on them. Sorry, but I wish I had better things to say about this restaurant, but at the moment, I don't. I'm pretty sure the owners are really sweet, but this place needs some major upgrades!

iJRX5pNPRbRsqshbS20mXA.text: Ross J's has some of the best and most authentic Hawaii'n food that I personally have had in Las Vegas. Great pricing to portion ratio and even better service! Love that it is a smaller more personal dining experience. Ross J's is the way to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

gUOD-_lBUUa4Lfm4BidtOA.text: I came here based on all the good reviews. However, I can help but feel that the reviews were slightly generous. The food was standard in terms of Hawaiian food. I've ate plenty of Hawaiian food over the years from L&L to Aloha Kitchen to the cafe at California hotel. This place is average. We ordered the spicy chicken bowl and the wife had Ross' special pack which was a mixed platter of meats. We also ordered two spam musabi on the side. Again, nothing stood out during this meal. Not the macaroni nor the flavor the meats. While the food was not bad, I'll probably not come by here again. There are SO MANY choices here in Vegas that I cannot see myself going out of the way to come here. The service was again standard. (At least they don't limit you to one refill, shame on you L&L.) The size of the restaurant was on the small side. This place had a steady flow of customers but there was always a table available. Overall, standard Hawaiian food.

wIPQcPj_o-LUnR38-OsZNQ.text: After seeing all the tips and pics of the Spicy Korean Chicken, I was more than intrigued to come here. So when I jus happened to be in the area, there was no doubt what I was gonna have for lunch.  Came here at 11:30 and there was a little line forming already. Ordered my Spicy Korean Chicken with Mushrooms and onions. Threw some sriracha on there (which was on every table) and enjoyed how crispy the chicken was. The onions and mushrooms were the cherry on top. All of this was sittin on top of steamed white rice. I love the teriyaki sauce they put on top. It was just the right amount to bring all the flavors together like a very good orchestral symphony.   Service was surprisingly fast based off of the customers that ordered before me. Im actually glad I got in at the time I did because around 12, the place got packed quick! That's always a good sign of a good establishment.  Prices are really good for the portions that you get. What I got was supposedly one of the bowl options. Seemed more like a stretched out oblong plate. Mind you they have actual plate combos that give you even more food.  Since all I had was the chicken, I know I have way more reasons to come back here to try out the other great items. 4 solid stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Teriyaki Combo! Beef, Chicken, and Pork!
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean Chicken with Mushrooms and Onions! So good!

SVm8kgrW8VpH7Yrbr_c1Mw.text: I know that Ross J's has been around for quite some time. Shame on me, that it took me this long to eat here. I'm in the area from time to time and have been to Blue Fin and Sumo, but never here until recent. The food at Ross J's is comfort island food to me. Here, you can get pretty much the same dishes that the rest of the Hawaiian joints have. But here, the prices are cheap and the portions are huge. We arrived one early evening for a quick dinner with friends. I ended up getting their Loco Moco and Portuguese Sausage Masubi. Total came to about $7, which is a steal. Both were full of favor and did I mention the servings? My Loco Moco had enough rice that was drenched in gravy, topped with eggs, and complimented with two hamburger patties. If I'm in the area, specifically in this side of Henderson, I now know where to go if I'm craving some comfort food at a great deal. Loco Moco: yelp.com/user_local_phot... Portuguese Sausage Masubi: yelp.com/user_local_phot...

AnKkAGQCnvyhJF9jL8SQ6A.text: Slow and disorganized service. Make sure to call your order in for priority service over customers who are in the restaurant.

6BnvZ5GH8jcx132UbrYGSw.text: This place is da go to for local food! They have bowls starting at 3.50 for a regular chicken bowl, menehune plate lunch, n regular size plate lunches! I always come here to get my fix of Loco moco, hamburger steak, Mahi Mahi, and chicken katsu.  I'm being different and gonna try da roast pork wit gravy! Mouth watering The wait time on to go orders was crazy. Call your order in! Super bummed on the mahi... shanghai lumpia is delicious tho

t-AvnNkuAi70YWfgy8bMrw.text: Stopped here for take out, and Ross j's always settles my hawaiian food needs. The staff is always friendly and accommodating.   I ordered spicy korean chicken plate, a side of mac Salad and a side of kimchi. The food is always well prepaired and delicious.    This is my go to hawaiian restaurant.  I would recommend coming here forsure! The only critic I can give them is they need more locations!

fo4qTnp7hOotZhA8nJCaRw.text: the food is good and the lady is a good person but she does the work of 3 people. that makes the service very slow.

3zXxVEqK73DVlXjulFjcjQ.text: Damn, this place is good!!! Their kim-chi is a must. I just can't stop craving the Kahlua Pig and Spicey Korean Chicken. My only complaint is that they close too darn early

Y196E0O79unwg9sfy9OLfg.text: My family has been customers for a few years, but this restaurant has taken a turn for the utter worst with the rudest staff and the worst customer service. While visiting for dinner the wait was tremendous with an extremely rude server. He kept calling me, "bro" and never apologized for the long wait, but what made it worse was his blatant disregard for the customers waiting in line. Instead of servicing the customers waiting he was adjusting menus and you could verbally hear him making continual comments to the staff in the back.   Finally when he got to us he gave us a dead look, and after we made a comment about the wait his first response was, "are you giving me attitude bro?" I was floored by this extremely vulgar and rude response. All I had asked was if he was ready to take our order, I had been waiting for 15 minutes with only two customers in front of me. What made the issue worse was that my Father who was using a cane due to his recent surgery was forced to stand while waiting.   During the confrontation this "server" who chose not to serve the customers began to say, "hey at least I'm workin', can't you see how busy I'm workin', you should learn to wait and be patient.. etc." Never once did he apologize, instead he continued to berate me as if I was a hebetudinous customer. This pernicious approach made my extended family and myself feel extremely uncomfortable, with even my grandparents who are regulars leave disgusted and sickened.   I teach and have worked in mental institutions, my job relies on patience. His aggression made my family leave. I left a note to the manager who was not working, only to not receive a call back or a formal apology. This extremely poor service should be noted, I will no longer recommend this restaurant to anyone ever again. The place is unwelcoming, extremely unfriendly, and their unorthodox "service" will make you leave. Never support his establishment, and please never recommend this restaurant to anyone you know.

TkPGrAvdDhTo5Xp50WOnPA.text: I was actually visiting from San Diego, CA and the only hawaiian food we have is L&L's.. I stepped into this place because of the reviews on yelp and not to my surprise... Its busy. Chicken katsu was sold out which I found..odd but, I figured it was because it was good. The gentlemen helping me recommended the garlic chicken with gravy. I ordered that along with musubi and literally, best fucking hawaiian food I've ever had. I wish I had more macaroni salad.

QBt3AkXnlTpvhpTtcv1eUA.text: Hawaiian cuisine is a fusion of all of my favorite cuisines - American, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Polynesian and Portuguese.  In theory, I should love Hawaiian food but 5-6 times that I've tried it, the dishes I've ordered were more miss than hit.  So I was really hoping, the food at Ross J's Aloha Grill would change that. It didn't.  I ordered Loco Moco and BF got fried mahi-mahi plate.  Filipino style Loco Moco is one of my favorite dish.  The dish consist of rice, hamburger patties with brown gravy topped with fried egg, sunny side up.  Really simple dish but with such big flavor if done right.  Unfortunately, the gravy was so bland it didn't taste anything.  I added soy sauce but it just wasn't the same.  Other yelpers were raving about their Loco Moco so maybe we came at a wrong time?  The fried mahi-mahi was all right.  It was a little greasy.  BF said he likes L&L better.

757zT8xyrKmaGpb8prTB0Q.text: I have never in my 24 years of life thought any establishment other than McDonald's put drugs in their food until i came to Ross Js. I swear I have become a fiend for their spicy korean chicken with extra sauce. its to the point where i will leave my house early for work just so i can stop and get my spicy korean chicken fix. I wish they were open later so i could eat it when i get off work. But i mean really the portion size is very filling and its beyond cheap[$4.05 for a chicken bowl come on not even subway can beat that]. personally i have tried the other stuff on the menu but me being such a picky eater that didnt go over so well but i will always come back for my chicken bowl with extra sauce.

JEG4AoJ2p3zXsyjHGeKAfA.text: Been living for here for about 6 yrs now & have heard about this place many times & just now I've tried it.  Went for lunch w/ the hubby after a doctors appointment & it's a good thing we beat the lunch rush!! As soon as we sat down after ordering & waited for our food to come, a swarm of people just filled the place in minutes! WHOA!!! I mean the line literally went out the door!  I ordered the menehune kalua pig w/ cabbage plate & hubby ordered the meat jun plate.  My plate was pretty good.  At least the kalua pig w/ cabbage tasted how it's suppose to.  =) I've tried other places, for example, Aloha Kitchen, doesn't make it too good.  Neither does L & L's.  The mac salad was a little too peppery for my taste.  I tried my hubby's meat jun & the meat was pretty tough.  I didn't like it at all.  I do plan on going back when I have the chance to try their other dishes.  Overall, the staff was real nice & the place was clean.  The menu had a lot to choose from.  Pricing was reasonable, about $8 & under from what I saw.

ZI2Sznz4VDzcMWX5NuX_uw.text: First of all, the servings are huge!  I can usually get 2-3 meals out of an order, especially if it's a large order.  So far I have had the kalua pork and katsu chicken.  Although the kalua pork was a little salty for my taste (I'm not a huge salt fan), I enjoyed both dishes.  I always substitute the fried rice - it is very flavorful.  I can't put my finger on what it is, but the macaroni salad has a unique flavor to it.  I enjoy it, but my mother was not a fan (more for me!).  My only complaint about this place is that they often have a large list of items that they are out of, but I guess you know that everything is fresh that way.  I'm a fan.

5HOkjKbxh6smGSBN2EH2dA.text: All I can say is that this is my number one  hawaiian food spot! Spicy combo bowl is the best as well as their loco moco!! Service is very personable and I always feel homey when I come here!! I love Ross Js!!

qwf12YiHq_c4eMi86-M10w.text: Did I order the wrong thing? Or maybe it was an off day? I feel a bit bad for giving them two stars, but honestly: "Meh. I've experienced better."   Chicken katsu had skin on every piece, the oil tasted a little off, and they left in a bunch of lousy bits on the meat. My mother was actually gagging from one of the pieces. I pulled off a bunch of inedible things but otherwise managed to finish the rest. What I didn't finish was the macaroni salad, which didn't taste as good as what I'm accustomed to.  Portion size was about what I've come to expect from Hawaiian places for this price. Service was pleasant. Ambiance was mostly hole-in-the-wall, and I feel like I made a mistake sitting under the kinda loud and tinny mono speaker in the ceiling.  We ended up going somewhere else after this meal and paying for some better food to clean the palate. Too bad.

71FEedhE9Bh9nESDKzvSnA.text: Been going to Ross J's for over 10 years and everything I've tried there is delicious. My personal fav is spicy Korean chicken and meat jun. The meat jun sauce is crazy good! Ross J's never disappoints!!

Z0P53liWWfRHXPVGdrVp7w.text: Large portions, enough food for multiple meals. Ordered the Hawaiian Plate with kalua pork. Yum. Awesome prices! Friendly service.   Would definitely visit again if in town.

tt_9IjLoRb6jp-WHUt0lzg.text: Local strip mall dive filled with Hawaiian transplants, seemingly authentic.  The meat jun and Korean chicken combo was pretty tasty.  The mac salad was weirdly spiced though.  Good grub overall.

d6M8ch4ZdcbWX6m20Mpt1A.text: I can't get enough of Ross J's!! Definitely the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas period!!! Their beef stew is my favorite but my husband will tell you they have the best spamisubi! Great prices too if your on a budget!! The staff always has the Aloha spirit and the food is awesome!! Keep up the good work!!

W0RG6CX90aZbPOCI-FSHtw.text: This place is really good for lunch. They would get a five star review from me if they were just a little more consistent. The food is amazing when they get it right. The prices are affordable and the employees are sweet. Just a little more attention to detail when customers ask for skinless chicken.

kkqpV6owKU-a6Oz7QrCGzA.text: Great spot , nothing beats a little local food joint ! A lot of people been telling me of this place over the last couple months and I decided to go check them out and let me say not bad !

HKW_s13U-UaDbuobI20wuw.text: I really like this place for lunch on gym days or when ever I'm craving teriyaki chicken, beef stew or loco moco...but mainly teriyaki chicken.  On days I'm going to the gym, I load-up with the chicken teriyaki and rice...with an extra side of chicken to be mixed in, and it all comes to about $5. If I order a chicken teriyaki bowl or plate from somewhere else with extra chicken, it generally comes out to $7 or more. So it's a great deal here. And tasty...not overdone with sauce.

2PyfzVgEAuPAI4aebpvqgg.text: I'd like to start by saying that I think that giving Ross J's a 3.5/5 is more accurate than a 4, but I'd rather round up than down.  I asked the server what she recommended and she guided me towards the spicy Korean chicken. I'll break down my experience there for you.  Ambiance: The place had a family-owned vibe that worked for it. That said, it did feel a little grimy. I think they'd benefit from updating some of the booths or re-paneling the walls. It tips it over the edge of homey to slightly dirty.   Food: The spicy Korean chicken came with white rice, pan fried chicken, and mac salad. The chicken was pretty darn tasty and had a nice crispy char to it. It wasn't spicy in the slightest, but I can let that slide since it was still quite enjoyable. If I get it again, I'll definitely ask for a bit more kick. The mac salad was...interesting. It was seasoned with a generous helping of white pepper that was a bit overpowering. It gave it a unique flavor that I enjoyed, but I don't think it's anything to write home about. It worked well with the rest of the plate but I don't think it could stand on its own.  Service: The waitress/cashier was amicable enough, but they were clearly short staffed. We had to wait a good 10 minutes at the counter while she dashed around trying to get people their food.   Price: It was a little over $8 after tax. Definitely a cheap eat for the quality.  Overall, I'll definitely be going back their to try some of their other dishes. The food tasted very authentic. which sets it apart from a lot of the other Hawaiian restaurants in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

K8guVFuPZ-rchrlLFR0cjw.text: Another Great Hawaiian BBQ Spot here in Vegas. I can honestly say that the Vegans are spoiled with these places!! Thats A Real Good Thing!!   Combination of Meat Jun and Mochiko: The main reason why I came here was to try their Meat Jun. I wasn't aware that another place other than my current favorite Haw. BBQ spot, "Island Style" was offering this dish. Well, the first time I had this I was Impressed and was absolutely hooked! Well, the Ross J version was a larger portion buy not by much, it was tender but not fall apart tender, egg batter was nearly identical in flavor but wasn't as fluffy and a bit oily. Their dip was also on the Spicy side which I did appreciate much with the meat. I would say "Island Style" edges out for the win but I'd have Ross J's any day of the week.   The Mochiko was something I've never had and actually the teller convinced me to try this over the spicy korean chicken (I love "Island Flavor" korean chicken). Well, the Mochi flour used to give this chicken dish its uniqueness was Awesome!! Tasty, Chewy and Kinda Crunchy!!  Plate came with a good amount of white rice and their Macaroni Salad had an evident sour creamy flavor rather than just the plain creamy mayo that plenty places serve it as. I liked their take on this one.  Spam Musubi: Typical and Just Comforting! I Love Spam!  Chill Atmosphere and Employees, Good Prices, Great Food!! No Complaints Whatsoever..

G1EwvFOYY49ZIBHPNS202A.text: AMAZING! Everyone in there is just super friendly and the food is AMAZING! There are days when I eat here for breakfast then do a quick run for lunch. I'd have to say that the spicy Korean chicken bowl is one if my favorites. If I'm in the mood for beef I always get teriyaki beef bowl with onions and mushrooms. Ross J's just has so many choices that there is always something new. I would definitely recommend eating here! Fast. Friendly. And good. What more could someone want?

VRmn6E0YaYDlxw3oaQnxTQ.text: This review is solely for the spam musubi, but I definitely want to come back and try their other menu items. Judging from the line at 12 pm, this place is quite popular with the locals. Customer service 5/5, prices 5/5, and spam musubi 10/5!!! I've had some pretty bad spam musubi in my life, so it's not often that I find a place that makes one of the best spam musubis I've had in a long time. The ratio of rice, seaweed, and that slightly sweet sauce that they add into the musubi is so perfectly balanced in taste. I'm sooo lucky this location is right next to my school. Spam musubi all day errryday! There is just something about Hawaiian food out in Las Vegas that has yet to disappoint me :D

XWZoqzmBO7Zbrk4IUWRvQQ.text: Love love love this place. Great prices. We cant get enough. My husband always get the loco moco with over easy egg, now he get the Portuguese sausage loco moco. I always want both a loco moco and the teriyaki chicken bowl add broccoli and extra sauce. My kids love both the dishes and the spam musubi.

EBuDxJsOY2tFojM_HrxqyQ.text: Food is DELICIOUS, and staff is friendly!!!  This place could easily be 5 stars but here are some of the issues holding them back:  1. The debit or credit card machine takes longer than most other businesses. 2. They keep running out of food. I have to have a backup plan for my wife and I whenever I get the dreaded "Sorry we sold out of _____". This happens so often, they have a white board to write down what sold out from the menu. 3. They can probably manage the cashier line better. It is faster to call an order in from the back of the wait line, then it is to wait in line and place your order. 4. I'd like to see some desserts added to the menu.

akgL1XCxQOyRrKiT0dR1VA.text: AMAZING!! The best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, the spicy Korean chicken bowl is the best and for under $5?? You can't beat it! I also love their saimin, I always add spam and veggies. They always have Hawaiian sun and the cookies are so good!! Love the shortbread, almond and chocolate chip Mac nut. Worth the wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

YCBqaJ_1FbYNlLOfuDzD6A.text: Been here a million times.  One of the best local Hawaiian food restaurants.  Yes they get busy and should have more help.  This is the kind of place it's worth it to wait.  It would be nice to change up the decor but at the same time no because it reminds me of home.

K96VYW_53X71xj601dCoKg.text: Great food, at least the teriyaki and spicy beef bowls. If you order over the phone, make sure you talk to someone who knows what's going on. The new employee is terrible.

cWYke8syPTr5kBnmm9GyoA.text: Small little place by my job but was super busy. Couldn't decide what to eat so decided to check this place out.  I ordered the mini katsu chicken plate.  The mac salad was delicious and creamy. The chicken katsu was cooked perfect and it was nice and crispy.  Glad u made thus stop and will be back to get the loco moco plate and try their spam Musasbi.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. The mini plate was the perfect size and a great price

RHRrWcn1id0dhU1fhuGxrQ.text: This is the second time that Ive eaten here.  This time we ordered the chicken plate, mini Kalua pig, Ross J's special pack and the spicy Korean chicken.  First let me say that from the time we entered the place to the time we left, there was always a line to order. The person who took our order at the counter was the same person who was taking out the food. Not sure if that was the reason for the long wait in line. The dinning room was on the smaller side, about 10-15 tables. As crowded as it was there always seemed to be at least one table open.   Now for the food. We came here because of the fried chicken challenge that yelp has going on. So, the chicken was ok-good. I liked the crispy skin that it had. It could have been crispier but I liked it. The chicken itself didn't seem to have much flavor. My wife liked the chicken better than I did. It reminded her of the chicken she used to get growing up. My favorite thing to do is to take the skin and make a little boat out of it and load it up with rice and furikake. YUMMY! ( see picture) I would eat a whole plate of that if I could order it. Would I get it again? Yeah why not. Would I get it if I was craving good fried chicken? Probably not.  The mac salad was on par, which is good.   The Kalua pig and cabbage. My son is a kalua pig aficionado. He loves the stuff. I ordered him the mini expecting to see it disappear in a few minutes. To my surprise he had only eaten about half. The kalua pig did seem a little dry.  My wife tried it and she wasn't a fan.   Up next is the Ross J's special pack. It had fried chicken, Teri steak, mahi-mahi, spam, mac salad and rice with furikake. The chicken is the same as on the chicken plate. The Teri steak, I liked how it wasn't dried out and tough like it is at most places so that part is good. I don't really care when they cook it and just plop sauce on the top. That's just me. The mahi-mahi was so small that you could eat the entire thing in one bite if you wanted to. The spam was a nice thick piece. Overall it was a good plate to order.   Lastly the side order of spicy Korean chicken. It tasted to me like it was a nicely cooked piece of chicken drowned in spicy soy sauce. I didn't  like it at all. It might be good if all that was dumped over a mountain of rice. Oh yeah I'm sure that would be good but as I ordered it, no Bueno.   I must admit that when I went there I felt like I was transported back to Hawaii. It definitely had a back home feel for me and we did enjoy our meal. If you go order the green river.

sJ__tHmAQGszu5NsInbleA.text: Cheap good food for students. Quality is definitely lackin, most of the chicken is skin, but still tasty.   Food 4/5 Service 5/5 Atmosphere 3/5  Recommend the spicy Korean chicken

1U3CoSfUJy39NUP8c7Bmhw.text: I love Hawaiian food, this place isn't all that bad. There are some problems though. 1) they are slow at the registers and the line gets long around 6pm when I was here it was reaching the door. 2) because they are in a hurry to fill orders I believe they cook the food fast and because of that it's extra greasy.  Some good things. The prices are very cheap and affordable but to each there own this is what I experienced here for my first time.

Mn__Zzj-2PyP5kF-KZBJJQ.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian place to go to! Sometimes there's a wait but the food is always worth it, started coming here over 8 years ago. Prices are incredible. I've been getting the chicken teriyaki rice bowl, always been filling with leftovers and it's under $4! Amazing macaroni salad too!

hcVXDN6bg8y4wWbCqaMbEA.text: Good, really cheap Hawaiian/ Filipino eats... if you're doing takeout, make sure to check that you have everything, they sometimes forget things like the sauce on the Korean chicken.  Also, the Korean chicken spice level varies (from not spicy to very spicy) every visit so you may want to tell them to put the sauce on the side or tell them your spice level.  The crispy chocolate chip macadamia cookies they have are yummy and made by the grandma.

x3lqmVkWwjUM8rxJLaYRZw.text: Only 3.60 for a teriyaki bowl. Nuff said. You're not gonna get that good of a price anywhere else. They give you big portions.

blfaT4w_D-VCAoJbTY-acg.text: Great food and great prices!  Definitely a gem in the rough of all these Aloha grills 5 Stars!!

m3LIbYqDvbwUqd_b0miQFw.text: Fuego. If you've never been there what are you doing right now thats preventing you from quality food for unbeatable prices? Sometime I ask myself did G-D know this place was gonna open someday when he created the world. Ive been going here for 7 years and my first experience hasnt outdated my most recent. I get the simple Teriyaki chicken bowl (spicy is not spicy)  or teri-chicken sandwich.   Say no more.

SLqBKTsMGxuTsBdOpx755w.text: I'm new to the area and have eaten here a few times now and the food is really really good! But there are days when try to eat there and they always say the wait is 35 minutes? WTF? I understand that you're busy but there should be no reason that the wait time is the that long! Also 1 Day I was eating there and they keep the phone off the hook so if you're trying to call in an order, you're not going to get thru. Some extra cooks or wait help would help this place move a lot smoother. Or at least tell people in line about the wait instead of letting people stand in line for 10 minutes then when they get to the front, you let them know it'll be a 35 minute wait? Come on, common sense.

B6xfZL9MiZRlRZbGbWVFfg.text: Best bang for your buck.  I'm split on giving this place 4 stars or 5 stars because of its price!  Quantity is huge and taste is great!  This place is super casual, food comes packed with flavor and the rice is so good!  How is it so good?!!!   For 3 giant meals with spam musubi the total came out to under $22!  They're owned by the same people as Aloha Specialties at California Casino, but portions here are larger and cheaper...and there's more variety!  I'll definitely come back.  We ordered take out and within 10 minutes, it was ready!  We got the chicken katsu, spam musubi, loco moco, and garlic chicken.  Garlic chicken was dark meat and packed tons of flavor with lots of brown gravy!  The chicken katsu was white meat with such amazing crispness from the first to last bite and the sauce was so bomb.  The loco moco could have benefitted from having the eggs cooked a little less (it was take out, so may have gone from easy over to medium in our car ride) and could have used more sauce.  The hamburger patty was a lil dry also.  Also, the rice is so good!    The venue itself is moderate size with enough seats for about 15 people.  It looks a little worn down, but definitely attracts many Hawaiians so their food does the work for them, as it should be.  Overall, such a steal for the taste, quality, and quantity.  We'll definitely come back and hope everyone tries this place too!

q1al_gY6_x1789XsCh2qIQ.text: Ono grindz on the cheap? Ross J's is the place! Friendly service, enormous portions, and really good food.  I stopped by here with Mel C and Terri R after checking out the lights at Ethel M's - it's located just around the corner, in the plaza with Smith's.   I got a rice bowl with teriyaki beef, and added veggies for $1.50; my total came to less than $9 with my meal and a fountain drink. Lots of veggies, not too salty, and the beef was really tender.  Great place to grab dinner before checking out Ethel M's or seeing a movie at the Galaxy Theatre, also nearby.

ZICdMp6FqtMbV16htc9nzw.text: Ross J's Aloha Grill is a fantastic place place to fulfill any Hawaiian dish craving. They serve bigger portions and give a lot of rice in their dishes. I love rice so I really appreciate it!  The best thing about this place is their value. You get a great meal for $5-$8 and it's portioned bigger so that you actually get full!  It can get busy during peak hours aka lunch or dinner time, but you can always call in for takeout! If they don't answer, it's probably because they are slammed!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget sriracha!

p_1qQpX5z75kmVJU6LDA1g.text: Good portions for the price you pay.  The rice appears to be an excessive amount, but I finished it. The spicy Korean chicken is the way to go here.  Lightly battered chicken, special mildly spiced with hints of teriyaki mix.  The meat jun wasn't bad, but I wouldn't know what to change about it either.  I was being really indecisive and Auntie at the cashier was so patient and nice, trying to offer me suggestions.  Lucky there was no crowd, but minutes later that all changed.   The food came out quick, delicious and satisfying.  Get you island fix here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Kimchi, spicy Korean chicken bowl, meat jun plate were all ono.

Yt8cAtLb_4zdYIh2b-_V_w.text: so Ono!  I wish I found this place sooner...  love the kalua pig ... so flavorful and love that you can combo anything on their menu!   only downfall they need more staff... counter person does register, phones, orders, serves and busses.   waited 45 min in line once tryin to pay for my phone order that was sitting on the counter bc the line was out the door.

NNTGb3tRbPEdDe9PKYBD3A.text: Our go to for Hawaiian food, their portions are massive and food is bomb diggity af. The prices are amazing for what you get. I usually get the Korean spicy plate with half fried chicken so goooood!!!!

Mxv5tTEYKP5IToz9HQdW4Q.text: i wish I could try something other than the Korean Chicken, Saimin or Loco Moco, but its just too good. I have had the fried rice, which is also excellent. Im a creature of habit.  The service is always good. I feel Hawaiian just walking in the joint & the people who work there are always very nice to me & make me feel welcome.  I always leave full & still have money left.  I always wanted to try it for breakfast & hopefully one day I will

B9uLkyFTygJmDwnrhmfLaw.text: This was so good and the prices were great as well. The food was very flavorful and just overall delicious. My Hawaiian was happy so it passed the test !

byWMKlZkfA-0S1fOcBJr-A.text: This place is bad service and over rated they also over cook my food and I told them about it and they just took it away and gave me nothing back.. I said i want my refund and she the cashier walk away ...

Z7WIzgQVBQ5P7fnCFsnfvQ.text: Super cheap, super good, authentic Hawaiian food. I took some friends from the island there, and they said it's a good as they get back home! Hard to go wrong at Ross J's

ON3lQlcmSct7d3yiTVaMfw.text: Ross j's never lets me down! Great food. Great customer service. Spicy Korean chicken bowl is the best!

uxytZSfwBjzFnB9ayx7zjg.text: Let me clarify that Before coming to Ross Js i have never tried Hawaiian food at all. This place was recommended to me by my girlfriends brother(who is a "usual") about 3 years ago and i took his word for it and gave it a try. Ever since then I've been coming here every time I'm by this area...EVERY TIME. My all time favorite from this place is the Spicy Korean chicken bowl. The chicken is very juicy and the sauce they cook it in...wow! words cant really explain how flavorful it is. The white rice is cooked perfectly and definitely compliments every dish you get it with. I've been recommending this place to everybody i know and they've all loved it. After so long i have finally wrote a review and I guess the only con is that it set my standards very high, because i have tried other Hawaiian places and this place is without a doubt above them in terms of taste and quantity.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. You can also eat it for breakfast !

ONA4aU0iUHCk3rdbqeroDQ.text: Dude, where's my extra Macaroni salad? Boom.com Everything is good except that weird pink hotdog thing. Always full of Hawaiians, too legit to quit. It gets a little pricey but who the hell can complain when shit is so good!!!

f6uNH8C0b5MIdSFbZCd2pw.text: Ross J specials are delicious both my kid and I had it. The amount of food is generous neither of us could finish it in one sitting. We got in there just at 12pm the lunch crowd got heavy after we ordered thank goodness LOL. We will definitely be back, it's one of the best places to get Hawaiian deliciousness :)

iV_Gc0HUmaGq_xtmFH1fmg.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.   Big portions reasonable prices. If you go during lunch hours, during the week, it get a little busy but definitely worth the wait.   I usually do the Ross Js Special Pack it's a BIG plate so usually don't finish it all.   Spicy Korean is great as well.   They have poke Friday's so If I'm there on a Friday I do the Poke.  Also, the Red punch goes good with any meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Ross J&#39;s special pack. (Teri chix, Mahi, fried chix, spam, rice and macaroni salad) $8.95

t82W5-DS3tJ38gaW--xHBw.text: Love this place! When you're short on money, this place will stretch your dollar and fill your belly with yummy food.   Our all time favorite is the spicy Korean chicken bowl with added veggies for under 5 dollars. Enough for 2 meals for me. Oh, please note...it's not actually spicy. Don't know why it's called that.  We've also had the ross j special; it's a combo plate of teriyaki beef stake, spam, fried chicken, breaded and fried mahi mahi with rice and scoop of macaroni salad for 8.95. Filled me and my husband up. While everything was good, not amazing. I always regret not getting my fav. Spicy Korean

x639cJdMVaSOM6XllaJQ_Q.text: Came in on 09/10/16 for dinner at 6:00pm , the cashier in the front is so sweet. Service was awesome! The food was on point as well. I got that Aloha bento , and of course it came with redondo's hot dog, my faaaaavorite !!

yLJ3yNoTuxXsHyhYtUojmw.text: Spicy Korean chicken bowl is awesome! Friendly staff, great service. Love this place. Definitely worth the drive every time. I have never been disappointed eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Awesome food

mMhqBnDhb3lgK_oDN7MyMg.text: Ross J's why must you be so far away from me?!  This has definitely been one of the better Hawaiian plces I have been to. Definitely reminds of someplace I might find in Ewa Beach or maybe even Pearl City. I have been wanting to come here forever & was finally in the neighborhood having my car serviced & happened to go with my boy Darren S. who lives on this side of town & is from Hawaii.  The service is great & the auntie behind the counter is really sweet & makes me miss Hawaii all that much more, not to mention the food. The Loco Moco with Portugese sausage was HUGE & on point. Very filling! The mac salad is also pretty decent. I am kind of picky when it comes to mac salad & have been disappointed by a lot of places here. Personally, I like mine the best ;) But everyone has their preferences, right? Oh & the prices...Chee Hu!! They can get no righter :P  Definitely my pick for Hawaiian on this side of town!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmm...Portuguese sausage Loco Moco!

M93i-00KlzG5I89ROOu_XA.text: I try not to ever give bad reviews but this has to be the worst place I've ever gone to for local food. We patiently waited while a lady in front of us made a huge catering order and the other girl working kind of wandered around. That's fine we can wait. 15 minutes later we order, sit down, wait, get our food. My mom's order was wrong so we took it back and they fixed it. My mom thought her roast pork were bad pieces because it was kind of fatty and just didn't taste good at all. My Teri beef bowl was flavorless and I could just taste how bad the pieces of meat were. We got up and the back of my mom's white pants were stained because they didn't clean the seats. Very disappointing.

14JJHedSa0FEoMjGc4CNZA.text: This is probably my favorite place for Hawaiian food in town and has never disappointed me when I come to eat as well as their pickup is quick when you need that good Hawaiian food on the go, definitely somewhere you should try if you love Hawaiian

hGsDoHu8idQHKbFn2Le8KQ.text: The service kind of sucked. It's my first time here and the line was until the door... like I would expect it to be faster but it was not. The lady at the register had to clean the tables and give forks out & didn't bother saying to us that she will be right back.. why couldn't the other girl give the forks out when she gives the food at the same time... also instead of the other girl waiting for the Togo food to come out she could at least look at other tables that are needed to be cleaned and wiped down... I ordered a chicken Teri bowl, comb bowl w/ so icky Korean chicken and a spicy Korean chicken bowl & a side of kimchee... my bowl came like 5 mins later while the other two had been received ... the rice was hard & it wasn't enjoyable.. the spicy chicken wasn't even spicy, so why call it spicy? I don't understand... there are much more better Hawaiian places that serve better quality in their food... the bowls and cheap and all but the quality is what matters.. I mean if it took so long to get to table I would think that it should be enjoyable to eat... I've worked at an aloha fast food and the service I had done was different than theirs.. the other girl had her hair down and her hair was passed her butt.. unsanitary & never coming back!

vvtgBBnKovPL55EsegpOCA.text: Today was my first visit there, and upon entering, I immediately fell in love. The setting is reminiscent of the L&L's back home but cleaner & more crowded lol. The lady at the front counter was sweet and friendly. The menu itself is mind-blowing.  I ordered a menehune kalua pig plate and a loco moco to go. I devoured that kalua pig like it was my last day on earth. It was so good. I've had better back home of course because this one was somewhat dry, but it still had that flavor, you know? Plus, I've been extremely homesick lately, and it sorta hit the spot.   I ate the loco moco just now, & I am not disappointed. It also hit the spot, but again, of course I've had better back home (but that's besides the point). It was still amazingly good.  Finally, the number one reason why I will be coming here often is because they have green river juice with unlimited refills!!! They labeled it as "lime soda", which I guess is what it is, but damn, it tastes JUST LIKE HOME :) I didn't see any lilikoi or orange bang, but they had what I think was fruit punch and other fountain drinks that you could also get unlimited refills on.   This is the only "Hawaiian" restaurant other than L&L that I've tried here in Vegas, but I'm sticking to it for now because it's close to where I live, and the food and service are excellent.

bYH5BXRXnfbPJ-tPBcSiIA.text: Life isn't a beach. It's a chicken bowl from Ross J's! Ross J's is hella cheap, hella tasty and the service is hella friendly. Total island vibe I am feelin' up in here. I could roll up all sweaty from the gym (which I have), roll out of bed with drool crust on my face (which I haven't) and I think the people would still be cool to me. They treat everyone like family. Hell, half the people there probably are related! GRUB ON THIS: It's all about the Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl for $3.65. No, it's not that spicy, but it's moist and action packed with Hawaii 5-O flavor. Yes, the chicken has skin so I try to pick most of it off. The portion sizes are for sumo wrestlers and circus elephants so it can no joke feed me for 2.5 meals. Do add extra veggies for $1.10 more. I've also had the lumpia and although it is fried to perfection the guts just seem flavorless and not worth the extra fat and calories in my opinion. The chicken bowl alone is a mouthwatering meal not worth missing. PEEP THIS: yelp.com/biz_photos/SueE... FYI: Take it from me. Takeout can be REALLY messy. The savory sauce MAY leak onto your leather car seat. Since it is 198 degrees outside here in Africa, Nevada you may want to keep an extra beach towel and swimsuit in your car. The towel will come in REAL handy about now. (The swimsuit is for spontaneous pool parties and/or mud wrestling.) Ross J's is saving lives one bowl at a time, people. If you can't afford to take DA PLANE DA PLANE to the islands to get your Aloha on well whip out your board shorts and flip-flops and roll up here. It doesn't get cooler than this.
