u7i1IP8pirHWmEcO3RwW7A.text: I am a big fan of Ross J's. It's become a Friday tradition amoung my fellow co-workers and myself, to enjoy this great Hawaiian cusiune. Especially enjoyable as a "hang-over" remedy and a much better option than the over greased burgers at most fast food establishments. The sauces are made to perfection! Proportions are good, but as many stated before me, less rice more meat would make it that much better (?). The service is fast and friendly. Check this place out, trust me

emOYlpu9pV8TnooWpVt2xA.text: This very down-to-earth Hawaiian joint have a good selection of Hawaiian food. Their prices are unbeatable and the portions are huge, so it's a great deal. I would stop by if I'm on the Henderson side, but don't think will be making the trip from Summerlin just for the food. It's a bit too salty and MSG-filled for me.

_EvaQ2ovMsI-9oj1XOrXMw.text: We usually go to Aloha Specialties at the California whenever we are in Vegas, but my friend recommended we try this place because the food was pretty similar and the lines are not as long. My girlfriend and I split spicy Korean chicken, katsu, musubis, and a small saimin. The food did taste pretty similar which is a good thing because I love the food at Aloha Specialties. If you plan on ordering saimin, I would recommend a small unless you are really hungry because if a small is what I ordered, I could only imagine how big the large is. Also, be sure to check out the Kool-Aid dispenser next to the soda fountains. Kool-Aid!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Korean spicy chicken, &#34;small&#34; saimin, musubi, and katsu.

SMR9Up4NTGVvzrrVw2podA.text: I got spam and eggs and rice.  I know its nothing big, but I have it at a lot of other places and this was just blah.. I could have totally made it better at home.  My friends said the bowls they got were pretty good, but I just wasn't impressed.  I would rather go to the Cal hotel and get oxtail there or topselog filipino breakfast.   Now that is what I call Yumm.

VzXM_z1H0hod7yJielegDg.text: Tried them out for a Sunday lunch, and wasn't disappointed. As you might have deduced from the storefront, they are a real mom and pop, hole in the wall sort of place-- prime target for Yelping!   The interior has a decently sized area for seating if you so choose. I suppose dining out might be a nice experience as well but they seem to get lots of take out business from regulars. That's another thing...you'll probably see a lot of regulars in line ahead of you. That sort of following counts for something. The lady at the counter was friendly and helpful-- no complaints there.   We ordered some pretty standard staples; the chicken teriyaki with vegetables and the spicy korean chicken bowls. The "bowl" is simply a smaller version of the plate. Considering the portion sizes of their plates, the bowl orders were more than enough food for us, but if you are a hefty eater you may opt for the whole nine yards. I was a tad disappointed but hardly surprised to find that they don't offer brown rice. This is an AUTHENTIC Hawaii style eatery and the options will reflect that. That's not to say that they don't do some unique things here--the menu has many interesting choices on it that I will no doubt be back to try, including a beef rib eye sandwich and Hawaiian fried chicken. Hawaiian expats will certainly find themselves at home here.  As for our food, it definitely met expectations. The chicken teriyaki was not drenched in a nausea inducing amount of glaze like you might find at an L&L. Oh and if you haven't figured it out, this place blows them out of the water. Like seriously. The extra dollar for veggies was worth it but it would have been nice to have some broccoli thrown in there. That turns out to be a separate add on for another dollar. The spicy korean chicken bowl had a unique flavor to it but it could have done with a bit more kick...I felt I needed to add some Sriracha sauce to finish the job. Still, even with the extra money spent for veggies, this food is very competitively priced. You can  walk in with a five dollar bill and walk out full and satisfied. It may not be as healthy as a Teriyaki Boy franchise, (where you can get a low-carb bowl) but it is much tastier and worth driving out of your way for. This joint is a do.

jmqfjML4ump-xSKYc6eSTw.text: Spicy Korean Chicken bowl is my favorite for sure and i always get a side a macaronni salad. I do always check for the daily specials after one day trying the Lau Lau, it was mouth watering! They serve it every Friday. The staff is very friendly and helps answer any questions you have . Shaved ice on the weekends is a perfect ending to a great meal

j1VT2bOjnCNyGGjSGJMQrQ.text: FRIDAY= Hawaiian plate= KANAK ATTACK....ALL PAU....cannot breath no mo room. Came in hungry, left tired, but all teeth!! AUURITE!!

to9vt6RQXcc_Y2gD1Mml6A.text: Ohh Buddy where do I start, how about best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, no Waite better yet best Hawaiian food in the continental United States, Yha this is the authentic Hawaiian food you expect from the islands, ohh I just might be here for lunch and dinner today, I do recommend getting the beef bowl with gravy, add pork fried rice, and also add the mushrooms and onions, the gravy is soooooo good I can just drink it, I know I know that sounds nasty "drinking gravy" but who cares what you think this gravy is amazing!!! And you can make a sprunch (sprit and punch)

21ZcpvLCjGNyt7u0c7fthQ.text: Love this place.  Everytime i go here the food is good and the price is just right.  Good selection of local favorites too.

9K6GWXZWwzWUWcXX4wrOQA.text: Again, i ate the hawaiian plate this past Friday and everything was so ONO with lau lau,kalua cabbage, lomi salmon and looks like about 2 cups of rice on one big plate. Whew Cuz, after that lunch i came home and had to take a nap little while...so full and contented. Like i said before, this is the place to get your bang for the buck!! Much Mahalos and Aloha from the local boy here in Vegas, but still no can beat home.

OIDjZxf-Towi7lgRXHu4jg.text: Well, we TRIED to eat here today.  Upon walking in, we noticed that there was only one woman working.  The food looked amazing though so we got in line.  After standing there for nearly 15 minutes while the one woman bussed tables, fixed other customer's orders and cleaned, the guy in front of us gave up and left.  Now at the front of the line, we figured it wouldn't be too much longer.  We weren't acknowledged as the one employee continued to serve every other customer that walked up. She finally glanced at us several minutes later and gave us an apathetic "sorry" before continuing on.  After having waited nearly 25 minutes, we realized that even if we placed our order now, it would take way too long to receive it.  And so we too gave up, the second customer in a row to do so.  On our way out, I wished the next customer walking in good luck.  It's truly a shame, we would have loved to try the food.  It still looks amazing.  Perhaps if they hire more staff.

C3j358FdGOSyWg0F6CxQ6A.text: I just had to come back to this place after trying it last week. This review is for the food only. I seem to be always on the run. Dining in has not been an option for me... yet. Besides, they give you so much food that I doubt I could finish it all. I probably end up getting a doggie bag anyway. I tried a few different things this time   1. Meat Jun plate - Beef dipped in egg fried on the grill with a sweet semi-spicy sauce on the side. Pretty flavorful dish.   2. Portuges sausge with egg and rice - The breakfast of Hawaiian champions. !!!!  3. Tonkatsu (Pork) - Crunchy batter. Tender pork. You cannot eat this dish cold.They do not have the sauce with Worcestershire (like Aloha Kitchens) :-(  4. Fried chicken plate - crispy, tasty, flavorful fried chicken pieces. Tastes best when it is hot and sizzling. A little sweet teriyaki sauce will enhance and contrast the saltiness of this dish.  5. Ross J special - Teri Beef, Fried chicken, SPAM and Mahi -Mahi.  Warning: FOOD OVERLOAD. Make lots of room in your stomach because this will put a dent in it.   6. Spicy Korean chicken - You cannot go to Ross J's without ordering this dish. This is probably the best dish here!!!   Spicy Korean chicken to go please !!!!! Yummy!!!  Oh yeah...prps to the MAC salad. MAYO, Macaroni and more MAYO !!!

dymiAd7iRbX_pDQ9k8OzaA.text: This place is a frequent lunch stop by many of my coworkers. It's delicious, and the workers are friendly and they are reasonably priced. The teriyaki bowls are great as well as the kahlua pig and cabbage.

2jKiKbhMBWoWDBh1MbN8Cw.text: Best Hawaiian food in Vegas by far!!!! The mochico chicken and fried rice is a must!   The place is run by local ppl from Hawaii and not by Chinese ppl like L&L that's how you know food is done the right way.    The prices are pretty reasonable considering the amount of food you get on your plate.  On average $6 you get meat of your choice 2 scoops of rice (or for me i get the fried rice), and macaroni salad.    I highly recommend Ross J's to anyone from hawaii thats missing that island flavor and to everyone else willing to experience HAWAII'S VERSION OF "SOUL FOOD"!

JrqpWeNmfVb7nV134ft73w.text: Been eating at Ross Js for over 11 years. Every time I want rice & don't want to cook I go there. Always a good eat and great customer service. Spicy Korean chicken and butter fish is my favorite. But all of their food is Ono!!!

1RbF-t-WWQTvvi6WW_uBCg.text: Chicken Katsu was horrible. Over cooked & massive fatty chicken yuck.

f2GZbqoeVQgyBchAUqaetQ.text: I love this place! I try to eat there once a week. The food is amazing & the prices are cheap. My favorite dish is the kahlua pig & garlic chicken with brown gravy. My husband loves the chicken tonkatsu.

wrMAyyMEWs63D6vuu5OhRQ.text: Great place to get some local kine grindz in the 702!    Great selections of some hawaiian favorites. Great Location and Good Food. Fresh and flavorful. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Plus the portions are huge! 5 stars for that!

Qpf0yKLxD-Lgt_YHCgPykw.text: Ross J's Aloha Grill has the BEST Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  My personal favorites on the regular menu are chicken katsu, mahi-mahi, teriyaki chicken/beef, and fried chicken.  Their specials (which are not available everyday) are what I really love.  The specials I have enjoyed most are sweet-n-sour ribs (da best!!), chow fun, and french toast.  The prices are excellent and the portions BIG!  I make it a point to eat there whenever I get the chance.

njraEes0kJIARoARDAgjrg.text: This is my new favorite island food place. Great deals and great food. Plate lunches cost just as much as any other place but portions are twice as much. Def recommend it

_AWFtncY0urUEZxUsSExhw.text: I'm a regular at another nearby Hawaiian joint but thought I'd try something new.  Wasn't overly impressed walking in but the restaurant itself is not nearly as important as the food it serves.  Went with their signature plate the "Ross J Special" and I can't say there's anything to complain about.  Great flavors, very authentic, and stands out uniquely above other Hawaiian Grills. Might be my new go-to HI spot.

asNBRM46J8Mu286He9p_rg.text: Good food! My one complaint was Mac salad was sooooo salty! I usually whack it all up but was too darn salty. :( we had 2 Ross specials, fried noodles (too much veggies next time gonna ask for no veg) and cheeseburger for my son....they didn't have fries!!!  I was surprised....food was really tasty and the counter lady was nice! I would say easy 4 stars but knock down 1 cz too salty Mac and no fries.  We will return....hopefully they add fries to menu. :-)

WhLep11O7iCa-vAV3UV2fw.text: This place is probably OVERALL the best local plate lunch place in town, yes braddahs I know about the other places too, and the wanna be L&L and other "Hawaiian BBQs". Haha! Anyways, the Bento (Ross J Special) is the one to get if you're undecided from the semi big menu. You get Teri Beef, awesome Fried Chicken, Mahi, Spam with Furikake on da rice. The fact you can combo anything on the menu like Meat Jun and Hamburger Steak, Beef Stew and Kalua Pig, what else can you ask for? Good portions, all local atmosphere, no Asians only working and cooking with Chinese specials all over the menu, just the pride and joy of "Locals Only" here! And did I say I never had anything I didn't like here, and yes I've tried a lot of the menu without being disappointed. Only bad is they close early on Sunday's but that's a small complaint. So if you like Aloha Specialties at the California Hotel? You'll love this sister restaurant because of the same flavor, the same same Saimin but bigger menu and not as busy from all the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Sx1BB6Gcoh1pEeCE7HcGhg.text: staff is friendly,food comes out quickly,as I took mine to go, it seem to be pretty busy during lunch ,lots of easy parking.. And now to the food.. The macaroni had too much mayo and very ,very salty,it taste like just like all salt,yuck? The combo special has loads of rice and the different meats, and fish,but a heart attack waiting to happen..The Kuala pork was not bad,it was moist and tasty..My favorite thing that the prices were pretty reasonable for huge portions... But I probably not go out of my way to return here....

K7BnNwWIe5wFIRri6cxpUg.text: Delicious, warm, local. I crave this place every other week, even though it's a 25 minute drive from home. I love this place so much. You get so much food for such a small price. I usually get the teriyaki chicken, with a side of kimchi and a musubi to go. Boyfriend usually gets the roast pork because it's so soft. We usually eat there, or we take it to go and either eat at home, work, or drive 5 minutes west on Sunset road and eat at the park. Bought a musubi for my best friend and told me the style and flavors reminded her of the ones the make in Hawaii, so I guess it's pretty authentic.

Rd1kmGK-NhU3FaVttEHCNw.text: I'd rather give Ross J's a 3.5 star, but I'll choose 4 over only 3 because the staff was nice and we liked the Kalua pork. I wish someone had mentioned that you can get smaller plates because the size of the regular plates is a little bit "ginormous". Granted, the plate looks large beccause it is filled with white rice, but you also get two servings of the main dish.  1) The spicy korean chicken was decent. Very tender. Must be chicken thighs because it wasn't dry. It reminded me of the General Tso's chicken I've tried from authentic, good Chinese restaurants because it's battered, fried and has a sweet, tangy taste that's similar. Seemed a little salty to me, but the rice helped.  2) Kalua pork would be worth coming back from Texas to get. The cabbage seemed fresh and the taste was better than most pulled pork I've tried....and I've tried a lot of pulled pork. This was tender and a little more smoky. Not sure what the seasoning is, but it's dead on.  3) The macaroni salad is a lurking heart attack. Very....very, very creamy. I had to cut the creaminess with meat, rice, and anything I can get my hands on. It's not necessarily a complaint, but just a warning.  4) Kimchi was good. Price was under $2 to add it as a side. I also added the Spam sushi thing, which I liked because it was different. Spam was a little salty, but hey, it's Spam.  5) Mahi-mahi was fried, which seems like a waste. The fish could have been cod due to the lack of flavor. Definitely won't get again, but it wasn't horrible.   6) Meat Jun...not sure what the fuss is about. It seemed like cheap chicken fried steak meat inside in a omelet and cut in strips. Teriyaki sauce was too overpowering. To each his own.  7) Fruit punch. What's up with the Yelpers saying this is great? It's Hawaiian punch. I can get that from the convenience store. The grape punch...seemed like grape Kool-aid. I'll stick with water next time, but if you enjoy very sweet punch drinks, knock yourself out.  If we come back to Vegas, we're definitely coming back for the Kalua Pork. The noodles also looked really good.

wXJDZs6GN0Rsm8S0CQ3Dog.text: Forget about the spicy Korean chicken!!  Repeat after me..  Kalua pig. Kalua pig. Kalua pig.  The kalua pig was better than what I had in Maui.  The pork was so juicy and tender with hint of smoke, and it was mix with perfectly cooked cabbage which allows you eat the whole plate without the need for a drink.  I can not wait to get hungry again, so I can have more Kalua pig.  Kalua pig. Kalua pig. Kalua pig.

eRapQyte_J8kPWBGscHOcg.text: The food was just okay to me. Wish they put more vegetables. The meat wasn't very well marinated.   The boss lady was not very nice. We order carry-out food, but then decide to sit down and eat. She then walk to us and told us we're not allow to do that.

gl7Mv0jzoq-m71diJcOLxg.text: This place was really good I had the loco moca so good and my boyfriend had the Korean spicy chicken we were both very satisfied good price and a good amount of food we couldn't even finish it all

0B0VAry5gPLPOA20yjXlRQ.text: Great food and great prices! The Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl is my favorite. Large portions for low prices. Only 4 stars because of the dive atmosphere, but it's always clean and friendly, and you can't beat the food!!

-_-m8YjOmQTYNbZ-2mwhkA.text: This little restaurant was very good! Tried the Local Plate and Ross J's Special Plate. Both of these were very good! The fried chicken on the special was insane and the Spam Musubi was spot on. Overall atmosphere was casual and friendly. Would definitely come back here!

UsPvQZ7UuEotDWytOqwS5A.text: For the price, the quality  of the food and amount of food is pretty good. Did not expect to find a good hawaiian place in henderson. Lunch time specials are great. Currently a regular on this establishment since i work close by.

qoDpYOpGE8f4xflXYYIipA.text: Food,service,atmosphere feels like back home! the prices are just outrageous...cheap! I'm definitely going to be back!

0IEyIWLTHj7cLD5O-RIqpA.text: Good lau lau, kimche and poke.  I don't have to go to Hawaii just to have good Hawaiian food.  I'm very satisfied... Lau lau was fresh!  Definitely goin back when I'm visiting Vegas!  To bad their were out of Kona coffee when ordered with my dinner.  Other than that happy with the service and food.

gX0odlPSXESglpcoyiu43w.text: As good as everyone said. Portions were large and very good. No poke during the week was a little disappointing, only on Friday's.

bdqveaiVxb2Fo-Wzr_Rs-Q.text: If you want to be reminded of being back home in Hawaii then I'd recommend Ross J's. It's definitely the best Hawaiian place I've had since moving to Las Vegas. Great friendly staff, affordable food, quick service if your looking for a fast meal to go. The Spicy Korean Chicken bowl one of my favorites. For being as cheap as they are they give really good portions that always leave me taking the rest home in a to-go box. Overall I've never had a bad experience at Ross J's and I would recommend it to anyone who lives in the Henderson area that wants some real quality Hawaiian food.

VurQaMmhqDRmDUqgeV9XtQ.text: if im ever in the area, this is usually the spot i like to go to.  ross j's. the service there is great! i still have yet to ask the lady what her name is (shame on me) but she's always friendly. i love that she speaks in pidgin/island speak. my boyfriend and a lot of my friends grew up in hawaii, some born and raised, and i guess i've gotten use it. but for some reason its comforting (i have no idea why).  anyway, loco moco, kalua pork, roast pig, korean chicken, and when they have it, their chicken long rice. everythings yummy!!! you might wait a little longer than usual for food, but thats because they make everything to order.   definitely coming back when im in the henderson area. maybe open one up on the west side of vegas?  just a tip: the plates are pretty big. i'd suggest sharing, or at least saving half of it for another meal.

Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. spicy korean chicken
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. kalua pork

NatbruovF5SpRZa6ZJ8_3Q.text: Here I go again, writing yet another review for a place that yelpers love that I did not.  Sigh.  I tried this place for lunch while running errands because of the rave reviews on here.  Because I'm a white Jew from Los Angeles, of course I know nothing about authentic Hawaiian food, so you don't have to listen to some random chick like me.  I was not really into the food, although as the others said, it was pretty cheap.  It was just too blatantly unhealthy for me to actually enjoy and I didn't really eat more than a little of my order.  I tried a combo plate that had one of the fatty pieces of dark meat chicken I have ever seen served in a restaurant.  It was if it had almost a half an inch of fat under the skin which just made me not want to eat it.  The chicken underneath was flavorful because it was cooked in that fat but it was just too over the top for me.  The beef was also a little too gristly, but the teriyaki sauce was nice.  The best part was the mahi mahi, but again, there was a huge glop of sauce on it that just tasted like some sort of mayo, and there was no acid in it to help flavor the fish.  Also on this plate was macaroni salad, which had the most mayo I've ever seen in a macaroni salad.  I love macaroni salad but they should be light and flavorful, not heavy and gloppy like this.  And there were tons of rice, which is ok but I had wish there were some vegetables to offset everything else.  I understand I could have gotten vegetables now from reading these reviews if I had asked but I had no idea when I got there that I needed to ask for them.  Anyway, because of the price I might go there again just to try the spicy korean bowl, but overall no, this is not a place I would frequent again, just as I don't eat at many places because it's just not healthy for anyone to eat that much fat in one meal.

ujykpNaUJEaPguOKEX4yuQ.text: This hole in the wall is great! :) My Hawaiian friend, who was born and raised, said that this is the closest place to authentic Hawaiian food. And if this is the closest thing to authentic Hawaiian food, I'm addicted!  What I don't like about this place, is their menu because they have so many good choices that it's difficult for me to decide what to get! I usually order Musubi--all of them are really yummy and the meats and rice are portioned well. I've also ordered their combination plates. Their teriyaki chicken and beef are grilled to perfection and are tasty! They are not oversaturated with teriyaki sauce. The Spicy Korean Chicken has a great balance of the rice, vegetables and chicken. I wouldn't say the Spicy Korean Chicken is "dripping sweat spicy" but it has a nice kick of spiciness to it that will leave you wanting more.  You'll definitely get your money's worth with the portions you get. I have leftovers every time. So instead of considering corporate L&L's, try this place out instead; you'll be pleased that you did.

5ZSMgs6rXHrJYGUbQxInlA.text: I got Mahi Mahi and Spicy Chicken. The Mahi Mahi was ok, nothing special. The spicy chicken was good, not great. The amount of rice was for 4 people. Personally I like Island Flavor much more! This was typical fast food Hawaiian food type of restaurant.

CZhybIhTdzjl5FY-4YYt8A.text: First time here for dinner before going to see "Man of Steel" at the best movie theater in town.  A popular spot with Yelp peeps, I was pleased to see that they offer breakfast all day.  I had the eggs, Portuguese sausage, and rice for the bargain price of $5.50--deal!  The sausage had a nice little kick to it, but I only got 4 pieces and about 3 cups of rice--for reals.  I think there should be some equity in proportion, but it's so cheap, I guess I can't really complain.  I really can't complain because I didn't even pay--thanks, BP!  Friendly service and a good selection of Aloha eats--mahalo!

k9uKHJTS-Grrq6YKwAiTmQ.text: Three reason why I like Aloha Grill; serve luncheon meat, choke parking and BEST of all, choke rice. I no kid you, you'll get 3 or 4 huge scoop of rice.   Very popular spot, so expect long line but you'll get your food pretty quick.

RaG-WMyVWWq6-HhdQKeWow.text: Been coming here for years. They have great customer service and good food at reasonable prices.  Lunch time can be crazy but that is to be expected, I have no complaints!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mac salad to go
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki bowl with a side of Mac salad $5.25 #winning

_0elwl1XPKaWYS_ovbsOaA.text: Best Ever, don't play yourself with "Aloha Kitchen" or any other Hawaiian food place. This is the spot and always will be!

hSPg-azct07OIy9tkcehRg.text: I've been to Ross j's multiple times & I always get the same thing! The spicy korean chicken bowl is so amazing and so filling! I'm sure there are more delicious things on the menu but I'm a little scared to try something and not like it. Lol.   The people here are super nice and friendly so more of a reason to leave them a good review! I will definitely be coming back to Ross j's.

Cxpt--wYhOx9AdvMRoZBvQ.text: Overall I was not impressed and I will not be returning.  I ordered a kahlua pig plate, and side of spicy Korean chicken. The kahlua pig was bland, albeit tender. The macaroni salad was so salty that I couldn't stand more than one bite, but it tasted more like salt water than just overly salted food. The spicy Korean chicken was the only part of the meal that was ok. If I had only ordered that it wouldn't have been so bad.  On the plus side, you get a good amount of food for the price.

sADN-omQFZXpBpaOYcAWKQ.text: Eating dinner here with my son and can't believe how they turn customers away saying their closed.  If you closed lock the door.  2 families walk up to the counter and the dizzy girl with glasses tells them "we're closed", and makes them leave..I mean at least lock the door...then right after that another family comes and she turns them away...poor customer service.

paeGTG95GQHw_B-EcX9vfQ.text: Anyone who doesn't like this place can go fuck themselves. How is that for a review? You want more? Ok:  In True Aloha Spirit, they can be a little slow on the move but if you have those expectations coming in, you won't mind getting stuck in the line during the lunch rush--they'd be well served having another employee to help during lunch but I'm not paying the bills (well, I guess I kinda am in a round about way, but whatever).   Everything I've had here has been amazing. the small saimin is anything but small. The won tons are great and the sesame oil they use really comes thru in the flavor. The added veggies (bean sprouts/napa cabbage) really are a must. The char sui pork is perfectly sweet and porky. I personally skip the fish cakes b/c that shit ain't for the haoles, man. Just make sure to get a side of hot mustard and dump it into your broth.    I've had most of the different mixed plates and everything i've had has been tasty. even that red-ass hot dog they serve on some plates (redondo hot dogs, i believe).   I think these guys must be laundering money for a rice company b/c they give you about 3x more rice than seems normal. I may die from diabetes in a few years from all the white rice, but hotdamn it'll be worth it.   The only issue I have is that sometimes they run out of things and the menu is limited during dinner. So-fucking-what, though. Just order something you haven't had before, ya jerk.   It's easily in my top 3 Hawaiian restaurants (and I love Hawaiian food) in town. Wish I lived closer because I'd go there all the time.

vgdnLqoq6CSV_fH2WJS_sQ.text: Great food and prices. Bring local Hawaiian food to da 9th island. I wish they would add some beef stew and curry plates to their awesome menu.Also, would like to see make your own plates. Like pick any 2 or 3 items and custom your plate. Hands down way better than Aloha Kitchen and L&L. AAAAAAAAAAA++++++++++

Sq4tjAHZD9WJ9GrpcDsAlw.text: Been here a few times, nothing really to complain about....except for this time. The Meat Jun seems to always be the thing to order, although today will be my last time at this local spot. The meat didn't even seem like it was marinated, and it also seemed like it was barely dipped in egg before being fried! No flavor at all, & after 4 bites my jaw was literally tired of chewing "rubber". I also ordered a side of the Spicy Korean Chicken--the flavors also weren't all that there & tasted basic as if I was grabbing a meal at Panda Express. The lady up front that took my order was "Ms. Aloha", & I didn't have enough guts give my meal back to her, so here I am writing a review about the most unsatisfying meal that I've had in a while. The commute to this restaurant is definitely not worth it anymore.

Bq0EK24lKtUdlLtjNbudnA.text: Great food at a great price. Fried rice is delicious, but the garlic chicken and korean chicken are amazing.  During the lunch and dinner rush and on weekends, it can take 30 min to get your food, so it's not the place to go if you're in a rush.

K-gWXwB57M-roT8ntnNI6w.text: Service is always good here. I remember when this place was called Taste of Paradise and it was across the street. It was the first place my cousin took us on our first trip to Vegas back in '98.   Food is still good to this day. I bring my niece here and she loves the chicken katsu.   I always try to get something different each time I come here. Korean chicken, chicken katsu, portagee sausage eggs n rice, corned beef hash, etc.   I think they only had the corned beef hash during st. Patricks day... If they don't have it on the regular menu, I wish they would add it on. That was Ono! I liked the way they made it here. And I'm all about supporting local Hawaiian businesses. the service is great, quick, and good food.   This is a popular spot for the Hawaiian transplants that live in the Henderson area. Seems to be getting popular among the local las vegas peeps too. Right on!   Bettah than Aloha Kitchen, all the way!  Same owners as Aloha Specialties at the California hotel downtown.

HBd31aTe_4ni2mUkb3cQPw.text: This place is great, love their food. Too bad they're always out of my favorite dish, Meat Jun, 9 out of 10 times.

OjQP5DYd-3eotEKiUohcEw.text: I was initially very hesitant to come here. A lot of my friends talked about how amazing it was but I have been very skeptical of the crap Hawaiian places that seems to be popping up everywhere. Thankfully I was not disappointed.  Located over North Green Valley, Ross J's serves up huge portions of real Hawaiian food. The menu is pretty expansive, they have all the traditional stuff you would find at any Hawaiian restaurants - katsu, saimen, corn beef hash, and the like. But they a couple of their own original stuff: Korean bowls, hamburger steak and the like which are great. Also the prices are very reasonable.  Every dish is a massive amount of food. I don't know how I finish each time but its so damn good. Suggestions: try getting the chicken with out the skin. The skin is a little fatty and actually tastes better with out it. Sub in fried rice for regular rice. The spam fried rice is awesome and goes well with pretty much any dish.  Definitely check this place out if you are looking for some real Hawaiian places.

YygrM2EJrF7oFeI8imn2og.text: I haven't been back in a long while, but still rather satisfied with this spot.   The portions are large so you can get a lot of bites at a cheap price. It's sort've outrageous actually how big the bowls are.   The BF and I shared a korean spicy chicken bowl - it's not really "spicy" but more spice flavored sweet soy sauce in that it reminds me of korean food without the heat. It's still pretty good, but this time it wasn't as crunchy on the skin which can make it rather fatty. I don't know how big a actual plate would be if this was a bowl sized.   Pork katsu menehune plate - menehune is their mini sized plates that has mostly rice, and a tiny scoop (like half what a scoop normally would be). The katsu was crisp and wasn't dried out which seems to happen a lot of pork chop katsus.   Lumpia shanghai - their was 6 in a order and these were thin and long and not filled with too much. Still, even though I would have liked more filling, the pork, carrot and cabbage filling was decent.   We also got a side of macaroni since the menehune didn't have too much and the BF loves macaroni. It was a heaping scoop side.   There was one lady at the counter running the show. Poor auntie had a constant line of people, and had to clear plates and serve so it took a bit for service, but nothing we can fault her on at all. She was doing everything.   Overall, still probably the best plate lunch Hawaiian food around in flavor and in price. It's no surprise there's this many people flowing in.

_GnrbV4WBZP4QUVHpgoQaA.text: I recently catered some food from Ross Js and the food was delicious. This was the first time I ever tried their food but I had no doubt that it would be good because of previous reviews and recommendations from friends.   We ordered the chicken teriyaki, chicken katsu, beef teriyaki and the fried rice. The service was very welcoming when I arrived to pick up the orders and the inside of their business seemed very homey. The portions that were given were very generous and for a very reasonable price.  I would rate this establishment over L&L and although I think L&L is good I just think Ross Js is just as good and for a better price.  The only minor con that I noticed but is not enough to knock a star off is the Katsu sauce. Now I know most Hawaiians have ketchup with their food and it goes for Katsu chicken too but at L&L they have a sweet thick gravy type sauce that comes with their Katsu chicken that I prefer over the ketchup.

Yhgw1kc7wy-0wLzasYQRiA.text: I'm from Hawaii and this place feels just like home. The place looks and tastes like some of my favorite restaurants back home. It's awesome! The only thing I would watch for are the lunch time crowds. You might hit a gnarly line at around 12:15. Other than that this place is great. For all the people around town that miss home, this is a great spot to visit.

QnYdGTgKZLS8EESHYxlQ8A.text: I just moved to Vegas but already have a favorite Hawaiian restaurant. This place is great, with the price of fast food and the ambiance of a cafe. You order at the counter and the food is brought to you at your table. Glass bowls and plates with silverware, no Styrofoam or plastic, except the cups. I odered the spicy Korean chicken bowl with a side order of lumpia. The portions were generous and it was all delicious. Add a Hawaiian Sun pineapple orange soda and the tab, with tax, was $9. If they ditched the Styrofoam in favor of a more environmentally friendly solution and updated the interior of the place, this would be an easy 5 stars. RECOMMENDED

2E1XjR1ieiRtmUzP09wX-w.text: A coworker suggested this place so I thought I'd try it out. Got the mixed plate (teriyaki steak, teriyaki chicken & mahi-mahi, rice and macaroni salad) as well as trying spam masubi for the first time. Portion was very filling, wasn't sure I would have been able to finish. The beef and chicken were tender. I am not a fan of fish, but the mahi-mahi was good. The Spam masubi was also tasty, especially since I have tried and did not like nori snacks by themselves nor a big fan of canned meats. This place is pretty affordable too. All in all the mixed plate,  spam masubi and 2 bottles of water was only about $14 after tax. I walked almost 3 miles to try this place out & I'll definitely be coming back.

ZZ3rmiLUC304CxAAEwxBZA.text: Honestly disappointed. Ordered the mixed plate and chicken teriyaki plate, and almost everything was flavorless. The fried chicken seems to be dredged in flour only (no seasoning). The taste of the Mahi was defined entirely by the tartar sauce they put on top. The portion of Macaroni salad was very small and tasted overwhelmingly of salt. Most of the meats (even the spam) had a faint fish flavor that I suspect is from shared oil or an under-cleaned grill. The chicken teriyaki had sauce on it but was completely flavorless. Finished the meal thinking the white rice was probably the best part. Unlikely to return. Want to go to an actual good Hawaiian place? Go to Island Flavor. Or even L and L because this place is that bad.

w7IkafPq_qH5QNbsb0qE4Q.text: The deals here are great! Spending up for the pricier plates isn't worth it. Stick with the cheaper meals and it's totally worth it. Quality is solid and quantity is plentiful

ykRPQBghywFt8m5VTOHwTA.text: After all these years I've come to this place, I am finally writing a review! I have to start out by saying this is one of the top best Hawaiian places for food!   The food is always the best, super fresh, perfect portions and fast service. My girlfriend and I stopped in around noon, we walked in and there were a lot of people eating. We looked at the menu and ordered a wonton min, teriyaki chicken bowl, spicy Korean chicken bowl, fried noodles and a broccoli beef entree. They have the best saimin, full of flavor, delicious noodles and a good portion for one person.   They are fast and friendly, always willing to answer any questions you may have as well as serve you up a huge dish of aloha! All these years I've gone whether with friends or family they have never failed with keeping the food the same and delicious.

8EKrBbTTLTWXrPKcnzUMwg.text: Ross J's in henderson and kolaches and donuts next door ,,,,gag a maggot .   I've included a phot of the gourmet condiments so full of life waiting for you. Tables dirty crapshoot to find a clean one.  Mac salad had sooooo much white pepper thought it tasted so strange that they might have gotten so cleaning chemicals in it.  Depending on what you order determines the sauce carefully chosen from the wheel of fortune but it's cheap eats and " drunk food" to fill up before or after your binge and rehab. So have at it. I prefer the root canal. At least can't taste it loaded up like a rhino on novacain

5xsx0f5IBfWmG9KB40GYeQ.text: Delicious Hawaiian food located in this side of town! I've been coming here for several years now whenever I'm in the area and craving Hawaiian food. Some of my go-to dishes are the beef stew, spicy Korean chicken, and the loco moco. My boyfriend and I stopped in last week before the lunch rush came in. I ordered the loco moco with over easy eggs and my boyfriend ordered the RJ's big breakfast (which is from the daily specials). The food came out fast with no wait at all. We found everything to be really good and extremely filling. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. Honestly, I'm not surprised that this place gets packed. I take it as a good thing because I know that I can get excellent food with great service. I definitely recommend this place!

ohCzCyoY6jRFxxitm9ZkXQ.text: First time trying this place and they will definitely see a lot more of me ! Sooooo good! I tried the spicy Korean chicken and the flavor was amazing ! I am really looking forward to trying all of the items on there menu!

Himkybh2L12xK24xillpYA.text: I've been going here for the past 3 years, and I can say that this is a Hawaiian restaurant for a great authentic experience of their native cuisine. Proteins of different sorts, such as beef, chicken and fish were cooked to perfection. Had a nice char on the chicken and beef, and not overcooked to becoming tough and chewy. The fish had a good fry, enough to have a crunchy taste exterior, and nicely cooked on the inside. Also decided to order spam musubi, and tasted as usual, amazing. The seaweed had a fresh taste to it, knowing that it was just made, not sitting out thank goodness. Which is why I go to this restaurant regularly, for good food at a good price.

1T8N3AB72Z5mW8hSPp9TWw.text: Get the spicy chicken bowl!! You will not regret it. This little hole in the wall is a hidden gem! I've been here multiple times and there hasn't been a time where I had a bad meal or bad service. During their lunch time roughly 12-2 they can get really busy and the wait might be a bit longer than normal but it is definitely worth it. I almost always get the spicy chicken bowl with broccoli added on. Their broccoli isn't anything special. It actually isn't even seasoned or anything but that's fine because the chicken is so good it compensates for that. Their chicken is sweet, it's salty, it's tangy, and its got a nice little kick to it. The closest thing I can resemble it to is orange chicken without the breading on the outside and a bit more spice. Their portion sizes are extremely generous as well so be ready to bring your leftovers home!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

vPSlOKUOXa-v-_Kx_dla3w.text: Ross J's Aloha Grill is located in the Southeast side of Henderson, up the street from Sunset Station. It's in the same plaza as Galaxy Theatres. It is a great place to get good Hawaiian food at a very affordable price. They also offer Hawaiian Sun canned drinks.  The classic go to is the spicy korean chicken bowl, which costs $4-$5. It is a pretty big portion, but all of their dishes consist big portions and a lot of rice. You can also ask for skinless chicken, which I know because a friend requests it every time. Drizzle some sriracha on there and you got some fire!  This time around, I opted for the corn beef hash with eggs because I wanted some breakfast food. It tasted like how it should have and the egg was over medium as requested.  Great value, big portions, decent quality.

Ad1AEbBkRTFjakLrKWS_Rw.text: Keeping This One Short & Sweet...  This is My Go To Eatery when I want to get my "Local Hawaiian Food" Craving!  It is located in the City of Henderson, in the Smith's Shopping Mall! The Eatery is a Little Small & it does get Busy Very Quickly!  Everyone that works there are Very Friendly and have that "Aloha Spirit", the food is Onolicious! and they are Generous with their servings.
