If you are ever in the Henderson/Green Valley area...look this place up! You won't be Disappointed! I Never was....  =)  Aloooooha!

UvSCv0Q9vBkMYv3YiMyciA.text: Have to say Ross J is top 3 in town in my opinion. Food is always good, hot, correct and served timely. Place is always very clean and the staff is very nice. Been going here for years and worth the drive!!!!   Taste just like back on the islands.

5pDkDIesHVBj2D7BVoDZkg.text: Wish this place was closer to home. Their spicy Korean chicken is so gooood. Their saimin taste just like I remember saimin back in my 7th grade year in Hawaii ('95).

fb1xKTw5PTvSxTdXllHIDQ.text: I've been going here for years, but just recently they got new workers who work beyond slow. There were 6 people in line while the workers slowly walk around, wiping tables, while no one was accommodating any customers in line to even take their orders. The girl with glasses started counting money, slowly in front of us and when we asked to order, she responded beyond rude that we're going to wait and she still won't take our order until after she does a couple more things. I don't understand at all why they can't accommodate us so we can sit and wait rather than just keep making us wait. The customer used to be amazing, but I guess they just hired slow rude girls who know absolutely no customer service.   It's pretty common sense to take orders and let us wait sitting rather than making a long line of people wait while they walk around killing time.

3-kqMiY90ts8X4pbmmoF3A.text: I love Ross J's!  I'm always down for Hawaiian food because they always give good portions on protein, and I'm not a small guy so I need my sustenance. Ross J's is a bit of a drive for me, but it's worth it because the food is pretty good.  I've gotten their chicken katsu and Ross J's mix plate.  The chicken katsu comes out warm and tender. It's very hard to go wrong with chicken katsu, and Ross J delivers on good chicken katsu.  The mix plate is contains teriyaki chicken, chicken steak, and mahi (fish). The chicken steak in the mix plate is battered and fried, and you may want to hold the teriyaki sauce if you're watching the sodium because it's a big plate. The rice in the mix plate is seasoned with seaweed, which adds a nice texture to the plate.  There's not wait staff so you have to get water yourself, but I'm not complaining since with the big portions, I need to be getting out of my seat every now and then to burn some calories.  I recommend Ross J's for anyone looking for some good, reasonably-priced Hawaiian food. It's worth the drive even if you're 5 miles away.

n2cIuODk3IEPpUCoOgkKOQ.text: My family loves coming here but I ate here like 3 times. The food is ok. Nothing I would come back for though. I had my husband order dinner on his way home so I ordered the Korean chicken and he had the chicken long rice. And a side of kimchi. He asked for no rice because I had cooked rice at home. When I opened up the plate, it had 2 small pieces of chicken and a whole lot of rice. Like so much rice that I thought it compensated for the small pieces of chicken. And my husband had 3 large pieces of chicken for his chicken long rice. Also the kimchi spilled everywhere on his way home. I wished they wrapped it up with some clear wrap or used a container with a lid. Food is good but I probably won't be coming back for a while.

YYwospQ4HuO46no660-ZFg.text: This place has big portions at a great price! Their teriyaki beef bowl with grilled onions & mushrooms was delicious and had a great price of about $5.50 - can't beat that! Their side mac salad is pretty good, was slightly salty, but after I mixed it in the container, it was better; and for the price of $1.35, that's great cause most other hawaiian places charges way more. Their Bento plate and the Corn Beef Hash plates were also delicious! My family loves this place. I recommend this place for their delicious and big portion plates and friendly servers. I just wished they closed later, even by one hour (9pm).

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Teri Beef Bowl w/ onions &amp; mushrooms and side mac salad

cKq74ELbiu5r54somx5YHA.text: Incredible hole in the wall Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas!! Absolutely amazing teriyaki chicken plate. Loved the laid back atmosphere and Hawaii themed restaurant. 5/5 !

bCQnYF8uguE_bNdkTB7IXg.text: If you love rustic places, this is one of the places to go! Came here during lunch time with my husband. The first thing that shocked me was the prices! They were so cheap like how back home was. It was the start of the lunch rush but we came in on time.  I ordered the Spam Loco Moco while my husband ordered the Hawaiian Plate special which consisted of Pork Laulau, Kalua Pig w/cabbage, mac salad, rice & shoyu poke. As we say it in Hawai'i, it "broke da mouth"! Sooooo good!  The staff was friendly, & the restaurant is a pretty good size. By the time we finished our food, the line was about to go out the door. Better make a stop here, you don't know what you're missing out on!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam Loco Moco
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Laulau, Kalua pork w/cabbage, shoyu poke, mac salad, &amp; rice

mxu18dBoRaXhsJbePl-hAw.text: Tried the chicken bowl with gravy and got a side of mac salad. The gravy was really thick and had no flavor at all. Not sure if it was because it didn't have any salt or something, but it was very very bland. The Mac n cheese was unfortunately the same. Thick and had too much mayo. Twice the amount that should have been there.   A plus is that the portions are great for the price, but sometimes that doesn't work in your favor.   Putting a 3 for now and hoping it changes when I come back in the future and try something else.

Su9XORLZxdKyAFD58hqUSA.text: Came here a long time ago and couldn't remember how we liked it (shame on me for having never reviewed it before). Was craving Hawaiian food and decided to eat here based off other reviews. There was also already a line when we came and lots of people eating inside so based off that we initially thought we were going to enjoy some really good hawaiian food. The wait for our takeout order was about 15-20 minutes. We ordered the teriyaki combo plate, Ross j special plate, and a side order of Korean chicken.   - The combination plates were honestly just ok. Kind of lacking some flavor. Portions were good though. - The Korean chicken was really good and would definitely recommended! Lots of good flavors.  - lots and lots of rice is given with the combo plates. More than needed. We had a lot leftover so it was a good thing we had an extra side of chicken ordered.  - the Mac salad.. something about it tasted different and not like all the other Hawaiian places we've been to  In conclusion, portions here are good but flavors are ok. Wait times are also long. Probably will not be back here again and instead go to a different Hawaiian place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. April 2019 menu

HVBD3H7CluCOJ_qbqi7cqA.text: I've heard a lot about this place from Hawaii locals. On this day, I wanted lunch. I was in the area so I stopped by.  It looked like an L & L. We ordered a Mixed plate, Lumpia, Fried noodles and Orange passion juice. The Lumpia was mushy, a no go. Mixed plate, eh.. not so good. The fried noodles were ok. It had some taste.  Would I eat there again? Maybe, I wanted to try their Butterfish but they were out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried noodles w/ no meat.
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Mixed plate special
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Lumpia

9QvfHtCGKtMHrWEHAsktjA.text: Love this place! Whenever I visit Vegas from Miami, I stay with my cousin who lives here. I don't have access to Hawaiian food so this is always the spot I come to because it's close by my cousins place. Let me tell ya, this place hits good! Great pricing for the food. Now it gets busy, so I recommend ordering your food ahead of time. My usual order is the katsu or katsu curry plate with a musubi or 2 & then some Mac salad on the side. Nothing hits like good ole Hawaiian food. Love this place, can wait to come back for another Hawaiian plate lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu

zjNg6hHFDdVlACpCYTzJTQ.text: After years of visiting, it's time to give some Yelp love...  Ross J Service & Ambiance:  This is a mom and pop kitchen with mom and pop Hawaiian decor.  It's comfortable like a casual resto you'd find in Hawaii.  It's mainly booth seating so you might see single diners taking up full booths when they're full.  The staff is always very friendly and the kitchen gets your food to you shortly after ordering.  The drinks are self serve so the staff can focus on processing orders and getting dishes out quickly.  Ross J grindage:  All the dishes I've had through the years have been prepared well and delish.  These are my faves:  The saimin soup comes loaded with noodles and beef and the broth is savory.  The loco moco gravy really brings the flavor that's paired with the egg, rice and hamburger patty.  My go to is the local plate: 2 Spam musubis with teri chicken for me.  You quantity sizes are massive as I'm either super full or taking food home when I leave Ross J's.  Ross J's is on my safe spaces when it comes to Hawaiian food.  They've never let me down and the grindage is consistently on point. Mahalo!

ln0JJrCaiP1Xi4fkr1HC-A.text: This place has great food that comes in large portions.  We tend to pick this spot over any other Hawaiian restaurants and they never let us down. Though we have been noticing lately that the cleanliness inside of the restaurant seems to keep dwindling. This last time, the tables were sticky, and the condiments on the table hadn't been cleaned off in quite awhile. Looking on the floor under and between the booths hadn't been cleaned in some time. After seeing this, it made our experience quite disappointing.

AmFMRcyt73LQql6AxX1Pkw.text: This is a hidden gem in Henderson! If you want something good and cheap, then this is the place for you. My go to is the spicy Korean chicken bowl extra extra spicy. It comes with rice but you can add mixed veggies or mushroom and onion. The chicken is on point, with a lot of flavor. The chicken is cooked to perfection making it soft with a nice crunch from the skin. While you are here, don't forget to try their spam musubi. They know how to make one good tasting spam musubi, you won't regret it. This place can get busy depending what time you go (usually around lunch) but it's definitely worth the wait. I always had great service and all the staffs are friendly.  If you are nearby, be sure to check out this hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean chicken extra spicy

NamBm6BwTOSduegxFQYauQ.text: My boyfriend and I always enjoy our food here.  Today we got the loco moco, Shanghai lumpia, and ross j's special pack..everything was delicious.  The prices are very reasonable which is nice.  The wait today also wasn't bad..only like 5 minutes.

avNmgy1AiDUQeiDiZQDUsw.text: I used to frequent this place a couple times a week when I lived in vegas. its always fire. Stopped in after not living in Vegas for 5 years and this place is still so good. I crave you weekly, and cant wait for the next trip back! Ross J's is as good as it gets.

WbW1MnDasO8hsCa3C56Ksw.text: I was in the area and took to Yelp to find me a new spot (that I haven't tried yet) that offered Hawaiian food. Do you ever have that random craving of Hawaiian food? Well for me, it was today.   When I arrived to pace my take out order, I walked in and it was packed. I thought to myself this must be a good sign; almost all the dining tables were full. I tried to creep on those sitting and eating to see how big their portions were and to just see what they were eating. From what I saw the portions looked quite large.  I ordered one of "the specials of the day," called the Aloha Bento. This included hellllllla rice, a piece of spicy Korean teriyaki chicken, a couple thin slices of teriyaki beef, 1 redonda hot dog and a small sauce cup filled with cold Mac salad. Seriously, I was excited to try this place but to my disappointment- it's not that great. The meat and rice ratio was just off for me; there was SO much more rice compared to the meat. The chicken was okay, and the beef was slightly rubbery. The Mac salad had a weird sour taste to it, I hope I don't get sick tomorrow. Ugh, yikes!   I'm going to stick to my Island Flavor for any and all Hawaiian food cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

n030SdEcKgCHzyzaNRZfrg.text: I Tried pretty much 75% of the food on the menu, by far the best is the aloha bento. You have a mixture of food. Korean chicken is crispy and has the perfect heat to it. Rib eye teriyaki beef, hot dog and fried spam. Staff is very friendly. Restaurant get pretty full quickly.

e8KO9YvlxGDNSf6tz-wgNg.text: Needed some local food to satisfy my hunger pains and my did it satisfy! Heard of Ross J's a couple times, nothing bad always positive that the food is ono. So since i was in the area i decided to grab a quick bite and a musubi for my little one for the ride home.  Stopped in around 330 pm and the place was rather quiet, couple tables occupied, some to go orders as well. The lady and girl working were real friendly and offered plenty of Aloha.  I decided to go with the bento from the specials board and the spam musubi (my littles favorite) the wait time wasn't too bad.  Judging by the menu they have tons of local favorites. Teri beef, hamburger steak, korean chicken, loco moco, spam musubi and the famous mac salad. Prices are moderate and pretty average while the special plates like the Ross J's special are a little pricier close to $9 a plate but well worth the price for the amount of food given.  The bento i ordered had Rice, Mac salad, Teri beef, Korean Chicken and Redondos hot dog. The plate was filling and ono. The teri beef was super duper delish and definitely will be having just that next time. The mac salad was tasty but little bit too much mayo for my liking. But i can get pass that.  Overall Ross J's has a lot of parking available, plate lunches have great portions for great prices and everything taste ono!!!! We will definitely be back even though we live a little further away for the ono grinds. Mahalo Ross J's!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam Musubi. My little said was 5/5! Lol
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Bento from specials board. Teri beef 5/5, Korean Chicken 4/5, Redondos hotdog 5/5, Mac salad 4/5. Overall ono!!!!!

avanOSXzfCmYE2g3J4Gt2g.text: I'm tempted to leave a bad review, just so no one will discover this gem in Henderson.  This place has become my top 3 restaurants in Vegas.   This place is wonderful. Even though I get the same item here every day, they make it so flavorful that I end up coming here once a week.  Making it a staple in my weekly routine   It's like a Mom & Pop shop, so don't expect quick service. They make every order fresh, but I promise you it's worth the wait.

MJgC7t-35ig-Q1TIIl10Mw.text: Love this place  great food, didn't have to wait long and it was super affordable. Going back again tonight, actually! Thanks for being a wonderful eatery.

KSgLVF3eLVeWWZ5sVQgAgw.text: They really should raise their prices and hire another person to help. You would think that at 3:30pm on a Sat, that it might not be too busy but it is. In fact, you have to have real luck to walk in without there being a line to order or a 30+ minute wait for your food. I do like the food and will go back but hate the wait!

9T3SFU2hYrRCb-gnSW6DvQ.text: You can probably catch me here once a week. The staff go out of their way to make sure you feel welcome, they are patient and knowledgeable. The food is tasty and crave able. Prices can't be beat and portion sizes that blow your mind.

SWm84uvnBeqcXaWQC_BQSw.text: If you're looking for a taste of home or good Hawaiian food - you've landed on the right page, my friends.  Ross J's is not over the top Hawaiian food. It's simple food - what you would likely find in most Hawaiian drive-inns. But the food does not lack flavor in any type of way.  The loco moco was delicious. One of the best I've had in Vegas so far. Featuring a decent sized hamburger patty, 2 eggs, brown gravy, and TONS of rice. I ordered extra gravy, of course. For the price, you can't go wrong. Although I do wish it came with a scoop of mac salad; even if that meant less rice. That would have put this plate over the top.  The spam musubi was yummy as well. Finally a place with a decent slice of spam and a good rice ratio. I'm tired of all the other places that gives you a sliver of spam, too much rice, and mounds of teriyaki sauce. Nope, not at Ross J's. They got it right here.  For the local Hawaiian's like me who grew up going to Byron's drive-inn for a cup of green river. GO TO ROSS J's NOW! Also known as lime punch, it was a very satisfying flash back to my childhood.  Ross J's is simple, satisfying local Hawaiian food and exactly what I needed during a Vegas excessive heat warning.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu sneak peak
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Lime &amp; Fruit Punch!
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco Moco - Rice overload!

P-XwGE-PlZz12DHk0FBruQ.text: My mouth waters at the thought of this place! Ross J's and Aloha Specialties are my two favorite Hawaiian places in town. Lo and behold, they are the same family! Every time I step in and even when I take a bite, they have a way of making me feel welcome and home.  It may be personal preference but Ross J's has my ideal comfort food. Honestly, it doesn't matter if it's a good or a bad day, just come here and I think you'll leave in better spirits and feeling stuffed in the best way.  I got a spicy chicken bowl a couple of days ago and when the server put it down, I was surprised at how massive it was! They also have different musubis; there is a chicken musubi, spam musubi, and Portuguese sausage musubi. YUM!  What keeps me coming back...I love the price, the taste, the area and the staff. Thank you for feeling my heart and belly with delicious love and warmth!

036QCYa0vi38L9bg-SRMDw.text: We usually go to a different joint when we're in the Las Vegas area, but since our long lost friends moved in the area, we decided to bring in some platters from this place we found on yelp.  Standard Hawaiian local style fare - bbq chicken, katsu, and mac salad. On this day, it was so salty, it was barely edible. Not sure what happened to the cook - and especially the mac salad. It doesn't need much salt, but wow was it salty today. Even the party hosts couldn't eat more than a few bites. Hopefully, this was a one time fluke, and I'll try again and update when I get a chance.

hgy-b4HKC2U729ZfCdQf9A.text: They had some good items like the spicy Korean chicken, seems like everyone likes the Kahlua pig, but they were out when I went.  Big portions!  Everything else was so-so.  Mac salad not so great too salty and peppery - not the island mac salad I'm used to.

WxeWD4LSDnrqzMiJbgSfuA.text: I drive from NW Las Vegas for the longanisa/fried rice breakfast place. Two words: hella good. Everytime.

FSzLg2aV0thgWO7AOKAWIw.text: make sure you come here with an empty belly because their portions are HUGE. my boyfriend and his family are hawaiian and took me here for dinner the other evening. i wasnt expecting so much good food at such little cost. i had a small bowl of saimin that was the size of my head. it filled me up only a fourth way into it but i wanted to keep eating it because it was full of flavor.  the rice was good and i loved the macaroni salad. the staff was friendly and the food was tasty. i will be returning to test out some new things only with room in my stomach next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. chicken teriyaki bowl with added broccoli. less than 5 dollars.

8uJBG42syZVXWq0O9VZLSw.text: Good food had order spicy Korea chicken and served it at my wedding with the rice and mac salad...good food got my friends and family hooked!

z6ZkrHI3YkzEGM2-HJO4vA.text: LOVE, LOVE the Spicy Korean Chicken!! Great quality + cheap food = a great meal :) . Next time I have to try the Loco Moco.....

mx6iJVPBLyseadcXY2r0vw.text: Dope food! Everything is good I suggest the Korean chicken is definitely has the home cooked flavor. Very tasty

t8RF8MIZDgPBUOZBzBDWeQ.text: When it comes to Hawaiian food, you cannot find better for the price you are paying. I used to work by here and I got the Loco Moco all the time. But now I live like 20 mins away, and I hate driving yet I still make a trip out there for the Loco Moco. I have tried so many different places but it does not compare. The hamburger meat they use does not taste like the lunches they serve at elementary schools and the gravy is perfect to compliment the meat and not overpower it. The eggs and rice... they taste like eggs and rice... if you mess those up... gg. Anyhow, the only drawback is the wait can be long at times. But, if you call in ahead of time and get it to go... no wait! Ross J's is a must! Where else you gonna get a spicy chicken bowl for less than 4 dollars?

fEEjqPi46abB3O6RfGXT1w.text: da kine korean chicken broke da mouf,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, dat ting so so ono! da kine loco moco guud fo quick kine too. da musubi is da same as aloha specialties. eva ting da same as aloha specialties, but git bigga menu! best hawaiian kine in henderson, nevada. try um out next time yu come dis side fo shop at da galleria.

fZMpMLaj-p3OjDzDI22umw.text: I have an obsession with Spam musubi. That's the only thing I came here for... Not greasy, enough ratio of sauce and rice. Yum

r9mu3pfn_6jhqN-uoYzfFg.text: teriyaki butterfish: i ordered the dish with teriyaki sauce on the side. the butterfish seemed to be lightly pan-fried. it didn't smell too fishy and it wasn't oversalted. i'd give it at 3.5 for its moistness and good quality.  pulled pork: i liked how the bbq flavor was mild. i'd give it a 3.5  pros: quick service cons: too much rice, macaroni salad was salty and too creamy recommend for: mid-week quick fix dinner

oVgrC1oXPlowPcHIjW6fIg.text: We are from Hawaii.  Every trip, we always come here to eat.  We love their hamburger steak (best ever), roast pork , saimin and chop steak.  Recommend this place to everyone who asks--where to eat in vegas.  Looking forward to our next rip in December and will be coming here to eat.

6MJA2kDeX_tIVH1_GbNqgA.text: My favorite hawaiian restaurant I love their macaroni salad and everthing with gravy.

vaYrFWzlgsGGQjOqjFh9Qg.text: this place is hands down better than vegas lnls, and aloha kitchen combined! so far this is the closest I've gotten to actual Hawaiian food here on the mainland. I was born and raised in hawaii so I know how things are supposed to taste ;)

NAA5WywjWNrJro9YgeoPGg.text: Came here yesterday cuz I was craving some local food. Born and raised in Hawaii, i know what real local food is so i would say this review is pretty credible. Was craving korean chicken like the kind from ZIppys but this one turned out to be grilled and chicken strips. Not fried in chunks. Put the sauce on the side and added veggies to the bowl cuz i heard the portions were pretty big. Also had the fruit punch which was as close as you can get I think to hawaiian style fruit punch, i think Island Flavor has better fruit punch though, had to add water cuz it was a lil too sweet. Only tried this one dish but have to say it was really good and you get a whole plates worth of food for just ordering a bowl. Sauce wasnt that spicy, thank goodness and it was actually really flavorful. I'd definitely come back here again but only if Island Flavor is closed.

5WxrwEJeacuVqBucAa_sYw.text: YUMMMM!!!  Funny how they have better "local" food in Vegas than on Maui!  The hamburger katsu is a MUST and the fried rice loco moco is the bomb!!!  Can't pass up the spam musubi either!!!

iZhL-vvyBh254ZEqUcwc4Q.text: Once again Yelp reviewers did not let me down.  I had trouble deciding what to have for lunch today so I gave Ross J's Aloha Grill a try.  I had the teriyaki chicken, and it was very tasty.  I would have preferred more teriyaki sauce, but I'll remember in the future to request more.  But their prices are unbelievably low.  I almost feel guilty.  Almost.  So I'll definitely be back, and I did eye a few other items on the menu I'm already looking forward to try...

R1ny9o06jtPA1DGfvKj0JA.text: Food was yummy! I ordered a spicy Korean chicken bowl for Lunch and a loco moco for dinner. I haven't eaten the loco moco but the Korean chicken was delicious!! I am definetely a fan!

7epnjzZa927FKEVb4ylBDg.text: My home away from home.  They have the best platelunches you can find in LV aside from actually flying home to Hawaii.  It's like I never left.

N08m0TgJ6shfDBVSyCl7-A.text: This is the best and #1 local type of food to eat. I love that they are the only hawaiian barbque place in Vegas that has meat jun. That and other things ont he menu if I feel like eating something different. The best ono!

hBGUZID1BS9znrgNLmX7ag.text: When it comes to Hawaiian food, Ross J's is as good as it gets.

d7E_hPVa_s2_eW96oyAygw.text: Okay food. What surprised me was my food came out in 4 minutes, meaning it was precooked. That's ok if I was in a hurry. If I am near here I will return. Good prices.

v8y-SlowUyY7zlnwQ8corw.text: The best! simply put. I love it 5 stars i eat here all the time! SPICY KOREAN! is to die for, In fact I will be in after work to get some. The pricing is amazing for the quality and quantity you get. the staff is very friendly as well.

VK8Hyqso_dIs1oOFYjXdsw.text: Try to make it here once a month. Love the spicy korean chicken and spam masubi.

czgSLaqSVmfY70u5gCvpMg.text: Yesterday, my girlfriend, my cousin, and I went here to eat. My girlfriend was in the mood for some Hawaiian food. She took me to Ross J's Aloha Grill where I have never been before. Upon entering, I looked around the restaurant as usual and found the place to be very clean and in order. We were created right away by the female cashier. We all placed our order ( sorry I forgot what my gf and my cousin ordered). I ordered the spam musubi and which all of our food came out right away and fresh. I am very picky about cleanliness, I carefully inspected out silverware and found them to be clean. So if anyone is looking for a good mom and pops Hawaiian restaurant to eat in this area - definitely check out these guys.

Gxkie6aMI3fhRelbZoGqIQ.text: I have to update my review after getting lunch from here twice this week.  Today I had Oxtail Stew, which is one of their temporary specials.  A couple of days ago I had Portuguese Sausage Loco Moco (and a Spam Musubi).  I am now a fan of Ross J's.  The Oxtail Stew was absolutely fantastic.  I wish the place was closer to work.

gY2ZoAuJbWzJFaAINfonFQ.text: Pretty much the closest thing I can get to a plate lunch like home here in Vegas.  Ross J's is my go to restaurant if I need my Hawaiian food fix.  I usually always opt for the Mahi plate and a fountain drink (although every so often I like to dip into their reserve of Hawaiian Sun guava juice).  The breading on the Mahi is soft and flaky and not the overly fried versions I find at L&L or Aloha Kitchen.  The plate also comes with a side of mac salad, and although it's nothing like grandma's mac salad or even Zippy's mac salad, it's pretty 'ono (delicious) to say the least.  The staff here is always friendly and inviting, regardless of how packed it is, and always willing to accommodate a special order (I like the korean style chicken sauce on my Mahi so I get it on the side to dip my fish).  All in all, Ross J's is a pretty good time and they always keep the super grubbin' eats comin.

87QIFuWC0h87f9WFXAce4g.text: The chicken was nasty and fatty and still had the skin on it and not much sauce. It was a good deal of you like plain rice. Will never go back.

EmLRRDBD71pqTKvGlMfwBA.text: YELP NEEDS TO UPDATE THE ADDRESS!  4650 Sunset across from the Car Wash.  Affordable! Delicious! Wonderful food! Nice servers!  We went here TWICE because it was so good. Seriously, this place deserves way more attention than it's getting. I've never had hawaiian food like they served it here and both of my rice bowls were awesome.  It's quite a trip from the strip but SO worth it. Seriously, if you want really good, affordable food I highly suggest going!!

Iz0PQJ7XdQ_SVdpfiQxSQg.text: 5 star price, 5 star taste, 4 star decor and atmosphere. Overall they earn a solid 4. I prefer the Ross J's special because you get a little bit of everything. The spicy korean chicken is really good, no I mean REALLY REALLY good. They are much more reasonably priced then L and L, and yes ill say it...THEY TASTE BETTER.

8jggYMed_E_wGCwQCc7ZCA.text: I lived in Vegas for 5 years before moving back to Hawaii. Thank God for this place. The chicken cutlet is awesome. I took all of my friends there and they all love it and still go there even though I don't live there anymore.   A big taste of Hawaii in Sin City.

cLA72J_ySFNPRus_77uqeQ.text: My gf worked in Henderson and she used to bring some Ross J's over for our family when I first moved here from Hawaii. We loved their food. It was like I never left Hawaii. So why the1 star?  My family lives in N Las Vegas and my daughter had a volleyball game in Henderson at 6:30. We told the kids we would wait till after the game to eat so we could eat at Ross J's. They were excited because they loved their food.  Well...we got there at 15 minutes to 8 and were immediately told that they were out of chicken and that they close at 8pm. So...basically you're not dining in here was the message we got.  So my husband lets them know we're not from this side of town so we wouldn't have a place to eat. And a blank stare... C'MON! Where's the Aloha Spirit? At 808 Mixed Plate on Craig Road in N Las Vegas, they sit and talk story with you and they tell you to take your time eating while they clean up around you. They get it, and their food is great!  We're standing there with 4 hungry kids and 4 adults (grandma and grandpa came to watch their granddaughter play). Grandpa walks in with a cane because he just got knee surgery.....and we got turned away. WOW...business must really be good for them.   I don't know about you, but in this economy I would rather be giving my hard earned dollar to businesses who need it and obviously they didn't need our business. Turning away 8 people... Really?  You can give them your money, but I'll be helping out businesses like 808 who need it. BTW 808 has a killer haupia cake that melts in your mouth. They are always asking what kind of Hawaiian foods and desserts that you miss so they can update their menu. That's great customer service and that's the Aloha Spirit.

ppaKy8HIRKiIeMm8qrqm4Q.text: I've never had a bad experience here. I tend to stick to the bowl items with added vegetables and the saimin noodle. It's awesome to go and support a little mom-and-pop shop. If you ever look in the back, there's probably 3 generations of one family working there. It's super cute. :)   The must tries:  -Saimin noodle with hot mustard on the side -Korean spicy chicken bowl -Chicken katsu is above average - it has the chicken skin on one side still.  If you go around lunch time, you'll get greeted by this tall, sweet lady who tells you "Okay, lovey." Like her, everyone is really friendly there.

SLKSLK4x4WoJWrEPhKMDrA.text: been coming here for years, referred many people,   always loved it BUT not anymore.  last 6 months service has gone to heck.  Couple of times long wait when no customers in, one time brought DH order but not mine, after waiting a few minutes asked lady where it was - oops we forgot to order it.  Tonight was the last straw: Husband got here ahead of me and ordered for us.  2 large phone in orders ahead of us but  I can live with that.  Brought DH order said he would be right back with mine.  5 minutes later go to counter - lady tells man I am waiting for my order.  10 minutes  finally my food comes out.  I explain it is rude to serve 2 people who order and came together 10 minutes apart.  Man gets angry with me and says "can't you see how busy we are, sure I say but food should come out together.  He says "what ,should I have let his food get cold, can't you see your not the only one waiting?" No sir that's not the problem. The food should have been cooked and served at the same time.  Complete 1 order at a time - restaurants all over the world deliver the whole tables order together.  We came to eat a meal together not a separate times.  Get organized don't try to do too many orders at once and most certainly, DON'T GET MAD AT THE CUSTOMER FOR YOUR MISTAKE.  Good restaurants would at least apologize and try to make it better not worse. Your food quality has gone down and you really don't care about the customer.  It makes me sad because I remember when this was a great and friendly place, but I won't be going back and will tell everybody I can not to go either.

iS8jQAYF8pPsPCSnLMhMLg.text: I love this place. Every time when I'm in town from the bay area, I make sure to stop by this spot to have a meal.  They have great musubi, awesome mahi, and tasty ribeye. The Ross J special has a good combo of their food. I like when I dine in and they serve your food on a regular plate instead of a styrofoam container.   I'm sick of living in an area where we only have chain Hawaiian restaurants like L&L. I wish there were spots like these back home.

VxeoQ1NX999FlhjxX3VQ6A.text: Excellent food with a great price. Friday they even have poke (poke ee) hawaiian shaved friday through sunday. coworker and myself make it a religious visit fridays. Don't forget the kool-aid!

0BiRZ-XWiMQRNg8qTUp8Pg.text: Ok, so me and my co-worker goes there for lunch.. mind you me this is my favorite place when it comes to there fried noodles. Fried noodles means fried noodles, I have never had fried noodles wet and soupy like. So, I call the restaurant to talk to them about the my meal. The girl who answered the phone was very rude, then she told me I had to talk to the owners daughter in law. She put's  me on hold for 24mins, then when the daughter in law gets on the phone,  that didn't go well either. As I was trying to explain to her about my meal, she tell's me I have to specifically specify how I would like my noodles due different cooks, prepping the meal differently.I then get disconnected, How am I suppose to know who's cooking and when to ask, I asked myself. So, then I call back I ask the person who answered the phone if I could get her name she stated "NO" she just needs my name & number if I would like to get a call back. I give her my number and I ask her if I could get the owners daughter in law's name, she say's "NO". Then I tell her she's rude then, she say's her name is Penny. I was put on hold again for another 18min just for her to tell me someone would call me back. I will never go back to this place ever again. My co-worker and the rest of my work crew will never go back to this place as they have witness what I just went thru. Sad so sad. The funny thing is, you go in they are all smiley and friendly, but when you call you get a whole different type of attitude. Like really I'm sorry that's not how we show aloha and the girl who answered is local. Everyone who knows Hawaiians we are very aloha spirited. There was no aloha spirit today. Those smiley faces today was phony it's all for the job and to sucker in consumers.

2UflEYCl-0In7tV-yu-wrw.text: THE BEST HAWAIIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS.  I just ate their two hours ago and I'm already craving it again.  First time, get their ross special. enough to feed two people or one hawaiian.  Their mahi mahi is tender, non fried, and amazing.  macaroni salad...hands down the best.  chicken katsu...Just like in korea!  I though I would never be able to say that ever.  the best chicken katsu, I remember when I went to korea long time and eating the katsu brought tears.  I shared a ross plate and a chicken katsu plate with three people and it was just enough.  some of the prices did go up since shannon's post.  Not enough to scare anyone away.

_ZQtvkE2IvXNnU9UOLtTIg.text: I would say that this is the best Hawaiian restaurant.  Reasonable price and prompt service.  Portions are massive.  Too massive.

klu7kgYmBPncfh4dQ3z6oA.text: Awesome! Hamburger Katsu was great as well as the Pork Cutlet. We will be back soon.

HOM5nMoXVmUbUzgH1euMDg.text: We dined in for lunch one day, the floor had been mopped with a dirty/sour mophead, you can smell the funky odor on the floor. Teri beef is fatty/greasy and tough. Mahi Mahi is just chunks of cooked fish. Huge slathering of stucky white rice and overly mayoed mac salad with no flavor. My chicken katsu came with what I still think is ketchup and no katsu sauce. I asked for katsu sauce and the boss lady says that is katsu. No it's Ketchup, not tonkatsu sauce like everyone knows. So I asked for a side of teri sauce instead. My chicken katsu is Deeeep fried extra hard and the chicken had tough skin underneath. Too crunchy and taste like low grade chicken, greasy. Overly mayoed mac salad and a huge wave of white rice that wasn't all that fresh. Is this good food? I guess some think so and they are welcome to it. I like a certain place on 215 and Green Valley or 215 and Eastern much better.

23sv8SsO8jDAVk7MMSQ5qw.text: Totally hit the spot. I was in town for work and had about an hour before I needed to be at the airport. Korean chicken YUM. Great price.

zh11I8tBkv4JOaRKKYBJ4A.text: Been here several times in the past and everything has always been good. It seems they may have changed owners and the food has just been alright. I always order the Loco Moco, while my boyfriend gets the Teriyaki Combo plate. He said the beef was very unimpressive and he usually saves that for last.   Not sure if we will be back, but still giving them 4 stars for past service.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Teriyaki Combo Plate
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco Moco

ulo9Rmx47pdLa9dGYw5tCw.text: For my first time, it was pretty darn good. I had to get the much raved about Spicy Korean Chicken, it lived up to the hype. Great flavor with just a bite of heat, goes great with the rice and macaroni salad to cool things off. I got an order of the Lumpia, they were not as fantastic as I had hoped, but it's okay. It was a cheap lunch (about $8) and I still have some for later! Staff was nice, I took it to go but the restaurant looked clean and busy! I'll go again, so much on the menu to try, not sure what will be next!

IdnavAylD0Z5STd8EAoxfA.text: This place is amazing! I cannot resist good Hawaiian food, it's the perfect comfort cuisine. This is one of the best Hawaiian food joints I have ever eaten at.  -Awesomely friendly service -Big portions -Big menu with many options -Everything is delicious -CHEAP! It's hard to find good cheap Hawaiian food these days  I tried my personal favorite Loco Moco and was impressed. It was simply delightful.   Do yourself a favor, drive 15 minutes to Henderson from the strip and try them out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco Moco breakfast

bqeMpEsg8UCoOapWfa8knQ.text: Manju!   Where the meat!  I still love the flavor of their plate, but the meals are starting to look more like a huge pile of Rice, with only  two small pieces of meat (and this is for a two choice combo).   Not to mention, the  mac salad was pretty salty on my last visit.   I'm not sure what this restaurant is doing lately, but stop being manju or you won't see me coming back.  I'll give Ross J's another try, because this was one of my favorites Hawaiian eatery in Vegas, but lately, the amount of meats is very shocking small.

nosrc5dtwcF4i_5U3qbX-A.text: When I think Hawaiian food, my go-to spot is Ross J's. This place is seriously the best Hawaiian restaurant in Henderson area hands down! The food portion of how much they give is ridiculously huge, yet so cheap. I recommend getting the Won Ton Min, Aloha Bento, or the fried chicken. So good!

46P6U-czFNMNNbQ28-8iQQ.text: First time here and was not disappointed. Had the Spicy Korean chicken and it was good! Pretty busy on a Saturday morning with one person taking orders, serving tables, bussing tables etc. but she did it all with Aloha!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

xavHIiJrpJY3pxwu8Bnb2A.text: Authentic Hawaiian.  Already a few places I have to go when I visit Vegas.  Now I have another one.  Aloooooooha!

0wm1xzS_G1wSge3FjtDfYQ.text: I love Ross j's and their prices! They make awesome local Hawaii food! This definitely brings me back home to Hawaii but I recently tried out their roast pork and its absolutely not what I had expected. I was very disappointed when I opened my plate because back home in Hawaii many people know roast pork as the crispy fried pork bites with crispy skin and usually eaten with hot mustard and soy sauce. But this roast pork looked and tasted as if it was boiled and then slathered with gravy. It tasted like a TV dinner and wasn't appetizing at all. I love Ross j's and everything else that I have tried but one star off because of the horrible roast pork.  It was not a pleasant lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Awful roast pork. Not the roast pork I know from Hawaii

3IbKXh7KSLFQzz5cs0PHug.text: Awesome local food the workers are friendly and helpful see you soon wow I took the time to write a review and this dam ting is telling me to short

1Ku2CtuxErDtmU-27vAcyw.text: Love the Hawaiian style food and the staff are very pleasant. Been visiting regularly since moving to Henderson in 2014. My go-to order is always the Aloha Bento my kids love the Korean chicken, teriyaki roast pork and my husband tries different things all the time so I get to venture through him. Portions are very generous and always leave stuffed.

csiX20jTiQS6lARUgh-Rnw.text: Customer service it's horrible,  Staff is rude and slow.  Food is good It's nice to call ahead but this place doesn't like that.  Horrible experience never going back..

xZIaWStrnClNmNFQ8u8I1g.text: I was looking at the menu and pictures of this place and was looking forward to enjoying a Hawaiian plate lunch. WRONG! First they didn't have what I wanted to order because they ran out?!?! The line maybe had 4 separate families and it took a half an hour just standing there waiting to order. The girls behind the counter was more interested in having a conversation then serving the people in front of them to cut down on the wait time. The food was horrible or maybe just the wrong cook for the day. My pork cutlet was burnt and barely had gravy. The Mac salad was salty to where I couldn't even eat it and I love salt. They brought the wrong food to the table and acted like we were wrong. Management needs to step in and straighten out these workers or this will be another Hawaiian restaurant that closes down. Where is the "Aloha Spirit"??? Oh and the tables were super dirty and the floor was sticky everywhere. As a Hawaiian u know we always support our own but man this place was horrible.

xy7c0zr6YGZNIWx9AsQDjw.text: Great food and service. Other places don't compare. My favorite is the spicy chicken Korean bowl with extra sauce and Mac.mmmmmm Call in your order though because this place is normally busy.

3urDj53kfajZ5b4bH2sUHg.text: Lots of rice given.   Ono food & great customer service.

yJq5WJ8FuaBPlfNFw-_quw.text: Love this place wish they had another location every time i go to our sunset store I stop in and get something to eat!!!! Audio express appreciates your business and the great food you guys get us every single time thanks guys!!!

eTmkWdaQhIoGq3JFJDxnxg.text: Whenever in the neighborhood, gotta stop in for a meal. There are a variety of items on the menu to choose from. Even small plates and bowls. The staff are always nice. Ordered the Chicken bowl with brown gravy and steamed rice. It was a good hot fresh meal! Fruit punch always on deck which is a plus! The portions were just enough! I enjoyed it a lot. Gotta check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Bowl with Brown Gravy! Portions are just enough and a yummy meal!

h3Fvh_MiD8wT_4bjUJ8TKA.text: Love the place, awesome food and customer service is awesome as well. The only thing is during lunch time, it gets really busy and it takes awhile for the line to move. The cashier serves the food to the people who is waiting for their food when they are dining in. I would suggest to make the line move faster, have another person working beside you and have them serve the food to the customers that are dining in. Overall, like I said food is awesome, customer service is awesome and the price is awesome.

Q8Csmjda_fMd5P7qFDuBUQ.text: Not only does this place remind me of Hawaii, but it has great food for the price. When you walk in you forget you're in Vegas feel like you're in a local spot in Hawaii. Large portions , good people and of course the food is super Ono!

m5ayQUncsnHMnG0eMsSwyg.text: Well, I first tried the food from this place because my son brought me a chicken bowl from there. He let me know that a lot of high school students go there after school. I thought it was good, so one day I decided to go in there myself. I strongly believe that I would've given it a 5 if I hadn't seen the inside.  If you are a person like myself that goes off what the tables and inside looks like, clean wise, then please don't go inside ever.  I believe they should take a day or two to really clean the place up. It's not even about how old the tables and chairs look but on how dirty it looks in there. My husband thinks I'm just too picky but trust me , you will enjoy your food more if you just order it and have someone get it for you. I still eat their food once in a while but the experience always gets ruined when the chicken isn't consistent on the crunchiness and flavor and then I remember how the establishment looks like inside.  So, just because I like it once in a while I'll give it a 3 because my husband and kids do like it no matter what.

QZjcyi0KHjR3BQXkTD9lRA.text: The besssttttt Authentic Hawaiian food I have tried out here in vegas. Such a nice family environment and the staff is super friendly. My favorite is the spicy Korean chicken bowl. Yuuummmmmmmmm.

nflyQbJzLHIDEhlp83eokQ.text: Hands down the absolute best Hawaiian food I've had in Las Vegas. I drive from Summerlin to eat here with my family!

8pYFq2uGDkKbApsAlRWT6w.text: I have been on a quest for the best loco moco, and the winner is still in Kapaa, Kauai; however, Ross J's is damn good for being on the mainland.  I'm a traditionalist so I had the regular, but my friend had the portuguese sausage version - both were so ono!!!  They are also very friendly and efficient there, for being a 'fast-food'ish sorta joint.

JdUa6Ap8nIcRrc28dDQOPg.text: Nothing fancy but the food is good, abundant and reasonably priced. They have a breakfast menu but the lunch menu sounded too good to miss. I was a little put off by the menu as the bowl I was interested in was listed as 3 choices:  Mushroom & onion OR broccoli & something OR mixed vegetables. ALL sounded good to me so I ordered the mixed veggie bowl and, you guessed it, there were a bunch of veggies but NO mushrooms, NO onions, NO broccoli. What I got was ample and good and they have bottomless drinks so I left satisfied. The wife was less than impressed with the Mahi Mahi plate. "It's OK", she said.

oKrY_DTxQAjyaWTZn2eyIg.text: DA BESS' LOCAL KINE GRINDZ ON DA MAINLAND. Same owners as "Aloha Specialties" in The California hotel. Ono to say the least, they get pretty much anything you can think of that they would have at any Drive-Inn back home (Hawaii). cheap too! XlmZ62jRz1wKLf5R3UUcbw.text: One of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Las Vegas. Been going here since they first opened and is always my #1 recommendations.

hWTYF7tWN4eWpqhXaX0BhQ.text: Food was pretty good. I don't recommend the mahi. The restaurant either doesn't have a/c, or it wasn't working properly because it was blazing hot. The server made a rude comment about my kid as we were already overwhelmed looking for a lost item. The woman at the desk taking orders was nice though. I probably won't go back.

95HZXlVGrtOS_dm-8TMn0g.text: One of my favorite places to go for lunch.  There is so much variety on their menu, always have a hard time deciding what to eat.   The portions of their meal is so BIG !!!   Even the mini size ones.  The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get.  Great bang for your bucks every time I eat here.   The food taste awesome as well. So glad we are close to this place for lunches.

n1fksxLlSunT35UKFS1WUw.text: I love this place. I stumbled across it when I first moved out here and go back on a regular basis. He food is authentic and delicious. Do not pass this place up if you like Hawaiian, and take your friends who don't like Hawaiian to this place.

5pReHF04pA4y7ZQybtf1gQ.text: the first time i ate here, the portion was super small.  but i gave it another try.  glad to say i was not disappointed this time around.  korean chicken is pretty good.  you can create your own combo, which is always a plus.  saimin is a definite throwback to back home.  everything here tastes good.  one of my favorite local grinds.

9xKOxLsk4Nj2Sr1luHDh0Q.text: This place is amazing!!! If they were open right now that's where I would be. Their Spicy Korean Chicken Bowl is a ton of food for only $4.05. I know the exact price because I go there about three times a week. For anyone that likes Hawaiian food go here you will love it.

0iAlqya7AfFBmLAqn02Okw.text: Was introduced to this place by a friend and have been a couple times now. The food is good and the portions are big. Very affordable. Will definitely be going anytime I am on that side of town.  Had the Teriyaki steak plate the first time and the Loco moco the second.  Both were great.

EQuW5T4GbzIP6PDv_aBR9Q.text: Food great hours suck not everybody eats before 8 service super slow and most of the time there is just one person cashiering and bussing and delivering food even when they are slammed busy which is why they get 3 stars all of the stars for the food only

yuav3YXKdK2JEQxGfBgmhw.text: Let me start off by saying I loveeeee chicken katsu! And around the Henderson area, Ross J's and Aloha Kitchen off sunset in front of Galleria are my go to's but I prefer Ross J's. Their katsu is very crispy and meaty. The boyfriend ordered the cutlet plate and thought it was going to be crispy katsu, but it was actually katsu curry hahah. No big deal thoughhhh cuz we ended up sharing our plates and I actually liked the curry over the katsu so I ate the majority of his and he ate mine. The mac salad was too salty though. I wish Yelp would let you do half stars, because 4.5 is what I would give this place. Mac salad are one of the reasons I l eat Hawaiian bbQ and this is the only place that it's disappointed me on that but nonetheless I love their katsu. They give you ALOT of rice too. Not sure if it's the same amount if you to go it but the plate they give when you dine in is HUGE. You will definitely get your money's worth if you're a big eater.

no9PwEpXVs2NisKdfZ75Fg.text: Didn't care for it very much.  The chicken was kind of chewy and had a lot of grissel. I enjoy the food at L&L so much more.  This place was nothing special despite the great reviews.  If you like L&L, you won't like this place.

CUlDwR0ENjPfvHGKLnGsDw.text: I love this place. Definitely the best place in Henderson for Hawaiian food. The servings on the plates are huge, and the flavors are all good. If you've never been here then of course you have to try the spicy Korean chicken as everyone says.

totncR7GZ_GuQdPcCtjbJw.text: Favorite restaurant in Henderson. For 2 broke graduate student like my husband and I, this place fits our date night budget. The spicy Korean chicken bowl with some veggies is perfect. The serving sizes are massive. Yum. We will keep coming back.

kaOunoDX93DAeRINqyMJ3w.text: I have never had such an awful customer experience like I did today. First: I ordered my lunch and paid for it. The woman at the register who I believe is married to the owner (wears a flower in her hair everyday) asks "is this order for here or to go?" I reply to "To go!" (because every time I eat here I always have to ask for a box to take out) Once my food is ready, I find an open table and begin enjoying my lunch. Soon after, a line is starting to form for the lunch rush and the woman behind the register passes my table while delivering an order to a nearby table. Much to my embarrassment, she stops at my table and says out loud enough to gain the attention of most of the surrounding tables which were full, "Sir, I am going to have to ask you to leave. You have a to go order and to go orders MUST leave. I was in shock and asked her to re-think again what she was saying and further explained that I am a paying customer and I have to leave because I ordered my meal to go. She replied "YES!!!!" I again gave her a chance to rethink her logic and asked, "So if I had ordered it for here, I could stay and you would have delivered the food to my table on a plate (which would now be dirty and requires cleaning?" She replied with "Sir I don't need customers fighting over tables, as you can see we are very busy and your order was to go so please leave. " I asked her if I could get her to explain it one more time while I get video of her explaining this nonsense and she then retracted to say, "OK If I have a customer who wants to sit here you may have to get up and go but you can stay for now." As I look around the restaurant for reactions I am met with turning heads in embarrassment and a couple of shaking heads (in shame) from some teenagers at a table close by. I am convinced she is having a bad day but this really makes me shake my head in disbelief. What would you do? I'd lover to know what others think about this woman's (business owners) decision.

-6BlJnHNbfaRS9BRuXjoRw.text: I was really happy with this little joint. The pork was just okay but the portion size, mac, and other items really made up for it. I saw someone else on here who said they drove up from the strip to eat here... that's a little excessive. I would say if you live in the area it's worth while. We ate here because we had a groupon for the bowling lanes across the street and needed lunch before heading in.  Overall: try it out

wCUoJNpTJl9ETOrqZfYWoA.text: Best hawaiian food in town!!  Try the beef tomato.  Chicken katsu here is amazing! Ask for it with gravy, you wont be sorry.

VCqpRpdPM-pIfrYlp3B7xg.text: My favorite place to eat in all of LAS VEGAS...! Hands down...  Reasons: Customer service is superb.  I have been in Vegas for over two years now, visited this place at least over 2 dozen times but have nothing bad to say about it.    I love love the Korean Chicken Teriyaki rice bowl..its under four bucks, you get a good amount of rice and chicken.  The sauce is different then your normal Teriyaki sauce at other places. I've asked for extra sauce so many time, pretty much with every order...They give without charging an extra penny.   I've recently tried their normal teri chicken rice bowl, also the same price but the sauce is less salty.  Feel in love all over again.  I don't know how this place stays in business charging as they do, but I think because its family own, quite affordable that the locals always comes back for more, keeping this awesome hole in the wall in business.    Their spam masubi is 1.50, spam is decent in size and enough for a good filling snack.  :)   I think what put it over the top for me was last night.  I order my usual, the chicken teri bowl on the phone,  but when i came to pick it up, their person who took my order thought i order the actually plate which was two times the price, I make it known to Matt, and he, without hesitation, gave me my food charging me for the rice bowl and extra side of chicken.  (I also tipped a few bucks for the nice service)  When i opened it, the size of my order was not the bowl but the plate.  I was amazed at the customer service this place continuous to reflect.  I called Matt to say thanks once again.    No reason to not try this place if you haven't been in before, its worth the time, the drive and the room you have in your belly! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. under 4 bucks.  Spicy korean chicken rice bowl with extra sauce on the side.  :) can&#39;t go wrong!

rIDWiRMCJo9l_1kvWMcZsw.text: I've been coming here for years and it never fails. Everything is amazing and this is by far the closest you can get to real Hawaiian food in Vegas. I always have a hard time deciding what I want but I've never regretted any choices.

0RdIFld-ACRVthXxmg9k7w.text: 3 stars for A-OK in my book! I had lunch here the other day when I was working an event in the Smith's parking lot. I got the chicken bowl with the spicy gravy. Talk about HUGE portions! I was stuffed afterwards, the flavors were pretty bland, so I asked for some sauces to kick it up a notch. The prices were super affordable and the place was packed! I'd recommend giving it a try yourself to see if you like it. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but if I was in the area again..maybe.

oQPBoroCCZT25bAELNMvqg.text: I ADORE Ross J's. I use to work in the same parking lot and would often forget my lunch on purpose so I could walk and buy my lunch here. I wish I lived/ worked near by but then again I would eat here everyday if I did.   The prices are very affordable and the owner and his daughter are just lovely. I always get great service here, never any issues.   I usually order the spicy chicken or the chicken teriyaki add broccoli. The portions are huge, I can't really finish a whole plate on my own. The chicken is cooked perfectly not over done, still moist and juicy. OH and I love the fact they have koolaid.  Seriously if you are ever in the area check them out, they are amazing!!

z4Uu03Pv1X2Vkd3jTR0eGg.text: My favorite place for local/Hawaiian food! Love the aunties that work there and we always feel welcome. As long as the line is sometimes, the food never takes long. Love this place! Love the people! Love the food! Get the Ross J's Special with fried rice and a pocho musubi on the side!

pMkFvKxolXAxDvqU3L2lOQ.text: One of my favorite Teriyaki Chicken/Beef spots I've ever been too. Service is fast and the food is cheap! You can order extra portions or extra meat and it'll still be cheaper than most places you go to. It's fast and tastes amazing. I would usually just order a teriyaki chicken/beef bowl with extra meat. That was plenty. I tasted a few other items on the menu and was never disappointed.   I've lived out here for years and found this place a year ago. Couldn't stop going after that. The Vegas area has a TON of great places to eat, arguably more than nearly any other place you might visit and this is one of the restaurants I'm gonna miss most when I move. I can tell you it has a solid following. I don't see ads anywhere or any word of mouth but I have a story.   A few months ago there was some insane construction going on in that plaza. The construction had to tear up the only parking lot with access to this place. So anyone who wanted to eat here had to park a bit down the street and walk a ways to get there. That didn't really phase me much but that will deter a lot of people, especially people who don't go there often so I expected it to be empty... When I went inside that place was packed with a big line. Apparently ease of access wasn't a concern for the people who know how good this place is. They definitely have a large amount of "regulars" for a reason.

n8N0WQ1gZLObr1AQP5yhWg.text: Best Hawaiian food in town!  Delicious food very reasonably priced. Try the mixed plate!

wT8bHiZJ2e6sMkgdPBvMdQ.text: Super busy which is always a good sign. I ordered the chicken and beef teriyaki bowl ... the chicken was on point  I had expected the beef to be a lil crispy but was not disappointed

8zLjIuyVCyU3jLNTIXM5ng.text: Really good Saiman.  My wife is from Hawaii and was craving some authentic Hawaiian food.  The saiman broth was flavorful.  The noodles were perfect.  The great thing about it, the noodles and broth were the star.  They did not overload it with stuff to mask the taste.    I had the cornbeef Hash with eggs and rice.  It was done as they do on the island.  It's comfort food for those who are familiar with Island style food.  Not gourmet Iron Chef Kitchen food.  Just plain, down home island style food that will remind  you how your grandma made it.

0gtjIBAQ5kByE1LqkIcHvA.text: I believe you should not waste your time going to anywhere else if your craving some hawaiian food! The food is amazing and consistently good and you could not ask for better service! I've been going here since this place opened and is hands down THE BEST IN TOWN. The spicy Korean chicken is my recommendation if you have trouble deciding.   Great prices, great portions, best service, consistent food quality... I think I have said enough! :)

sMjGmFqp-FKqIV5_0zMjww.text: After reading the reviews, I was giddy with joy that Ross J's makes mochiko chicken. I made my way here and Lo and behold, Ross J's only serves it when he has time to make it. Oh that hawaiian timetable makes my stomach grumble. I also expected a plate to be massive after reading all these reviews. Usually a hawaiian lunch plate in Hawaii usually can feed  a family of 4. I must have been more hawaiian this day as one plate barely fed 2 of us. The chicken katsu was good and I'll have to try this place again for their hawaiian plate. When's the lau lau and poi coming out?

vB0Dg7LhIEc8azqIHM1-5Q.text: Amazing location since it's right by my school and has cheap prices that are perfect for a college budget! The spicy Korean chicken bowl with broccoli--my go-to!

TVY1m8BM__0plrhL--ZsJA.text: Probably the best Hawaiian restaurant you'll ever have in the Las Vegas valley!    I think it's safe to say that everything on the menu is a good choice.  I usually get the spicy korean chicken bowl because i already get full off that.  AND it's less than 4 bucks after taxes.  I got the the garlic chicken with gravy plate one time and the portions were ridiculously big!  3 big pieces of chicken w/ gravy over a mountain of rice with a side of Mac salad. This is truly food for my Samoan homies and for those who can really eat.  Everything is priced cheaper than it should be, in my opinion.  But I hope they don't change the prices on anything. It's one of the reasons why I keep coming back.  MORE BANG FOR YOUR BUCK HERE!  PS: they have cherry and grape Kool-Aid as options for a drink. Genius!

0fD0OMcFK3JPsALLgHa9gA.text: This place is just amazing. EVERYTHING is amazing. I'm sitting here in the diner right now after finishing the most delicious meal ever. And it's always consistent. The line is always out the door and we don't mind waiting!!!!!

HrYuL8we31HDmRP62ot7FQ.text: My roommate and I were running errands when we drove by this place and decided to try it. I had the chicken katsu & teriyaki chicken and she had chicken katsu & Korean chicken. We definitely could have shared one plate, the portions were huge! We both needed to go boxes.

-9Wu3kqvkvTEyL4XaWpSGg.text: I visit this place frequently for lunch.  My favorite is any of the bowls (chicken or beef, spicy or teriaki) with broccoli and the mushrooms and onions added.  They give you way more rice than is consumable, but that's ok.  The food is fresh and delicious and the prices are very good, especially for the bowls. If you come for lunch, get there before noon... or expect to stand in line to order and you may not get a place to sit!

qU9wKHFM3yaql_a92MTAvQ.text: Finally came and tried this place after a few failed attempts.   Ordered Spicy Korean chicken. Honestly, it was pretty alright. It didn't really amaze me or blow my taste buds. It was a good portion, lots of flavor, and chicken wasn't dry.   The beau got the Ross J Special Pack. This was such a big portion that it honestly can be shared by two. It had everything.. Chicken, Kalbi, fish, rice and Mac salad. I didn't really try anything on that plate besides the Mac Salad, which I thought was on the salty side. I attempted to try a bite a few more times after that but it was just way too salty. I felt my blood pressure rise from all the sodium.   The people that work there were pretty nice and attentive. The place is pretty clean. The portions were great. Even the "Half Order" of Katsu Chicken looked like a full order! I probably won't be returning all that soon but none the less a good place to go when you're on that side of town with a Hawaiian craving.

olbsPYNvAoigTRmKZaq56A.text: THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE FOR HAWAIIAN FOOD.   Customer service: 10/10 Food: 10/10  My family has been going here since I was a teenager, so ten years and more. I've continued going here and love it so much. As a Hawaiian, I'm always looking for close-to-home food places and am a harsh critic when I find one. Ross J's has never let me down and for me, this is my comfort food, my little secret of a Hawaiian restaurant doing it right.  My go-to combo plate: chicken Katsu & spicy Korean BBQ chicken with extra mac salad. While the entire menu is incredibly delicious, this is my absolute favorite.

Nl8A-HVra0U4LDuzVtPSpQ.text: I've been here a few times, and their food is delicious! Their food is farely priced, especially for the amount you get. I am only giving them 2 stars because of their customer service. The lady who takes the orders at the register is just plain rude. She has no manners whatsoever! Customer service is such a huge thing for me. Today was the last straw for me. I will no longer come here to eat, they have lost my business. I ordered my food 45 mins prior coming to pick up the food, and that same lady yelled at me and told me to wait in line. NEVER AGAIN!

exLxsrolC_LZAXc0CRJdhw.text: My first time here. I got the teriyaki combo plate with chicken, steak and pork. I loved the chicken! It was tender and juicy! Large portions with a generous amount of rice. It also came with a small cup of macaroni salad, which is the whole reason for getting Hawaiian BBQ, but sadly the Mac salad was too salty for me and a tad bit too much mayo for me. V7Tnb14oEH58Za2mGPedzg.text: Another great meal here at Ross J's...  this time it was the Loco Moco, but we have tried the Spicy Korean chicken bowl, Meat Jun and the Katsu...all were great! The spam Masubi has been fresh and very good every time I order it...and when it's to go, it never makes it home, as I eat it on the way every time. This is a small place, so seats fill fast, and there is usually a line to order...to me that means it must be pretty dang good, if there is almost always a line here. Our service has always been spot, whether we ate in or had ot to go.  A MUST try if your in the area.

QOd2FTc60JarvlPcpbA6HQ.text: When you are missing island homestyle grinds or want to get a taste of Hawaiian comfort food, you'll find it here!  I was in heaven back in '01 when they opened their 2nd place here in Green Valley. Aloha Specialties at the Cal is their first restaurant. Since then Ross J's has gone through one move but it is still the same family and still the same ono (good) eats!    2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop mac (macaroni)salad, and choice of meat and you have your traditional Hawaiian "Plate Lunch!" That's what I wanted today. I got the "Hawaiian Plate" which came with Kalua Pig and Lau Lau. The price is right too!   Loooove the Kalua Pig and Lau Lau. Both are moist with a lot of flavor and portion wise, fine enough for me...but DANG THE RICE..it was more like 2 shovels than 2 scoops of rice! I hardly eat rice as it is so there was plenty left that got wasted.  Now I remember why I hardly am here anymore.  Not trying to come off as a health nut, but dietary wise too much starches, not enough veggies.  Ahh no worries I'll just shake it off in Hot Hula Fitness classes at the gym.   Ross J crew always full of Aloha. They still remember us and come out to say hi. Atmosphere here is pretty laid back. I can show up sans no makeup, crazy hair wearing slippahs in the winter and no one gives me stink eye.   The place is clean, it's been through couple changes throughout the years. Gone is the awesome mural they had at the original location.  The booths in dining area had blue seating with the surf scene on it. It's now red  hibiscus flowers.  But for going on fifteen years here in Henderson this place still gots the island flavor!

I've eaten here a few times already and I really enjoy this place.   The 2 older ladies working the counter (their names slip my mind) are so sweet and welcoming. Very True to the Hawaiian lifestyle. There is a huge menu to choose from, so make sure you aren't in the way of other people who know what they want already. Food comes out quickly with a friendly smile. And while you are enjoying your food, they check on you to see if you're doing ok.   I always order the same thing; Portuguese sausage, eggs and rice with a side of kimchee. The portions aren't on the enormous side but are enough to get you full. I'm sure the other items are just as delicious. Well this just gives me a reason to keep coming back.

Dvb7gWsiiIOLHyIxXFJ0Qw.text: Ross J's Hawaiian Barbecue is where the ninth island meets the sunset and mountain Vista. Las Vegas is referred to as the ninth island. The Las Vegas valley is interspersed with outstanding restaurants serving Hawaiin barbecue. At the northwest corner of Sunset Road and Mountain Vista Boulevard in the Smith's - Galaxy Theater anchored shopping center, Ross J's Hawaiian Barbecue has built a reputation for their plate lunch Hawaiin barbecue dishes.      A plate lunch consists of two scoops of rice (usually white), macaroni salad, and an entree. The plate lunch tradition dates back to the 1800s when the Plantation workers sustained on leftover rice with food such as canned meat, teriyaki, and cold meat. In 1999, L&L made the plate lunch popular on the mainland. In 2015, I developed a taste for the plate lunch thanks to L&L Hawaiian Barbecue. It is this taste for Hawaiian barbecue that has led me into Ross J's a few times recently.       Everytime that I stepped inside, it has been abuzz with people. Ross J's obviously has a good name in the valley.       In contrast to L&L and Island Flavor, the Ross J's system is different. Here you order the food and pay. From the point that you pick up your beverage cup, you seat yourself and they deliver the food to your table. Plus they will bus your table. The delicious food that they deliver to your table is presented on a plate instead of a styraphon box. Every table features condiments that include chili sauce, soy sauce, Sriracha sauce, salt, and pepper.       The restaurant itself is nothing beautiful. The shopping center could use a remodel. The restaurant interior with its sufficient seating is ordinary. Many times in life it's not the beauty on the outside that counts but the beauty on the inside that counts. The beautiful taste of the abundant portions of good food is what counts with me.       On my first visit, I enjoyed the mixed plate. In plate lunch terminology a mixed plate is a plate lunch with more than one entree. This mixed plate featured teriyaki steak, chicken, Machi, lots of white rice, and macaroni salad. I enjoyed it so much that I'd return to Ross J's a second time. This time I experienced the mochiko chicken plate lunch. Six pieces of chicken occupied a good portion of the plate, white rice nearly half, and macaroni salad a quarter of it. Following this visit, some of my Yelp friends boasted about how great the Spicy Korean chicken was. In Yelp friends I trust, and made a third visit for the spicy Korean chicken. These Yelp friends were right on the mark because the spicy chicken with some Sriracha sauce over it was my favorite.       Ross J's Hawaiian Barbecue lives up to its name. I see myself returning, especially since I frequently shop at Smith's. The next time I will most likely take out a plate lunch to enjoy across the street in the Ethal M Cactus Gardens. Before I return I give Ross J's Hawaiian Barbecue my stamp of approval with this four star rating.

drqeL-_zv8dhKHUiDohU7w.text: The best hawaiin  food in townPrice is very reasonable and big serving and quality/quantity never change! More than 10yrs price ddnt change maybe some cents but still. Hope they can open up some other locations. Thanks for keeping up a great consistent service.

WUSNG1nakObHQ-8ch0v4EA.text: Broke the diet today and went to Aloha Grill.  Best loco moco and spam mud I in town.  I always order extra gravy on the side, since they give you so much rice.  Spam musabushi, was delicious, spam was grilled crispy on top and moist in the middle.  Crispy but tender nori (seafood) wrapper,  I put tobasco sauce in the extra gravy and dunk the musubi in it Delicious!

UNxx1Pzz8gQwH3jXgYSrVg.text: ***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 90/100***  We used to live in the apartments nearby, many moons ago and have seen this particular space cycled into different restaurants. For the past couple of years it's been home to Ross J's. If I had my way, I would come here everyday but alas, we reside in the other side of the valley now.  We wanted Hawaiian food when we woke up Saturday morning and was debating on either going to their California Hotel location or Henderson, the latter was decided on as we remembered the HI vs UNLV game was this weekend and most likely downtown would be insanely busy. I like coming here better anyway, it's more laidback.   Hubby opted for the breakfast fare: Hawaiian fried rice, eggs and Portuguese sausage. I was jonesing for a fix of their Spicy Korean chicken, man was it good! With just the right amount of heat for my liking, so flavorful and moist and the crispy skin just puts it over the top. They have the best Spicy Korean chicken in town imho! Kids shared a Chicken Katsu plate as their portions are so large. Everything was on point! Prices are very affordable, would definitely be willing to pay a couple dollars more for the quality and portions we get. Weekends can get pretty busy and there might be a little wait here and there but believe me, it's WORTH it! Don't forget to grab a bag of their delicious cookies by the register for dessert $5 a bag ;)
