ESNdQlXTQFy7WsfsNrSeEA.text: First time to Ross J's Aloha grill and it was mid day the placed was packed and the staff are very friendly and courteous they have a full menu I order the beef stew and omg the meat was so tendard right on point my wife order the saimen she was very pleased for its flavor and  we will be a returned customers we highly recommend this place.

LzhWZ9mB7s1Q6yXTrfyaFw.text: Obsessed with Ross J's! The food is amazing and such a great value! My go-to is the mini Katsu plate with  Teriyaki sauce on the side for the rice, but everything is really good.   I've been going to this family owned restaurant for years and everyone I introduce this place to loves it as well! I used to live nearby and go weekly, but now I live 30 minutes, so only can make the trip once or twice a month. Best Hawaiian food and nothing compares to the price or value!

yj-RXdjrQZb4wsbz82_oaQ.text: i dont come here as often as id like but when i do, it always reminds me of home and the plates are always fulfilling. definitely would recommend this place !

-v3sgcBYUHI6skY1aD431w.text: One dish I will keep coming back for is the spicy Korean chicken bowl w/ a side of onions and mushrooms. The portions are huge and they really hook you up with the white rice.  Even though the dish is already spicy and seasoned well, some sriracha sauce puts it over the top!   This place would be #3 in my top 5 Hawaiian food places in the Las Vegas/Henderson area. In Henderson, it's #1.  I love the vibe here, so laid back and the workers are always nice and accommodating. There are plenty of items on the menu including all the classic Hawaiian favorites like teriyaki bowls, loco mocos, kalua pig, and saimin. I never seem to have a chance to really try anything else because I always want the spicy Korean chicken!  We have used them for catering years ago.  Ordered a tray of the chicken katsu and it was really good.

nsTy35v2VdfQqdSAMJMfjw.text: I came here after an awesome morning hiking Mount Charleston. I heard that they had the best Loco Moco in Las Vegas and so I added thirty minutes to my commute home by driving across town to test this claim. I was going to dine in, but then I saw it. Spam Musubi. I love spam musubi. I really really want to give Ross J's five stars for their spam musubi alone, but I wasn't as thrilled with my entire meal experience. Let me explain.   I was so overwhelmed by the menu and also starving that I decided to order several entrees and two spam musubis, just for me. I ordered the Loco Moco for myself and decided to fib to the super friendly girl taking my order and say that I had a friend who wanted me to surprise "him" with a meal. Why I decided to fib is beyond me and why I selected to label said imaginary friend male is also beyond me. I have no shame in eating two meals. None. But in that moment, I shamed myself. Brene Brown would have been very disappointed in me.  I added the Ross J special to my order and an extra side of Mac Salad. They were super proactive and offered to poke holes in the to-go boxes as not to let them get all steamy. I ate one spam musubi on my way home. The spam was browned and crisped to perfection. The rice was warm and tender. The seaweed easy to bite through. Heaven. I nibbled on the white fish that was part of the Ross J combo. It was a little eggy and tough in some bites. The flavor was good and the tarter sauce was packed with citrus. The combo also had the most magically crispy exterior. The chicken was juicy. Yum. What lost me through was the beef. It was chewy and hard to eat.   I dove into the loco moco when I got home. The beef patty was a bit overcooked, and since they pack the rice mile high, it really needed extra gravy. *note for next time* I'm going to blame the 25 minute commute back home on the overcooked patty, so I want to try it again to be sure. The mac salad was a bit too heavy on the mayo for my liking and not my favorite thing I ate there either.  I'm so in love with that Spam Musubi though. I think when I get married someday, I'm totally going to have them make me a spam musubi "cake".  Even weeks later, I'm still full from this experience. All for less than $30. That's a win.

AyfiUsvKwUON06inC5Q-tQ.text: Great place to grab food to fill you up when on a budget always a go to. Between checks.

b-aFFr8FLDDmz2E8e33M1g.text: The food here is so good! Out of all the Hawaiian food spots here in Vegas, this place definitely takes the cake. All my buddies who are also from the islands also puts this place on the top of their list. Although, it can be hot in the restaurant during the day time of the summer, maybe an upgrade to the a/c? Other then that, amazing!

34vo6itOyZ7f69tmtfip7Q.text: Place is amazing. Family oriented and their chicken bowls are only 3$ but fits a whole to go plate. Better than ANY Hawaiian grill here

kbDoibSULV-9TrahcT-jCw.text: Why hadn't I been to this spot before today? Idk but I'll definitely be back. Got the chicken and gravy rice bowl for lunch for a whopping $3.75 and it was delicious! Such a huge plate, I could barely finish half of it. Next time I'll add the mixed veggies for $1.50 to give it more variety, but what I got was definitely food coma worthy. They were super swamped with big orders for lunch with the two girls up front running around like crazy chickens. They kept up though and service was fast and great! Maybe an extra body to help during the lunch rush, but other than that, absolutely onolicious.

DWb9KBJwbV2Ta2lejr3yjA.text: Spicy chicken bowl = cheap and delicious! Open one on the northwest! Great prices, large portions, spacious restaurant, lots of menu options!

mIn851OyvSTy3OEpkGWd1Q.text: I went here for breakfast and it was the place to be apparently. It was super busy! They had egg roll and breakfast specials which the lady at the counter informed us if we wanted to order the special. Since it's my first time, I definitely tried the egg rolls and rice with kalbi. At any other restaurant, rice is always 1 cup and I always end up purchasing extra rice but not at this place my whole plate was filled and I could hardly finish my meal. Also, coffee was good and the server was very friendly. The bathroom need wall touch up with paint but it was definitely clean and it smells great.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

mImskmtOvkyYC3ZdIjZRJg.text: Love the food here! The food is always fresh and they are very friendly. The deliciousness of the authentic Hawaiian good is yummy.

WHx4oZ1OJLrlFjCvOYty4A.text: My boyfriend wanted to try this place out since he's heard so much great things from his boss. We came here on a Monday night and it wasn't too busy. I noticed right away a few tables were not cleaned with plates still sitting there.  I ordered the Chicken Katsu and it was the worst I've ever had. It was so plain, no taste at all...  I only took 4 bites and said no more. We also ordered a side of lumpia and that wasn't too bad. My boyfriend ordered a mix plate that came with fried chicken, beef, and spam and he enjoyed his food very much. He gave me some of his and it definitely had more flavor than what I ordered.  Not sure if I'll come here again but if I do I won't be getting the Chicken Katsu.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu

JZbBkwvalif_2GWhDxpTXA.text: Been here a couple times now for my Hawaiian fix. Pretty good value, less than 10 bucks for the combo plate with mahi, fried chicken and teriyaki steak and spam. Lots of rice unfortunately, not enough sauce. Place could use a bit of a cleanup slash remodel, feels a little dusty and dinerish. Friendly service. Overall, not bad, not great. 3.5/5

DiaQ9obzHPuMupWmKCPHpQ.text: Ross J's special with fried rice is great. . The  fried chicken is amazing. Will come back

9ssl96I7sYKe8Gy4_ILAdQ.text: RJ's Just like da kind you can get on the Islands.  Lots of hawaii style local food, katsu, loco moco, span, meat jun, korean spicy chicken, saimen, musubi, teri bowls, etc.  If you are a big eater and want lots of ono island-style food for good price, RJ's is the place. I am getting too old for this so I gotta stick with a bowl with extra veggies or a bowl of saimen.  The combos are too much.    Service is quick and friendly.  This is old school place.  It's the kind of place you find in Honolulu even though it is Henderson, NV.

WCDq9dkeJqBG_pAVGOxl_A.text: This is one of the very rare mom and pop shops that Vegas locals should all know about. They have wonderful food and it's very affordable. They have the perfect serving sizes! Me and my boyfriend always pick Ross J's over the chain Restaurants(aloha kitchen, l&l, etc)! Definitely recommend this place! Sucks that this place is so far though and not very central. Other than that, this place is awesome :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Combo Bowl w/ Spicy Chicken

eOKMSetOTRWxnQGuWrJ08g.text: So, I was a regular at this place. This post has nothing to do with quality of food, but everything to do with mannerism and customer service. I went to lunch today with my buddy and ordered hamburger patty Loco moco and one to go for my husband. I can't consume large quantities of food at one time so I decided to get a to go container for mine. My husband's food was in a plastic bag and mines was sitting under his. When I left, I only grabbed the bag leaving my food by accident. Now, I can deal with them just say there was nothing they could do to replace it, but to go as far as saying "if you want us to get it out of the trash for you we will!" I found that statement insulting and disrespectful. My thoughts are,  if you talk to people that way that spend their hard earned money at your establishment really says a lot about how you feel about your customers. I will never eat here again. I never was disrespectful to them, all I asked is "was there anyway they could replace it or maybe discount it, or I'll pay for a smaller portion. Mind you they said they kept it 20 minutes. I don't even live 20 minutes away.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States

DttiGqGnxXO_iH-ialak3Q.text: Every time we come to Henderson, this is the place to come for Hawaiian plate lunches. Ono delicious

b-maN-HMnYToEzimECIzvg.text: Awesome food at a great price!   We thought that the portions would be small based on the price.  Wrong! The spicy Korean chicken bowl was filled with delicious crunchy sweet chicken. The sauce was a perfect compliment with the fresh vegetables.  The roast pork was served with a very flavorful gravy over rice with a small serving of macaroni salad.  We were so full that we didn't get to the fried noodles.   Took them home for a late night snack! We live across town but will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Fried noodles
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean chicken bowl with vegetables. Delicious!

fPNSMjo5cFZpLDkrJbQY0A.text: Good food and good service. I saw the reviews so I came specifically to try the spicy Korean chicken.  I also got the macaroni salad and span musubi as well.   While the chicken is yummy it doesn't make me think of Korean flavors at all but that didn't bother me it was the amount of salt used on the chicken. I didn't get rice so that probably made it worse.    Their Mac salad is divine and they fry the spam for their musubi which many places don't do. I would come back just for those two.

ylaI3I-1CY_XXXYKApTiJw.text: The food here is excellent. I've been here at least a dozen times and I try to order something I haven't tried yet every time. It's usually packed here around dinner time so you may have to wait a good 15-20 minutes to place an order, but its well worth the wait. My favorite dish is the garlic chicken with gravy. If you like authentic Hawaiian mixed plate type food. This is the spot! A big 5 for Ross J's!!

to95MHEW47p4LKygu_YxrQ.text: I love this place! Have been going here for more than 5 years and after I moved I always make sure to visit! My favorite is the classic of a teriyaki bowl. The Mac salad here is one of my favorites where it's just the right amount of sweet and flavorful! The con about this place is that it is pretty small and only have a few employees working so it takes awhile for food and to order. However I'm glad the business is booming because they deserve it!

UzK2Pamkg_zZrogd9lg9tg.text: First of all, this place is CHEAP.  You can get a whole lotta diabetes for not a lot of money.    Example: Mix plate = Huge filet of breaded chicken, huge filet of breaded mahi mahi, huge portion of Teriyaki beef, approximately 1 pound of cooked, white rice, and mac salad.  All this for $6.95.  INSANE.  Second, big, big selection.  They really do have something for everyone.  And, and, they have my beloved Lau Lau on Fridays (Hawaiian plate, what what).  Third, it's always packed with Hawaiians.  I feel that my presence is probably bringing down their rep, but, whatevs.  I want the diabetes too!  Overall, good Hawaiian spot.  Leftovers for days.  Win.

VF_Dsfi97z-Ze5R5GMiBcA.text: You like grind cuz? If so, this is the spot. Never left this place hungry. In my opinion, best Hawaiian joint in Las Vegas. Awesome staff too. Every time I come here, I feel as if I'm eating at my Aunty's house.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Combo plate spicy korean chicken and roast pork with bacon fried rice. Cheee.

yVDfWNfFustrSgrz8VfBDg.text: I have been going to this place for at least 10 years. I am sorry it took me so long to Yelp it, shame on me.  This place is a little hole in the wall and amazing. You know you are in the right place when you are the only Non Hawaiian in there.   I always get the same thing. Poke, its only on the menu on  Friday and its really delicious. The mac salad is done right too.   I learned some Hawaiian slang too. if its good, you say "it broke da mouf! and this place definitely broke my mouf!

HbzDUTKgK2OWQHD0JgQeUw.text: I've been coming here for a while since it's by my school. I like it, it's well priced and pretty tasty. However, I got food poisoning the last time I was here. This is actually not the first time I've heard of this from Ross J. I'm probably never coming back here ever again.

Ry1teKnq0znyqRmBs3GarA.text: Reasonable price for a whole lotta food! Their Ross J special is the size of a bento on steroids! Definitely my go to for local hawaiian food.  Their spicy korean chicken and meat jun is soooooo good.

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Combination spicy korean chicken  and meat jun with a side of kimchee
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Beef stew with macaroni salad

FBmGvB2n4jnhQauDai6xnw.text: I love coming here. It's very family orientated and my girls love the musubis. It can get pretty packed but for good reason (it's good food)...i had to change my rating down since the customer service is kind of going down hill...i walked up to the register and instead of a "hello"..they said "its going to be a 30 minute wait"...all I wanted was 3 musubis for my girls

wtVMPw05U5bARphOBcUw6Q.text: I love this place! One of the best authentic Hawaiian dishes in Las Vegas.  Staff is super friendly.   On top of their regular menu they also have daily specials.  You never know what dish they will have available for these specials so its always good to visit frequently.  If your craving Hawaiian food this is the place to go!!!   Be cautious if you are trying to take your lunch break and only have 30 minutes as they get really busy around noon.  I've seen the line as long as out the door.  My advice is to go prior to 12p.

HzkN83GOfP7R2pkU8_X_7A.text: Loved this place! Super cheap, fast and friendly. Highly recommend the spicy Korean bbq chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Side of Teriyaki beef
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Korean BBQ chicken! Delicious
Photo of Ross J's Aloha Grill - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam musibi

yCXxoc9xpNevqPXQsaEFxw.text: I have been eating at Ross J's since they were in the the other place on the other side of Sunset.   The menu offers many different choices at a great price.  There is also a daily special menu that is on the wall behind the cashier.  Be sure to take a look before you order.  Lunch time is very busy but the food is served quickly.  After sampling many different things on the menu over the years, my absolute favorite is the Spicy Korean Chicken, chopped up and extra crispy.  The plate comes with rice and mac salad.  Another favorite that is reserved for the winter time is the wonton soup. The wonton's are homemade and simply amazing.  On Friday's they serve Poke which again is simply amazing!  Aloha!

qD9NY1YqihfI22WLgaQbsg.text: This place SUCKS. The first time I went I got the chicken katsu and it was horrible. I went another time thinking that maybe if I just got some won ton min, they couldn't f*** that up. Not only did they get my order wrong, but they decided to fix it while my husband's order of food was getting cold.

ntV-6Fmn4hVW6-q01JBWXA.text: I love your food but really can you post a better Menu, not a picture of the board in your restaurant. Great place to eat local Hawaiian food. They give you a nice portion size and always feel full when you leave! Keep up the great service!

bkImuPsoYQbp40lRGkq98Q.text: DELICIOUS!!!!! Thanks to yelp we decided to try this place while in the area..... THANK YOU YELP!!!! We were NOT disappointed. The place was so busy there was one booth left! It took a while for our good to arrive because they were so busy but, it was definitely worth the wait!!

5bd6L4b2Qwq8wfcMdN_8pg.text: Wow! I was really impressed with this whole in the wall. I heard from a few friends how good this place was but didn't get a chance to try until today. I ordered the spicy korean chicken with mushroom and onions. It was far beyond excellent.  I saw a gentlemen order the samw thing but instead of white rice he got fried rice. I guess I'll have to come back to give that a try.  But for now, this place earns a 5 star from me!

jftA9m2u5NDXrt25Awtgeg.text: Being from Hawaii, I have those cravings for some Hawaiian comfort food and Ross J's is where I go to. They have the best tasting meat jun plate for around $8. My favorites are the Ross J's special pack (mani, teri chicken, teri beef, and spam) for around $9. You can easily share the special with someone and you got some cheap grindz. I always like to get a side order of mix vegetables as portion sizes here are pretty huge when it comes to meat and white rice.

x9TvAR6tR4sP7e3HDwxf1g.text: I first of all want to say that if i wasn't waiting on friends I would've just left. I wanted fried noodles that was on the menu for $5.75 but because I wanted certain things and not others they upcharged everything. Instead I paid $10.27. Re-dick-you-less! I would rate a ZERO

Ncylf2rLN3hBHYxlTFsbVQ.text: Great service, really nice staff, I had the chicken teriyaki bowl and it was great! Lots of food for a great price! Would recommend to anyone that likes hearty food at a great price.

gcIVf2ENhq0xEJQelaiD9A.text: Cheap and delicious food. The loco moco is really good, if you get spicy Korean chicken, get some mushroom in it too. They also give you a big portion of rice and food so I get the mene plates because it is really filling.

KHQhu6B4OpjYHRjp8TK1lQ.text: I've been back a few times since my first try, and I've gotta say that I must've found the one thing on the menu that's not good for some reason. I think I've had the spam loco moco, the less expensive teriyaki pork dish, and the spicy Korean chicken bowl since then. The latter is probably the best option, and it's truly not that spicy. I remember really enjoying the small side of macaroni salad that came with the teriyaki pork. There's actually no need to get the $7+ stuff unless you're really hungry or splitting a dish with someone! So yeah, come here and skip the portuguese sausage moco loco, imo, and you'll have a great meal.

i2CwjEwUdL4omUL5hAY5kA.text: If you like Hawaiian food this is one of the best places in town.  Large portions, great price, Fridays they have specials - Lau Lau!!!!   The Spicy Korean is another must try - dont forget the punch.

LKJoy3mZr7sBJNTKYWDj-Q.text: Fantastic food and service here. I ordered a combo plate with teriyaki beef and chicken. They were out of lumpia, so if you are looking for that call ahead as they said they run out quickly!

0utSRQtmLixiT6N7ChM5PQ.text: I remember going to Ross J's years ago prior to its relocation and it was extremely tasty from what I had remembered.  I recently went here for brunch and was just truly disappointed:  Ordered:   Garlic Chicken and Teriyaki Chicken Bowl with Mushrooms and Veggies  Pros:  * Huge portions.  So large you can even share  *  Very friendly service  *  Decently priced  Cons:   * Both the Garlic Chicken and Teri Bowl were very bland (and I mean VERY bland)   * Slow service.  It was very busy and the cashier was also the same person delivering the food to the tables  Overall:   I hate giving low scores.  This place was real busy and seems to be a local fav, but I was just disappointed with my order.  The service, price, and portions were all a plus but the food itself was a thumbs down for me.

F_zlfH36Gag9td08Prij-g.text: Been coming here for years! Their spicy korean chicken plate is the best. I don't live anywhere near here but it's definitely worth the drive.

yb8c67NdNXLXs_mHkgc80w.text: I give this place a one star because we used to eat here a lot. But got this disappointed cause we wanted to dine in and they 50 min left n the lady cashier told us that we can only take it to go cause they already full when there is so many open table. Very disaappointed

6le0J9mBszq8OoaDODTcBg.text: Never disappointed eating here. Friendly service, hot and fantastic tasting food.  I especially like the spicy chicken bowl.  You can have it with a fountain drink for under $6, what a bargain. I want to try their breakfast one day.

aGxhZAgtLaGbW3pFsr5JEQ.text: This is real deal Hawaiian period. Was in town. Tired of casino food. Wanted away from the strip. So me and my lady hit Roy J's. I had the Aloha Bento plate and she had the Teriyaki Combo. We shared some fruit punch. Everything was killer. The only problem is now when I go home I won't be able to find Hawaiian this good.

ACBPNbc929agoyW1AXykKQ.text: I love this place. When you think of a Hawaiian BBQ kind of place, I'm sure L&L might come into mind at first, but once you try Ross J's, your Hawaiian food referral is switched.   Starting off with their service, the staff is friendly and gives off their local Hawaiian feel. (I'm from HI myself) I love the locals service. They're all very welcoming and patient, especially when their lines are longer. However, I feel they're somewhat under-staffed during certain shifts.   I've eaten here about 4 times and I cannot get enough of the garlic chicken with gravy... What I love is that the gravy isn't too salty, so the flavor of the chicken is what you're tasting with the compliment of gravy. I did try their loco moco, just because my boyfriend ordered the garlic chicken already. Their pork patty to eggs to rice ratio is right on the dot.   The seating is limited depending on the hour of your visit.  If you're dining in, they serve your entree on large plates. Overall, all visits were worth the drive and money. Youre leaving with a happy stomach :)

jWU4fVC-tXdgDWPKStfOKg.text: Amazing service from a family owned restaurant, and they really do put love and value into their dishes! I love the meat bowls, and the spam-misubi is the bomb!! Get there soon for a good value!

vpD5jXJYp6s9gKbAwt_OAw.text: My husband and I have been going to Aloha Specialties at the Cal for like 20 years. We were at his dad's house on this side of town so we checked it out. We were all very pleased and glad to know we can get great food without dealing with the weekend crowds downtown. Keep up the great work and wonderful food!

AinIgW7GNWtPM1T1XiRcHw.text: Forget all the other so-called Hawaiian plate lunch places, all you need to know is Ross J's Aloha Grill! Large menu selection with local favorites and served with Aloha by actual Hawaii guys. We were warmly greeted walking in and also when leaving with our delicious assortment of musubi, lumpia, and plate lunches. Food was really good, rice and meats cooked to perfection, no dry rice here. My only regret is that we found this place on our last day in Vegas, at least we have spam and Portuguese sausage musubi for our long drive to Oregon :)

wL6Qt03v8LNNORar77113w.text: I had the chicken tofu plate which is delicious here just like at Aloha Specialties..... However if there's one thing I can't stand, especially when eating local food, is soggy ass rice.  Zero stars for rice but four stars for chicken tofu and the excellent way they packed my to go order.

AIPc0KumlJK0aDDOtyE1JA.text: Their were only one person working on the cashier register. It took ten mins for me to finally get in the register for her to ring out my order but before i order it took another 5mins because  she decide to pick up the phone order ignore me. I ask for loco moco with over easy eggs. When i got home the eggs wasn't what i order. I wasnt happy about my experiences.
